examples.en: The tea turned draffier after it sat too long with the leaves.
examples.zh: 茶叶泡得太久后，这杯茶变得更“渣”了。

extraExplanation: “draff”原指酿酒或蒸馏后留下的酒糟/谷物残渣，在苏格兰英语中很常见；“draffy”表示“带酒糟的、渣多的”，所以“draffier”就是“更渣、残渣更多”。这个词比较少见，更常见的表达是“more sediment/with more dregs/with more residue”。

summary.en: “Draffiest” means “the most trashy/low-quality,” the superlative form of “draffy.”
summary.zh: “draffiest”意为“最粗俗/最低劣、最像糟粕的”，是“draffy”的最高级。

definition.en: Superlative of “draffy”: the most full of worthless or low-quality material; the most trashy or crude.
definition.zh: “draffy”的最高级：最充满无价值/低劣内容的；最粗俗、最“垃圾”的。

examples.en: That was the draffiest article on the website—mostly rumors and clickbait.
examples.zh: 那是网站上最“垃圾”的文章——基本都是谣言和标题党。

examples.en: Among all his jokes, that one was the draffiest and made everyone uncomfortable.
examples.zh: 在他所有笑话里，那一个最粗俗，弄得大家都很尴尬。

extraExplanation: “draff”原指酿酒或蒸馏后剩下的谷渣、糟粕（常用来喂牲畜），因此引申出“无用的残渣、废话、低劣之物”的含义；“draffy / draffiest”就是“像糟粕一样的、充斥糟粕的”。
这个词比较少见，带有强烈的贬义色彩。日常更常用的替代说法包括：“trashy / the trashiest”“the worst”“the most low-quality”。使用时注意语气可能显得很刻薄。

summary.en: “Draffin” is usually a rare name (surname) or an informal spelling that represents “drafting” in casual speech; it is not a common standard English word.
summary.zh: “Draffin”通常是少见的人名/姓氏，或表示口语里“drafting”的非正式拼写；它不是常见的标准英文单词。

definition.en: A rare proper name (usually a surname). It is not a standard common English vocabulary word.
definition.zh: 一个较少见的专有名词（通常作姓氏）。“Draffin”不是常见的标准英文词汇。

examples.en: Dr. Draffin will lead the research team this year.
examples.zh: Draffin 博士今年将带领研究团队。

examples.en: I met Ms. Draffin at the conference.
examples.zh: 我在会议上认识了 Draffin 女士。

definition.en: Informal spelling that may represent a pronunciation of “drafting” (dropping the final -g) in casual speech or in some dialect writing.
definition.zh: 一种非正式拼写，可能用来表示口语里“drafting”（把结尾的 -g 省掉）的发音，常见于随意对话或方言式写法。

examples.en: He’s draffin’ a new design for the poster.
examples.zh: 他正在给海报起草/绘制一个新设计。

examples.en: I was just draffin’ an email when you called.
examples.zh: 你打来电话时我正要起草一封邮件。

extraExplanation:
“Draffin”在常用词典里不太作为正规拼写出现。如果你是在作业、简历或正式写作中看到它，很可能是：
1）人名/姓氏；或
2）把“drafting”用口语方式写出来（draffin’）。

如果你想查的是“drafting”，它常见意思包括：起草（文件/邮件）或制图/绘图（工程制图、设计草图）。你也可以告诉我你看到“Draffin”的句子，我可以帮你判断具体意思。

summary.en: A rare adjective meaning “dreggy; made of waste; low-quality or shabby.”
summary.zh: 一个很少见的形容词，表示“像渣滓的；由残渣构成的；低劣或粗糙的”。

definition.en: (Rare) Like dregs or waste; made of or full of leftover, low‑quality matter; worthless or shabby.
definition.zh: （罕见）像渣滓/残渣一样的；由低劣的剩余物构成或充满残渣的；无价值的、粗劣的。

examples.en: The soup tasted draffish, as if it had been reheated too many times.
examples.zh: 这汤喝起来很“渣”，像是反复加热了很多次。

examples.en: He tossed the draffish scraps into the bin and started fresh.
examples.zh: 他把那些低劣的残渣扔进垃圾桶，重新开始。

extraExplanation: “draffish”来源于名词“draff”（酿酒或制麦后剩下的糟渣、饲料残渣）加上形容词后缀“-ish”，表示“有点……的/像……的”。这个词在现代英语中非常少见，更常用的替代表达有“shabby / worthless / dreggy / full of dregs”。
语感上它带有轻微的贬义，常用于描写食物、酒、材料或作品“像残渣一样粗劣”。在正式写作里更建议用更常见的词来避免读者不熟悉。

summary.en: Draffman is an old/regional word for someone who handles draff (spent grain from brewing/distilling), often taking it away for animal feed.
summary.zh: Draffman 是较旧或地方性的说法，指处理“酒糟/麦糟”（酿造或蒸馏后的谷物渣）的人，常把它运走作饲料。

definition.en: a person who handles or collects draff (the leftover grain after brewing or distilling), often for animal feed; an old or regional (especially Scottish) term
definition.zh: （尤指苏格兰旧称/方言）处理或收集“酒糟/麦糟”（酿造或蒸馏后剩余谷物渣）的人，常把酒糟用作饲料

examples.en: The brewery hired a draffman to cart away the spent grain for local farms.
examples.zh: 啤酒厂雇了个处理酒糟的人，把麦糟运走送到附近农场。

examples.en: In older Scottish writing, a draffman might be mentioned working near a distillery.
examples.zh: 在较早的苏格兰文字里，有时会提到酒厂附近干活的“draffman”。

extraExplanation: “Draff”指酿酒/蒸馏后剩下的谷物渣（类似“酒糟、麦糟”），传统上常被拿去喂牛羊。Draffman 这一说法比较少见，带有旧时代、地方职业称呼的味道。现代更常说 “spent grain” 或 “brewery worker/handler”。

summary.en: “Draffs” means the leftover residue from brewing (spent grains), and figuratively it can mean dregs or worthless leftovers.
summary.zh: “Draffs”指酿造后的酒糟/麦糟等残渣；引申义可指“渣滓、无用的剩余物”。

definition.en: The leftover grains and other residue from brewing or distilling (often used as animal feed). Usually seen in the plural: “draffs.”
definition.zh: （酿造或蒸馏后剩下的）酒糟、麦糟等残渣（常作复数 draffs，可用作饲料）。

examples.en: After the beer was made, the farmer collected the draffs to feed the pigs.
examples.zh: 啤酒酿好后，农夫把酒糟收起来喂猪。

examples.en: The distillery gives its draffs to nearby farms.
examples.zh: 那家酒厂把酒糟送给附近的农场。

definition.en: Dregs; worthless or unwanted leftovers (figurative).
definition.zh: （比喻）渣滓、残余物；没用的东西。

examples.en: He felt he was being offered only the draffs—nothing fresh or valuable.
examples.zh: 他觉得对方给他的只是些“残渣”——没有新鲜或有价值的东西。

examples.en: They searched for hope in the draffs of a failed plan.
examples.zh: 他们在失败计划的残余中寻找一丝希望。

extraExplanation: “Draff / draffs”在英式英语、苏格兰英语里更常见，和啤酒、威士忌等酿造文化关系很深；在美式英语中更常见的对应词是“spent grain(s)”（用过的麦芽/酒糟）或“dregs”（沉淀/渣滓，偏比喻或饮料底部残渣）。

summary.en: A bag used to hold draff—wet spent grains left from brewing/distilling, often saved as animal feed.
summary.zh: 装酒糟（酿酒/蒸馏后的湿谷物渣）的袋子，常留作动物饲料。

definition.en: a sack or bag used to hold draff (the wet grains left after brewing or distilling), often kept for animal feed
definition.zh: 酒糟袋；装酒糟（酿酒或蒸馏后剩下的湿谷物渣）的袋子，常用作牲畜饲料

examples.en: After brewing, they shoveled the spent grain into a draffsack for the cattle.
examples.zh: 酿完酒后，他们把麦渣铲进酒糟袋，留给牛吃。

examples.en: The old draffsack smelled of malt and damp barley.
examples.zh: 那只旧酒糟袋有股麦芽和潮湿大麦的味道。

extraExplanation: “draff”常见于苏格兰英语，指酿酒/蒸馏后的谷物残渣（类似“spent grain”），传统上会喂猪、牛等；因此“draffsack”多出现在乡村、农场或与威士忌/啤酒酿造相关的语境中。
这个词比较方言化、地域性强；在现代标准英语里更常见的说法是“bag of spent grain”或直接说“a sack of draff”。

summary.en: “Draffy” means full of dregs/waste or, figuratively, low-quality and unpleasant.
summary.zh: “draffy”指“多渣滓/像残渣的”，也可引申为“粗劣、很烂的”。

definition.en: Full of dregs or waste; resembling the leftover grains or refuse ("draff").
definition.zh: 充满渣滓或废料的；像“糟粕/残渣”（draff）的。

examples.en: The draffy smell from the brewery hung in the air.
examples.zh: 酿酒厂飘出一股带着酒糟味的气味。

examples.en: After cooking, the pot was left with a draffy layer stuck to the bottom.
examples.zh: 煮完后，锅底留下了一层渣状的东西粘着。

definition.en: (Figurative, informal) Low-quality, unpleasant, or “trashy.”
definition.zh: （比喻/非正式）低劣的、令人不快的；“很垃圾”的。

examples.en: We ended up watching a draffy movie that wasn’t worth the time.
examples.zh: 我们最后看了一部很烂的电影，不值得花时间。

examples.en: He complained about the draffy service at that restaurant.
examples.zh: 他抱怨那家餐厅的服务很差。

extraExplanation: “draffy”是一个比较少见的形容词，来自“draff”（酒糟、残渣、废料），在苏格兰英语里更常见。它既可字面形容“有渣/像糟粕”，也可引申为“粗劣、没品质”。日常英语里更常用的替代词有：gritty（带砂砾感的）、dreggy（多渣的）、trashy（很烂的）。

summary.en: Draft most commonly means a rough first version you plan to revise; it can also mean to prepare that version, a military conscription system, or a current of air.
summary.zh: Draft 最常见指“草稿/初稿”（之后会修改）；也可指“起草”、美国语境中的“征兵制”，或“气流/漏风”。

definition.en: a first rough version of a piece of writing, plan, or document, which you will likely change and improve later
definition.zh: （文章、计划或文件的）草稿；初稿（通常还会再修改完善）

examples.en: I wrote a draft of my essay and then revised it twice.
examples.zh: 我写了作文的初稿，然后又修改了两遍。

examples.en: Can you send me the draft by Friday?
examples.zh: 你能在周五前把草稿发给我吗？

examples.en: This is only a draft—please don’t share it publicly.
examples.zh: 这只是草稿——请不要公开分享。

definition.en: to write or prepare a first version of something (especially a document or message)
definition.zh: 起草；拟定；写草稿（尤指文件或信息的初稿）

examples.en: She drafted an email to the client.
examples.zh: 她给客户起草了一封邮件。

examples.en: We need to draft a new policy for remote work.
examples.zh: 我们需要起草一项新的远程办公政策。

definition.en: the act of selecting or forcing someone to join the military or another service (conscription)
definition.zh: 征兵；征召（强制入伍或加入某种服务）

examples.en: He was eligible for the draft at 18.
examples.zh: 他18岁时符合征兵条件。

examples.en: Many people protested against the draft during the Vietnam War.
examples.zh: 越南战争期间，很多人抗议征兵制度。

definition.en: a current of air in a room, vehicle, or chimney; a flow of air
definition.zh: （室内、车内或烟囱里的）气流；穿堂风；通风

examples.en: There’s a draft coming from the window.
examples.zh: 窗户那边有风漏进来。

examples.en: Close the door—it’s drafty in here.
examples.zh: 把门关上——这里有穿堂风。

extraExplanation: 在美国英语里，draft 的“草稿”义非常常见：first draft（初稿）、final draft（定稿）。动词 draft 常用于正式写作或职场语境，如 draft a proposal（起草提案）、draft a contract（拟定合同）。
“征兵”义带有明显历史文化背景，美国常提到 the draft（征兵制），尤其与 Vietnam War（越战）相关；现代语境中也会用于讨论是否恢复征兵。
“气流/漏风”义常出现在日常生活：a drafty room（漏风的房间）。与“draft beer（生啤）”拼写相同，但含义不同：draft beer 指“桶装/龙头现打的啤酒”。

summary.en: Draftable means “able to be drafted,” most commonly “eligible to be picked in a sports draft,” and sometimes “able to be written as a draft.”
summary.zh: Draftable 指“可被选秀挑选的（最常见）”，也可指“可起草成初稿的”。

definition.en: able to be selected (drafted) into a sports league or team, usually because you are eligible and meet the requirements
definition.zh: （体育）可被选秀挑选的；有资格参加选秀的

examples.en: After one year in college, he became draftable for the NBA.
examples.zh: 读完大学一年后，他就有资格参加 NBA 选秀了。

examples.en: Not every player is draftable—some are too young or haven’t declared.
examples.zh: 不是每个球员都能参加选秀——有些人太年轻，或还没有宣布参选。

definition.en: able to be drafted (written as a first version); easy or possible to write into a draft
definition.zh: 可起草的；能写成草稿的；便于拟定初稿的

examples.en: This policy is draftable, but we still need legal review.
examples.zh: 这项政策可以先起草出来，但还需要法务审核。

examples.en: Keep your ideas simple so they’re draftable in one sitting.
examples.zh: 把想法保持简单，这样你就能一口气把初稿写出来。

extraExplanation: “draftable”来自“draft（选秀/征召；草稿/起草）+ -able（能够……的）”。在美式英语里最常见于体育语境，尤其是NBA/NFL/MLB等选秀制度下的“eligible/draftable”。写作或职场语境也会用，但更常见的表达是“easy to draft / ready to draft”。

summary.en: Draftage is an older term for a fee charged in connection with bank drafts (and, rarely, hauling by draft animals).
summary.zh: Draftage 指与汇票/银行汇票相关的手续费（较旧用法；少数情况下也指役畜拖运费用）。

definition.en: a fee or commission charged for obtaining, issuing, or paying a bank draft (a written order to pay money), especially in older financial or business use
definition.zh: （尤指旧时商贸/金融用语）办理、开具或兑付汇票/银行汇票时收取的手续费或佣金

examples.en: The bank charged a small draftage on every foreign draft.
examples.zh: 银行对每张外汇汇票都收取少量的汇票手续费（draftage）。

examples.en: They compared the exchange rate and the draftage before sending payment.
examples.zh: 他们在汇款前比较了汇率和汇票手续费（draftage）。

definition.en: (rare) the cost or charge for transport using draft animals or for hauling/pulling loads
definition.zh: （罕见）使用役畜（如马、牛）拉运货物的费用；拖运费

examples.en: The invoice included draftage for hauling the timber to town.
examples.zh: 账单里包含了把木材拉到镇上的拖运费（draftage）。

extraExplanation: 这个词在现代日常英语中很少见，更常见的说法是 bank fee / service charge / commission，或在国际汇款语境中说 remittance fee。
draftage 与 draft（汇票/汇款单）同源；在19—20世纪的贸易文件、账簿或旧合同中更容易看到。

summary.en: “Drafted” means officially chosen (often for the military or a sports team) or written as a first version (a draft).
summary.zh: “drafted”表示被正式征召/选拔（常指征兵或体育选秀），或表示已起草成初稿（草拟）。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “draft”: to choose someone officially for a group or duty (especially the military or a sports team).
definition.zh: “draft”的过去式/过去分词：正式征召/选拔某人加入某个群体或承担任务（尤指征兵或体育选秀）。

examples.en: He was drafted into the army at 19.
examples.zh: 他19岁时被征召入伍。

examples.en: She was drafted by the Chicago team in the first round.
examples.zh: 她在第一轮被芝加哥队选中（选秀）。

examples.en: During the war, many young men were drafted.
examples.zh: 战争期间，许多年轻人被征召。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “draft”: to write a first version of something (a draft), such as a document, email, or plan.
definition.zh: “draft”的过去式/过去分词：起草/拟定（文件、邮件、计划等）的初稿。

examples.en: I drafted a reply but didn’t send it yet.
examples.zh: 我起草了回复，但还没发出去。

examples.en: The lawyer drafted the contract for both sides.
examples.zh: 律师为双方起草了合同。

definition.en: Chosen or written in draft form; not final.
definition.zh: 被选中的；或处于草稿状态的、未定稿的。

examples.en: The drafted proposal still needs editing.
examples.zh: 这份草拟的提案还需要修改。

examples.en: He’s a newly drafted player.
examples.zh: 他是一名刚被选中的新秀球员。

extraExplanation: 在美国语境里，“be drafted”最常见的两类含义是：①被征兵（如越战时期的征兵制度）；②体育“选秀”中被某支球队选中（NBA/NFL等）。具体是哪一种通常要看上下文（army/war vs. team/round/pick）。
拼写小提醒：draft（美式常用）在英式英语中有时会写作 draught（如“a draught of cold air”一阵冷风；或“a draught beer”生啤），但“征兵/选秀/起草”通常仍用 draft。

summary.en: A draftee is someone chosen by a draft—most commonly for military service, and sometimes in sports drafts.
summary.zh: draftee 指通过“征召/选秀”被选中的人，最常见是被征兵入伍者，也可指体育选秀中新秀。

definition.en: a person who has been officially chosen (often by a government) to join the military; also, someone selected by a sports team in a draft
definition.zh: 被（通常由政府）征召入伍的人；也指在“选秀”中被球队选中的人

examples.en: During the war, many young men became draftees.
examples.zh: 战争期间，许多年轻人成了被征召入伍的人。

examples.en: He was a draftee and had to report for basic training.
examples.zh: 他是被征召入伍者，必须去报到参加新兵训练。

examples.en: The first-round draftee signed a contract with the team.
examples.zh: 首轮被选中的新秀与球队签了合同。

extraExplanation: “draftee”来自“draft”（征兵/选秀）。在美国语境里，最常见的是“military draft”（征兵制）相关用法；体育领域里则常指被球队在选秀（如NBA/NFL Draft）中选中的球员。
在美国历史中，“the draft”常让人联想到越南战争时期的征兵，因此“draftee”有时带有特定时代背景的社会与文化意味。

summary.en: “Draftees” are people forced or required to join the military by a government draft.
summary.zh: “draftees”指因征兵制而被征召入伍的应征者（复数）。

definition.en: people who are chosen by the government to join the military, usually because of a draft (compulsory service)
definition.zh: （因征兵制而）被政府征召入伍的人；应征者

examples.en: During the war, many young men became draftees.
examples.zh: 战争期间，许多年轻人被征召入伍。

examples.en: The training camp was filled with draftees from across the country.
examples.zh: 训练营里都是来自全国各地的应征者。

examples.en: Some draftees served for two years before returning to civilian life.
examples.zh: 一些应征者服役两年后回归平民生活。

extraExplanation: “draftee”常见于美国历史语境，尤其与越南战争时期的“draft（征兵制）”相关；当时征召入伍引发了广泛的社会讨论与反战运动。
词形：draftee（单数）→ draftees（复数）。它来自 draft（征召/征兵）。注意：draft 在美式英语里也可指“草稿”，需要靠语境判断。
近义说法：conscript（更正式/书面，常指“被征召者”）；与 volunteer（志愿兵）相对。

summary.en: A drafter is someone who creates technical drawings or who prepares official written documents.
summary.zh: drafter 指制图员（做技术图纸的人）或文件起草人（撰写正式文件的人）。

definition.en: A person who makes technical drawings or plans (especially for engineering, architecture, or manufacturing).
definition.zh: （尤指工程、建筑或制造领域的）制图员；绘图员。

examples.en: The drafter prepared detailed floor plans for the new office building.
examples.zh: 制图员为新办公楼准备了详细的平面图。

examples.en: Our drafter updated the design in CAD before the meeting.
examples.zh: 我们的制图员在会议前用 CAD 更新了设计。

definition.en: A person who writes or prepares official documents (such as laws, contracts, or formal statements).
definition.zh: （法律、合同等正式文件的）起草人；撰写人。

examples.en: A skilled drafter can make a contract clear and precise.
examples.zh: 优秀的起草人能让合同清晰严谨。

examples.en: The bill’s drafter explained the purpose of the new law.
examples.zh: 该法案的起草人解释了新法律的目的。

extraExplanation: “drafter”来自动词 draft（起草/绘制草图）。在工程与建筑领域，现代制图员常用 CAD 软件工作。
在英式或较旧的用法中，也会看到“draftsman”（传统上偏男性称呼）；现在更常用更中性的“drafter”或“draftsperson”。

summary.en: Drafters are people who prepare written drafts (like laws or contracts) or who make technical drawings; it can also mean drafting tools in technical drawing.
summary.zh: drafters 指起草文件的人或工程/建筑制图员；在制图语境中也可指制图工具。

definition.en: People who draft (write and prepare) official documents such as laws, contracts, reports, or speeches.
definition.zh: （法律、合同、报告、演讲稿等）起草者；拟稿人。

examples.en: The bill was reviewed by several drafters before it went to the committee.
examples.zh: 这项法案在提交委员会之前由几位起草者审阅。

examples.en: Experienced drafters can make legal language clearer and less ambiguous.
examples.zh: 有经验的起草者能让法律措辞更清晰、少歧义。

definition.en: People who create technical drawings or plans, especially in engineering, architecture, or construction.
definition.zh: （工程、建筑等）制图员；绘图员。

examples.en: The firm hired two drafters to update the building plans.
examples.zh: 公司雇了两名制图员来更新建筑图纸。

examples.en: Drafters often use CAD software to produce accurate drawings.
examples.zh: 制图员常用 CAD 软件来制作精确图纸。

definition.en: In technical drawing, a drafting tool (a “drafter” or drafting machine) used to draw lines at set angles; “drafters” can mean more than one of these tools.
definition.zh: （制图）绘图仪/平行尺式制图器（可设定角度画线的工具）；“drafters”指多个此类工具。

examples.en: The studio replaced the old drafters with newer drafting machines.
examples.zh: 工作室把旧的制图器换成了新的绘图仪。

extraExplanation: “drafters”是“drafter”的复数。日常语境里更常指“起草文件的人”或“制图员”。
英式英语中也常见“draftsman”（美式也用，但较旧或偏传统）；性别中立表达更常用“drafter”。
在建筑/工程领域，“drafter”多与CAD（computer-aided design，计算机辅助设计）搭配；在法律/政策领域则常与“bill, contract, legislation（法案/合同/立法）”等词搭配。

summary.en: “Draftier” means “more drafty”—more cold air comes through a place, making it feel colder.
summary.zh: “draftier”表示“更漏风/更有穿堂风的”，让空间感觉更冷。

definition.en: Comparative form of “drafty”: having more cold air currents (drafts) coming through; less well sealed or insulated.
definition.zh: “drafty”的比较级：更有穿堂风的；更漏风、保暖性更差的。

examples.en: This room is draftier than the bedroom, so I’ll work in there instead.
examples.zh: 这个房间比卧室更漏风，所以我还是去那边工作。

examples.en: After we replaced the window, the house felt much less drafty.
examples.zh: 换了窗户之后，房子感觉没那么漏风了。

examples.en: The old library is draftier in winter, so bring a sweater.
examples.zh: 那座老图书馆冬天更冷、更漏风，所以带件毛衣吧。

extraExplanation: “drafty”在英式英语中常拼作“draughty”，意思相同；“draft/draught”都可指“穿堂风/气流”。
发音注意：drafty 里的“draft”读作 /dræft/（不是 /drɑːft/）。

summary.en: “Draftiest” means “the most drafty”—the place where cold air leaks in the most.
summary.zh: “draftiest”表示“最透风的/漏风最严重的”。

definition.en: Superlative of drafty: having the most unwanted cold air moving through (a room, building, etc.).
definition.zh: drafty 的最高级：最透风的；最有冷风灌入的（房间、建筑等）。

examples.en: This is the draftiest room in the house, so it feels cold even with the heater on.
examples.zh: 这是家里最透风的房间，所以就算开着暖气也觉得冷。

examples.en: The hallway near the back door is the draftiest spot in the apartment.
examples.zh: 公寓里后门附近的走廊是最透风的地方。

extraExplanation: “drafty/draughty”指“有穿堂风、漏风”的意思，来源于“draft/draught（气流）”。注意不要和“draft（草稿）”或“draft beer（生啤）”混淆。美式常拼 drafty，英式常拼 draughty。

summary.en: “Draftily” means in a rough, first-draft way, often implying haste or lack of polish.
summary.zh: “draftily”表示“像草稿一样粗略地/未润色地”，常带有“匆忙、欠周全”的含义。

definition.en: In a rough, unfinished way; like a first draft (not polished or final).
definition.zh: 以草稿般的方式；粗略地、未完善地（还不是最终版本）。

examples.en: The proposal was written draftily and needs careful editing.
examples.zh: 这份提案写得很草率，还需要认真修改。

examples.en: He explained the idea draftily, then refined it with details.
examples.zh: 他先粗略地讲了想法，然后再用细节完善。

definition.en: Hastily or carelessly; without much planning or attention to detail.
definition.zh: 匆忙地；草率地（缺少规划或不够注意细节）。

examples.en: She draftily packed her bag and forgot her charger.
examples.zh: 她匆匆收拾行李，把充电器忘了。

examples.en: The email was sent draftily, with several typos.
examples.zh: 那封邮件发得很草率，里面有好几个拼写错误。

extraExplanation: “draftily”来自名词/动词 draft（草稿；起草）+ -ly（……地）。它不算常用词，日常写作里更常见的说法是 roughly, hastily, carelessly, in draft form。
英式英语里 draft 也常拼作 draught（如 a draught of air 一阵穿堂风），但表示“草稿/起草”时通常用 draft。

summary.en: Draftiness usually means unwanted cold air coming in through gaps; less commonly, it describes writing that feels rough or unfinished like a draft.
summary.zh: draftiness 通常指房屋漏风、冷风从缝隙进入；较少见时也可指文字有“草稿感”，显得粗糙或未完善。

definition.en: The state of having unwanted cold air coming in (usually through gaps around windows, doors, or walls).
definition.zh: 漏风；有穿堂风的状态（通常是窗户、门或墙的缝隙进冷风）。

examples.en: The draftiness in this old apartment makes winter bills expensive.
examples.zh: 这间老公寓漏风，冬天取暖费很贵。

examples.en: We fixed the draftiness by sealing the window frames.
examples.zh: 我们把窗框封好，解决了漏风问题。

definition.en: A quality of writing that feels like an unfinished draft—unclear, rough, or not fully polished.
definition.zh: （写作）草稿感；未完成、较粗糙、不够精炼的特点。

examples.en: The report still has some draftiness; it needs clearer structure.
examples.zh: 这份报告还有点“草稿感”，需要更清晰的结构。

examples.en: Her early poems have a charming draftiness, like notes in a journal.
examples.zh: 她早期的诗有一种迷人的“草稿感”，像日记里的随笔。

extraExplanation: “draftiness”最常见的语境是房子“漏风”。它来自形容词“drafty”（有穿堂风的、漏风的），常见搭配有：drafty room / drafty window / drafty hallway。
第二个意思（写作的“草稿感”）更偏文学或评论用法，表示文字还不够定稿、带有未打磨的痕迹，语气通常中性或带一点欣赏（“质朴、随笔感”）也可能是批评（“不够成熟”）。

summary.en: Drafting most commonly means preparing an early version of a text, and it can also mean technical drawing, selecting people (sports/military), or riding closely behind someone to reduce wind resistance.
summary.zh: Drafting最常指“起草/写初稿”，也可指“工程制图”“（体育/征兵）选拔征召”，或“（骑行/赛车）跟风以减少风阻”。

definition.en: the process of writing or preparing an early version of something (such as a document, email, plan, or law) that will be revised later
definition.zh: 起草；拟稿；写初稿（为之后修改做准备的过程）

examples.en: I spent the morning drafting a proposal for the new project.
examples.zh: 我花了一上午在为新项目起草一份提案。

examples.en: Drafting the email was easy; choosing the right tone was harder.
examples.zh: 邮件的初稿不难，难的是拿捏合适的语气。

definition.en: the act of making a technical drawing or design (often using precise measurements), especially in engineering or architecture
definition.zh: （工程/建筑等的）制图；绘图（按精确尺寸画技术图纸）

examples.en: She took a drafting class to learn how to read and create blueprints.
examples.zh: 她上了制图课，学习如何读懂并绘制蓝图。

examples.en: Drafting requires attention to detail and clean lines.
examples.zh: 制图需要关注细节和干净利落的线条。

definition.en: the process of selecting people for a group or team, especially in professional sports; sometimes also used for officially calling people to serve (the military draft)
definition.zh: （体育等）选拔入队；（也可指）征召入伍（征兵制相关）

examples.en: Drafting starts tonight, and teams will pick new players round by round.
examples.zh: 选秀今晚开始，各队将一轮一轮挑选新球员。

examples.en: He followed the drafting closely to see where his favorite college players would go.
examples.zh: 他密切关注选秀，想看看最喜欢的大学球员会被哪支队选中。

definition.en: in cycling or racing, the act of staying close behind someone to reduce air resistance
definition.zh: （骑行/赛车）跟风骑行；尾流中行进（借前方挡风以减少阻力）

examples.en: Drafting behind another cyclist can save energy.
examples.zh: 跟在另一位骑手后面跟风骑行可以省力。

examples.en: He moved out of the draft to pass on the final lap.
examples.zh: 他离开尾流区，在最后一圈超车。

extraExplanation: “drafting”来自动词“draft”（起草/征召/选派/拖曳），常见于职场写作（draft a report）、工程制图（drafting table/blueprint）和体育“选秀”（NBA Draft 等）。
英式英语中“draft”在“气流/穿堂风”的意思常写作“draught”（如 a draughty room = 有穿堂风的房间），但在美式英语里多用“draft”。

summary.en: A drafting technician makes technical drawings and detailed plans, often using CAD, to support engineering or architectural work.
summary.zh: drafting technician 指使用（常为 CAD）制作工程/建筑等技术图纸与细化方案的制图技术员。

definition.en: A person who prepares technical drawings and detailed plans (often using CAD software) for engineers, architects, or designers.
definition.zh: 制图技术员；绘图员：为工程师、建筑师或设计师制作技术图纸和细化方案（常用 CAD 计算机辅助设计软件）的人。

examples.en: The drafting technician created detailed drawings for the new bridge design.
examples.zh: 这位制图技术员为新桥梁设计制作了详细图纸。

examples.en: As a drafting technician, she uses CAD software every day.
examples.zh: 作为制图技术员，她每天都使用 CAD 软件。

examples.en: The architect asked the drafting technician to update the floor plan after the client’s changes.
examples.zh: 建筑师让制图技术员根据客户的改动更新平面图。

extraExplanation: 在北美职场里，drafting technician 常见于建筑（architecture）、土木（civil）、机械（mechanical）、电气（electrical）等领域，工作重点是把概念设计“落到可施工/可制造的图纸与规格”。
相关常见软件/技能包括 CAD（如 AutoCAD、SolidWorks、Revit）以及读懂工程标准、尺寸标注（dimensioning）与公差（tolerance）。
和 drafter（绘图员）意思很接近；technician 往往强调更系统的技术训练、规范化制图与与工程团队协作。

summary.en: “Draftings” usually means multiple acts of drafting (writing preliminary versions) or multiple rough drawings/design drafts.
summary.zh: “draftings”通常指多次/多份的起草（初稿写作过程或成果），也可指多张草图、初步设计图。

definition.en: the act or process of preparing a first version of something (such as a document, plan, or law), especially by writing it in a preliminary form
definition.zh: 起草；拟定（如文件、计划、法律等的初稿的过程）

examples.en: The draftings of the new policy took several weeks.
examples.zh: 新政策的起草花了好几周。

examples.en: During the draftings, the team kept revising the wording for clarity.
examples.zh: 在起草过程中，团队不断修改措辞以更清晰。

definition.en: rough drawings or preliminary designs, especially in architecture or engineering
definition.zh: 草图；初步设计图（尤指建筑或工程领域）

examples.en: The architect showed several draftings of the house layout.
examples.zh: 建筑师展示了几张房屋布局的草图。

examples.en: We compared the early draftings with the final blueprint.
examples.zh: 我们把早期草图和最终蓝图做了对比。

extraExplanation: “draftings”是“drafting”的复数形式，但在现代英语里，更常见的说法是：写作/文件方面用“drafting”（不可数，表示过程），具体的文本用“drafts”（可数，表示一份份草稿）。例如更自然：“the drafting of the policy”（政策的起草过程）或 “several drafts of the policy”（政策的几个版本/草稿）。
在建筑/工程语境里，“drafting”也常指“制图”这门技能或工作；具体的图纸常说“drawings”或“drafts/draftsman’s drawings”。

summary.en: A draftsman is someone who makes technical drawings or drafts official documents.
summary.zh: draftsman 指“制图员/绘图员”，也可指“文件起草人”。

definition.en: A person who draws technical plans or detailed drawings, especially for buildings, machines, or maps.
definition.zh: 制图员；绘图员（尤指绘制建筑、机械或地图等的技术图纸与细部图的人）。

examples.en: The draftsman prepared the floor plans for the new library.
examples.zh: 绘图员为新图书馆准备了平面图。

examples.en: Before CAD software, a draftsman often worked with rulers and pencils.
examples.zh: 在CAD软件普及之前，绘图员常用尺子和铅笔工作。

definition.en: A person who writes or prepares the first version of an official document, such as a law, contract, or policy.
definition.zh: 起草人；撰稿人（指起草法律、合同、政策等正式文件初稿的人）。

examples.en: She was the main draftsman of the new labor law.
examples.zh: 她是新劳动法的主要起草人。

examples.en: The committee asked a draftsman to produce a clear first draft of the agreement.
examples.zh: 委员会请起草人把协议的初稿写得清晰明了。

extraExplanation: 你输入的拼写 draftman 常见但不标准；更常用的标准拼写是 draftsman（美式/英式都常见）。英式英语里也常见 draughtsman（拼写更传统）。
在现代职场里，“制图员”这一义常被更具体的职位替代，如 CAD technician（CAD 技术员）或 architectural designer（建筑设计绘图人员）。

summary.en: Draftsmanship means skill in drawing—especially technical drawing—or an artist’s drawing technique.
summary.zh: Draftsmanship 指绘图技能，常指技术制图能力，也可指艺术家的线描/绘画功力。

definition.en: Skill in making technical drawings or plans (for example, in architecture, engineering, or design).
definition.zh: （建筑、工程、设计等领域的）制图/绘图能力；绘制技术图纸或方案的技能。

examples.en: Her draftsmanship is excellent—every line is clean and accurate.
examples.zh: 她的制图功底很强——线条干净而且精准。

examples.en: The job requires strong draftsmanship and attention to detail.
examples.zh: 这份工作需要扎实的制图能力和对细节的关注。

definition.en: Skill in drawing (especially with a pen or pencil), often used when talking about an artist’s technique.
definition.zh: （尤指用钢笔或铅笔的）绘画功力；画工（常用于评价艺术家的技法）。

examples.en: The comic artist is known for confident draftsmanship and expressive faces.
examples.zh: 这位漫画家以自信的线条功力和生动的表情刻画而闻名。

examples.en: His draftsmanship gives the sketches a sense of life and movement.
examples.zh: 他的画工让这些速写有了生命感和动感。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“draftmanship”常见为拼写错误；标准拼写是 draftsmanship（中间有 “s”）。
draftsmanship 在美式英语中更常用；英式英语有时也写作 draughtsmanship（同义，拼写更传统）。
与 drafting（制图这项工作/课程）相比，draftsmanship 更强调“水平、功力、技艺”。

summary.en: Draftproof means preventing cold air drafts from getting in, or making something resistant to drafts.
summary.zh: draftproof 指“防漏风/防穿堂风的”，也可指“给……做防漏风处理”。

definition.en: Preventing cold air from entering through gaps (such as around windows, doors, or walls); not letting air “drafts” through.
definition.zh: （门窗等）防穿堂风的；防漏风的；不透风的。

examples.en: We installed draftproof windows to keep the apartment warm in winter.
examples.zh: 我们装了防漏风的窗户，让公寓冬天更暖和。

examples.en: A draftproof door curtain can stop cold air from coming in.
examples.zh: 防漏风的门帘可以挡住冷空气进来。

definition.en: To make something resistant to drafts by sealing gaps (often used in home improvement).
definition.zh: （通过密封缝隙等）给……做防漏风处理；使……防穿堂风。

examples.en: We draftproofed the old windows with weatherstripping.
examples.zh: 我们用密封条给旧窗户做了防漏风处理。

examples.en: It’s worth draftproofing your home to save on heating bills.
examples.zh: 给房子做防漏风处理能省暖气费，值得。

extraExplanation: 在美式英语里常写作 **draftproof** 或 **draft-proof**；英式英语更常用 **draught-proof**（draught = 穿堂风/气流）。
常见的做法包括：在门缝窗缝贴密封条（weatherstripping）、用门底挡风条（door sweep）、用填缝剂（caulk）封住墙体或窗框的小缝隙。

summary.en: “Drafts” most commonly means multiple unfinished versions (draft documents). It can also mean cold air currents indoors, military conscription, or “drafts” as the verb “draft” in the present tense (she drafts).
summary.zh: “drafts”最常见指多份草稿/初稿；也可指室内穿堂风、征兵制，或作动词“draft”的一般现在时第三人称单数（she drafts＝她起草）。

definition.en: Plural of “draft”: a first or unfinished version of something (such as writing, a plan, or a design).
definition.zh: “draft”的复数：草稿；初稿；未完成的版本（如文章、计划或设计）。

examples.en: I saved three drafts of my essay before the final version.
examples.zh: 在定稿前，我保存了三份作文草稿。

examples.en: Please send me the latest drafts of the contract.
examples.zh: 请把合同的最新草稿发给我。

definition.en: Plural of “draft”: currents of air in a room, often felt as an unpleasant breeze.
definition.zh: “draft”的复数：穿堂风；（室内的）气流，常带有“不舒服的冷风”的感觉。

examples.en: Close the window—there are drafts in here.
examples.zh: 把窗户关上——这里有穿堂风。

examples.en: Old houses often have drafts under the doors.
examples.zh: 老房子门底下常常漏风。

definition.en: Plural of “draft”: systems or acts of selecting people (especially for military service) by law.
definition.zh: “draft”的复数：征兵制；（依法）征召入伍。

examples.en: Many students protested the drafts during the Vietnam War.
examples.zh: 越战期间，许多学生抗议征兵。

examples.en: He avoided the drafts by staying in school longer.
examples.zh: 他通过延长在校时间来避免被征召。

definition.en: Third-person singular of “draft”: to write or prepare a first version of something.
definition.zh: “draft”的第三人称单数：起草；拟定；写草稿。

examples.en: She drafts reports for the manager every week.
examples.zh: 她每周都为经理起草报告。

examples.en: The lawyer drafts the agreement and sends it to both sides.
examples.zh: 律师起草协议并发给双方。

extraExplanation: 英式英语里，“draft”的“穿堂风/生啤（桶装啤酒）”常拼作“draught”；美式英语通常都写作“draft”。但“草稿/起草/征兵”在英美都常用“draft”。

summary.en: A draftsman is usually someone who makes precise technical drawings or plans (often for architecture or engineering).
summary.zh: draftsman通常指制作精确技术图纸或设计方案的人（常见于建筑或工程领域）。

definition.en: A person who draws detailed technical plans or designs, especially for engineering, architecture, or manufacturing.
definition.zh: （尤指工程、建筑或制造领域的）制图员；绘图员（绘制精确的技术图纸或设计）

examples.en: The draftsman prepared the blueprints for the new bridge.
examples.zh: 制图员为这座新桥准备了蓝图。

examples.en: She worked as a CAD draftsman, turning engineers’ ideas into precise drawings.
examples.zh: 她做过CAD制图员，把工程师的想法转化为精确的图纸。

definition.en: A person who is skilled at drawing (less common in modern use; often replaced by “drafter” or “artist,” depending on context).
definition.zh: 擅长绘画的人（现代用法较少；根据语境常用“drafter/制图员”或“artist/艺术家”替代）

examples.en: He was known as a talented draftsman who could sketch portraits quickly.
examples.zh: 他以绘画功底扎实著称，能很快画出人物素描。

extraExplanation: 在美式英语里，职业语境中“draftsman”传统上常见，但现在很多职场更偏好用更中性的“drafter”（制图员）。不过“draftsman”仍很常用，尤其在历史文本、传统行业或固定搭配中。
英式英语中常见拼写为“draughtsman”。
不要和“draftsman（制图员）”混淆：draftsman ≠ draftsperson（更中性写法），也 ≠ draftee（被征召入伍者）。

summary.en: Draftsmanship means strong skill and quality in drawing, especially accurate, well-controlled line work and technique.
summary.zh: Draftsmanship 指扎实的绘画/制图技巧与画面品质，尤强调准确、线条控制与技术功底。

definition.en: Skill in drawing, especially the ability to draw accurately and attractively (often used in art, architecture, and design).
definition.zh: （尤指艺术、建筑、设计中的）绘画技巧；制图功底，强调线条准确、美观。

examples.en: Her draftsmanship is so precise that the buildings look realistic.
examples.zh: 她的制图功底非常精准，画出来的建筑看起来很逼真。

examples.en: The teacher praised his draftsmanship and attention to detail.
examples.zh: 老师称赞他的绘画技巧和对细节的关注。

definition.en: The quality of the drawing itself—how well something is drawn (line, proportion, shading, and control).
definition.zh: 画作的“画得好不好”的品质；指线条、比例、明暗和控制力等表现水平。

examples.en: The sketch is simple, but the draftsmanship is excellent.
examples.zh: 这幅速写很简单，但画作的表现水平非常出色。

examples.en: Collectors admire the draftsmanship in his early studies.
examples.zh: 收藏家欣赏他早期习作里的绘画功力。

extraExplanation: “Draftsmanship”常用于较正式或专业的语境，比“drawing skill”更强调训练与技术（如线条控制、透视、结构）。
词源提示：draft/draught（草图、起草）+ -smanship（……的技艺，如 craftsmanship）。因此它带有“手艺/功夫”的感觉。
相关词对比：craftsmanship（工艺/手艺，范围更广）；drafting（制图/起草，多指技术制图或文书起草）；drawing（绘画，最通用）。

summary.en: Draftsmen are people who create technical drawings or who are skilled at careful drawing.
summary.zh: draftsmen 指“制图员/绘图员”（做技术图纸的人），也可泛指擅长精细绘画的人。

definition.en: A person who makes detailed technical drawings or plans (for example, for buildings, machines, or maps).
definition.zh: 制图员；绘图员（制作建筑、机械或地图等的技术图纸和方案的人）

examples.en: The architect sent the sketches to the draftsmen to turn them into detailed plans.
examples.zh: 建筑师把草图发给制图员，让他们把草图做成详细的图纸。

examples.en: Experienced draftsmen know how to read and create blueprints accurately.
examples.zh: 有经验的制图员知道如何准确阅读并绘制蓝图。

definition.en: Someone who is skilled at drawing, especially precise or careful drawing.
definition.zh: （尤指精细、严谨的）绘画者；擅长画图的人

examples.en: He was a talented draftsman who could capture faces with a few lines.
examples.zh: 他是个很有才华的画图者，几笔就能抓住人物的神韵。

extraExplanation: “draftsmen” 是 “draftsman” 的复数。英式英语常写作 “draughtsman / draughtsmen”。在现代职场中也常用更中性的说法 “drafter” 或 “draftsperson”。

summary.en: A draftsperson is someone who creates technical drawings and plans (often called a drafter).
summary.zh: draftsperson 指制作技术图纸与方案的人（常称 drafter）。

definition.en: A person who makes technical drawings and plans, especially for engineering, architecture, or manufacturing (also called a “drafter”).
definition.zh: （尤指工程、建筑或制造业的）制图员；绘图员（也可称 drafter）。

examples.en: The draftsperson prepared detailed drawings for the new bridge.
examples.zh: 制图员为新桥准备了详细图纸。

examples.en: An architect may design the building, while a draftsperson turns the ideas into precise plans.
examples.zh: 建筑师可能负责设计，而制图员把想法转化为精确的图纸。

extraExplanation: “draftsperson”是性别中立用法，用来替代“draftsman”。在美式英语里更常见的说法是“drafter”。
常见搭配：drafting software（制图软件）、technical drawing（技术制图）、blueprint（蓝图/施工图）。

summary.en: A draftswoman is a woman who creates technical drawings or plans, especially for architecture or engineering.
summary.zh: draftswoman 指女性制图员/绘图员，主要负责制作建筑或工程等技术图纸。

definition.en: a woman whose job is to prepare technical drawings, plans, or detailed designs (for example in architecture or engineering); a female drafter
definition.zh: （尤指建筑或工程领域的）制图员、绘图员（女性）

examples.en: The draftswoman produced precise floor plans for the new library.
examples.zh: 这位女制图员为新图书馆绘制了精确的平面图。

examples.en: As a draftswoman, she worked closely with architects to turn ideas into drawings.
examples.zh: 作为女绘图员，她与建筑师密切合作，把想法变成图纸。

extraExplanation: “draftswoman”是带有性别标记的职业称呼，对应“draftsman”。在现代英语里，很多场合更常用中性说法“drafter”或“draftsperson”，尤其在职场写作与招聘信息中更普遍、也更包容。
相关领域里，“draft/drafting”指“绘制（设计）图纸”，常见搭配有“technical drawing（工程制图）”“blueprints（蓝图）”“CAD（计算机辅助设计）”。

summary.en: Draftswomanship means skillful, clear drafting—especially of formal or legal documents.
summary.zh: draftswomanship 指“起草技巧/文稿措辞能力”，尤指法律或正式文件的清晰与严谨。

definition.en: Skill in writing or drawing drafts clearly and accurately, especially when preparing documents (such as laws, contracts, or formal statements).
definition.zh: 起草（或绘制草图）的能力与技巧，尤指撰写法律、合同或正式文件时的清晰与准确。

examples.en: Good draftswomanship makes the contract easier to understand and harder to misinterpret.
examples.zh: 良好的起草技巧会让合同更易理解，也更不容易被误读。

examples.en: The committee praised her draftswomanship in shaping the final policy language.
examples.zh: 委员会称赞她在打磨最终政策措辞方面的起草能力。

definition.en: The quality of wording—clarity, precision, and organization—shown in a written draft.
definition.zh: （文稿）措辞质量：体现为清晰、精确与结构性。

examples.en: The memo’s draftswomanship is strong, but it still needs a few facts checked.
examples.zh: 这份备忘录的措辞与结构很好，但仍需要核实一些事实。

examples.en: With better draftswomanship, the instructions would be less confusing.
examples.zh: 如果起草得更严谨，这些说明就不会那么让人困惑。

extraExplanation: “draftswomanship”是“draftsmanship”的性别标注变体，把传统的“man”换成“woman”。在现代英语里，更常见、也更中性的说法是“drafting skills”或直接用“draftsmanship”。
在法律与公共政策语境中，draftsmanship/起草技巧通常强调：用词明确、避免歧义、定义一致、结构清晰，以及对后果（可执行性、可解释性）的把控。

summary.en: A woman who makes technical drawings or plans; a female drafter/draftsperson.
summary.zh: 制作技术图纸或设计方案的女性；女制图员。

definition.en: a woman whose job is to make technical drawings or plans (for engineering, architecture, etc.); a female drafter/draftsperson
definition.zh: （工程、建筑等）制图员；女绘图员

examples.en: The draftwoman prepared the detailed drawings for the new bridge.
examples.zh: 这位女制图员为新桥准备了详细图纸。

examples.en: She worked as a draftwoman in an architecture firm before becoming an architect.
examples.zh: 在成为建筑师之前，她曾在一家建筑事务所做女制图员。

extraExplanation: “draftwoman”比较少见，更常用的说法是 gender-neutral（性别中立）的 **drafter** 或 **draftsperson**。传统用法 **draftsman** 常被认为带有性别色彩（默认男性），在正式写作或职场语境中，很多人会改用 **drafter/draftsperson**。
在英式英语中，相关职业也常用 **draughtswoman / draughtsman**（拼写不同：draught-）。

summary.en: Drafty usually means “leaky and cold because air comes in,” and less commonly “rough/unfinished (like a draft text).”
summary.zh: Drafty 通常指“漏风的、会进冷风的”，较少见也可指“草稿的、未定稿的（像草稿文本）”。

definition.en: Letting in cold air because air moves through cracks, gaps, or an open space (often describing a room, building, or window).
definition.zh: （房间/建筑/窗户等）有穿堂风的；漏风的（因为有缝隙或开口让冷空气进来）。

examples.en: This apartment is drafty in winter, especially near the windows.
examples.zh: 这套公寓冬天很漏风，尤其是窗户附近。

examples.en: Put weatherstripping on the door if the hallway feels drafty.
examples.zh: 如果走廊感觉有穿堂风，可以在门上贴密封条。

definition.en: (Of a written text) not finished; in an early, rough form.
definition.zh: （文章/文本）草稿的；未定稿的；初稿状态的。

examples.en: My essay is still drafty—I need to revise the introduction.
examples.zh: 我的文章还只是初稿——我需要修改引言部分。

examples.en: Send me a drafty version first, and we’ll polish it later.
examples.zh: 你先发我一个初稿版本，我们之后再润色。

extraExplanation: “drafty”最常见的意思是“漏风的”，来自名词“draft/draught（气流、穿堂风）”。美式英语常写 draft，英式英语常写 draught（但“草稿”通常都写 draft）。
第二个意思“草稿的、未定稿的”在口语里有人用，但更常见、更自然的说法是 “a rough draft / a first draft / still a draft”。“drafty essay”可能听起来不太正式。

summary.en: Drag means to pull something with effort (often along the ground), or to move slowly; as a noun it can mean something boring or a slowing force like air resistance.
summary.zh: drag 常指费力地拖拽（多在地面上），也可指缓慢费力地移动；作名词可指“无聊烦人的事”，或指空气阻力等“阻力”。

definition.en: to pull something along a surface, usually with effort (often because it is heavy or not moving smoothly)
definition.zh: （费力地）拖；拽着……移动（常因很重或不顺滑）

examples.en: They dragged the box across the floor.
examples.zh: 他们把箱子拖过地板。

examples.en: He dragged his suitcase up the stairs.
examples.zh: 他把行李箱拖上楼梯。

definition.en: to move slowly and with effort; to walk as if you are tired or hurt
definition.zh: 缓慢费力地移动；（像疲惫或受伤一样）拖着脚走

examples.en: After the long hike, we dragged back to camp.
examples.zh: 长途徒步后，我们拖着疲惫的身体回到营地。

definition.en: something that is boring, annoying, or slows progress (informal)
definition.zh: 无聊/讨厌的事；拖累、阻碍（非正式）

examples.en: Waiting in line is such a drag.
examples.zh: 排队真是太无聊（太烦）了。

definition.en: a force (such as air resistance) that slows movement
definition.zh: 阻力（如空气阻力），使运动减慢的力

examples.en: A smoother shape reduces drag in the air.
examples.zh: 更流线的形状可以减少空气阻力。

extraExplanation: “drag”最核心的画面是“在地上拖着走”，因此常带有“费力、缓慢、被迫”的感觉。用在时间或体验上时，也会引申出“进展很慢、让人厌烦”的语气：The meeting dragged on.（会议拖了很久）。
常见搭配：drag on（拖延、持续很久）；drag someone into something（把某人拉进/牵扯进某事）；drag yourself out of bed（强打精神起床）。
注意区分：pull 更中性（拉），drag 更强调“拖/费劲/在地上摩擦”；tow 常指用车/船“拖曳”另一辆车或船。

summary.en: “dragade” is not a standard English word; it’s probably a misspelling or a proper name.
summary.zh: “dragade”不是标准英语单词，更可能是拼写错误或专有名词。

definition.en: Not a standard English word; likely a misspelling or a name. Common possibilities include “dragged” (past tense of drag), “brigade,” or “grenade,” depending on context.
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词；更可能是拼写错误或专有名词。常见可能是“dragged”（drag 的过去式）、“brigade”（旅/队），或“grenade”（手榴弹），取决于语境。

examples.en: I couldn’t find “dragade” in an English dictionary—did you mean “dragged”?
examples.zh: 我在英语词典里找不到“dragade”——你是不是想写“dragged”？

examples.en: Can you share the sentence where you saw “dragade”? That will help identify the intended word.
examples.zh: 你能把看到“dragade”的句子发我吗？这样更容易判断你想表达的词。

extraExplanation: “dragade”看起来像拼写误差。最常见的情况是把“dragged”（/dræɡd/）打错了；也可能是把“brigade”（队/旅）或“grenade”（手榴弹）之类的词记错。
如果你告诉我它出现的场景（聊天、歌词、游戏、小说、地名/人名等）或原句，我可以给出最准确的词条、发音与用法。

summary.en: “dragaded” isn’t an English word; it’s probably a misspelling of “degraded” or “dragged.”
summary.zh: “dragaded” 不是英文单词；更可能是把 “degraded” 或 “dragged” 拼错了。

definition.en: Not a standard English word. It is likely a misspelling of a real word such as “degraded” or “dragged.”
definition.zh: 这不是标准英文单词；很可能是拼写错误，常见可能想写的是 “degraded（被贬低/退化的）” 或 “dragged（被拖拽/拖着走的）”。

examples.en: I couldn’t find “dragaded” in a dictionary—did you mean “degraded” or “dragged”?
examples.zh: 我在词典里找不到 “dragaded”——你是不是想写 “degraded” 或 “dragged”？

examples.en: The metal has degraded after years in the rain.
examples.zh: 这种金属在雨里多年后已经退化/变质了。

examples.en: He dragged the heavy box across the floor.
examples.zh: 他把沉重的箱子拖过地板。

extraExplanation:
“dragaded” 看起来像把字母顺序/拼写打乱了。最接近的常用词里：
- degraded /dɪˈɡreɪdɪd/：常指“质量变差、退化；（人）被贬低、受辱”。
- dragged /dræɡd/：drag（拖拽）的过去式/过去分词。
如果你告诉我原句（前后文），我可以帮你确定你真正想用哪个词。

summary.en: Degrading means humiliating to a person, or causing something to become worse in quality or status.
summary.zh: Degrading 指“有辱人格的、羞辱性的”，也可指“使质量/地位下降”。

definition.en: (adj.) Causing someone to lose dignity or respect; humiliating.
definition.zh: （形容词）有辱人格的；使人丢脸的；羞辱性的。

examples.en: He said the comments were degrading and asked for an apology.
examples.zh: 他说这些评论很羞辱人，并要求道歉。

examples.en: Doing degrading work for no reason can hurt a person’s self-respect.
examples.zh: 无缘无故做有辱人格的事会伤害一个人的自尊。

definition.en: (v., present participle of “degrade”) Lowering something in quality, value, or status; treating someone with disrespect.
definition.zh: （动词，degrade 的现在分词）使质量/价值/地位下降；贬低、侮辱（某人）。

examples.en: The chemicals are degrading the plastic over time.
examples.zh: 这些化学物质会随着时间使塑料性能下降。

examples.en: He kept degrading his teammate in front of others.
examples.zh: 他一直当着别人的面贬低队友。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“dragading”很可能是拼写错误，更常见的词是 **degrading**（羞辱性的/使质量下降的）。
**degrading**（degrade + -ing）既可形容“让人难堪的”，也可表示“逐渐变差/被破坏”。在日常语境里，形容人的感受时常用第一种意思。
相关词：**humiliating**（更强调“让人羞愧”），**demeaning**（贬低人的、轻视人的）。

summary.en: Dragan is mainly a South Slavic male given name meaning “beloved,” and it can also be a surname.
summary.zh: Dragan 主要是南斯拉夫地区的男性名字，含义偏“受喜爱／亲爱的”，也可用作姓氏。

definition.en: A masculine given name common in South Slavic countries (especially Serbia, Croatia, Bosnia and Herzegovina), traditionally meaning “dear/beloved.”
definition.zh: 男性名字，常见于南斯拉夫语系国家（尤指塞尔维亚、克罗地亚、波黑等），传统含义为“亲爱的／受喜爱的”。

examples.en: Dragan is a common first name in Serbia.
examples.zh: Dragan 是塞尔维亚很常见的名字。

examples.en: I met a man named Dragan at the conference.
examples.zh: 我在会议上认识了一位叫 Dragan 的男士。

definition.en: A family name (surname) used in some countries and diaspora communities.
definition.zh: 姓氏，在一些国家及海外侨民社群中也会使用。

examples.en: Ms. Dragan will join the meeting at 2 p.m.
examples.zh: Dragan 女士将在下午两点参加会议。

extraExplanation: “Dragan”通常源自斯拉夫语词根 drag-，与“珍贵、亲爱”有关（如塞尔维亚语/克罗地亚语里表示“亲爱的”一类含义）。
英语学习者常把“Dragan”和“dragon（龙）”混淆：拼写只差一个字母，但意思完全不同；“dragon”是普通名词，而“Dragan”多为人名。

summary.en: A dragbar is usually a bar you can drag on a screen (like a slider), and it can also mean a steering linkage part in a vehicle.
summary.zh: dragbar 通常指界面上可拖动的滑条；在汽车领域也可指转向系统中的横拉杆等连杆部件。

definition.en: a horizontal or vertical bar on a screen that you drag with a mouse or finger to change a value, move an item, or adjust a setting (similar to a slider)
definition.zh: （界面上的）可拖动条；用鼠标或手指拖动来调整数值、移动项目或改变设置（类似滑块/滑动条）

examples.en: Drag the bar to increase the volume.
examples.zh: 拖动滑条来调大音量。

examples.en: You can drag the bar left or right to set the start time.
examples.zh: 你可以把拖动条向左或向右拖动来设置开始时间。

definition.en: a metal steering link in some vehicles that connects steering components and helps control the front wheels
definition.zh: （汽车）转向横拉杆；连接转向部件、帮助控制前轮的金属连杆

examples.en: The mechanic replaced a worn drag bar to fix the steering play.
examples.zh: 修理工更换了磨损的转向横拉杆来解决方向盘松旷的问题。

examples.en: A bent drag bar can cause uneven steering or pulling.
examples.zh: 弯曲的转向横拉杆可能导致转向不稳或车辆跑偏。

extraExplanation: 在软件/网页语境里更常见的写法是 **drag bar** 或更标准的 **slider / slider bar**；在移动端也可能叫 **seek bar**（尤其在音视频进度条）。
在汽车语境里，**drag bar** 常见于皮卡、越野车等的转向结构；有时也会被更笼统地称为 **steering linkage**（转向连杆机构）的一部分。

summary.en: A dragboat is usually a boat used for towing; less commonly, it can mean a boat used for water drag racing.
summary.zh: dragboat 通常指用于拖拽/拖运的船；较少见时也可指水上直线竞速用的快艇。

definition.en: a boat used to pull (tow) something through the water, such as another boat, a barge, a net, or logs
definition.zh: 拖船；用于在水上拖拉其他船只、驳船、渔网或木材等的船

examples.en: A dragboat towed the broken sailboat back to the marina.
examples.zh: 一艘拖船把坏掉的帆船拖回了码头。

examples.en: On the river, dragboats helped move heavy logs downstream.
examples.zh: 在河上，拖船帮助把沉重的木材顺流运走。

definition.en: (less common) a high-speed boat built for drag racing on water
definition.zh: （较少见）水上直线竞速（拖曳赛）用的高速船

examples.en: He races a dragboat on a short straight course.
examples.zh: 他驾驶拖曳赛快艇在一段短直航道上比赛。

extraExplanation: “dragboat”在日常英语中不算常见，更常见的说法是 towboat（拖船）或 tugboat（拖轮）。
第二个含义来自 drag racing（直线加速赛）：原本多指汽车比赛，后来也用于水上竞速，因此会出现 drag boat / dragboat 这种说法。

summary.en: A drag bolt is a bolt used to pull or draw parts into position, helping alignment or tight fastening.
summary.zh: drag bolt 指用于拉拽零件就位、辅助对齐或拉紧固定的螺栓。

definition.en: (engineering, hardware) A bolt used to pull, draw, or drag parts into position—often to align components or tighten two pieces together.
definition.zh: （工程/五金）用于“拉、拽、牵引”零件就位的螺栓——常用来对齐部件或把两块材料拉紧固定。

examples.en: Use a drag bolt to pull the two plates into alignment before tightening the nuts.
examples.zh: 在拧紧螺母之前，用拖拉螺栓把两块钢板拉到对齐位置。

examples.en: The installer used a drag bolt to draw the frame tight against the wall.
examples.zh: 安装工用拖拉螺栓把框架拉紧贴合墙面。

extraExplanation: “dragbolt”不是很常见的标准词，更多时候会写成两个词“drag bolt”。在不同地区或行业里，人们也可能用更常见的说法来表达相近概念，例如“draw bolt / drawbolt”（强调把零件“拉紧、拉到位”）或更具体的名称（如拉紧螺栓、牵引螺栓等）。如果你是在某个产品说明书、游戏/小说或特定机械图纸中看到它，语境可能会给出更明确的专门含义。

summary.en: A dragée is a small sugar-coated candy (often used for decoration or wedding favors) or a coated pill.
summary.zh: dragée 指糖衣小糖果（常用于烘焙装饰或婚礼糖果）或带包衣的药片。

definition.en: a small sweet (candy) with a hard sugar coating, often with a nut or chocolate inside (e.g., sugar-coated almonds).
definition.zh: 糖衣小糖果；常见为糖衣杏仁或糖衣巧克力等（外层硬糖壳，内里是坚果或巧克力）。

examples.en: The wedding favors were white dragées (sugar-coated almonds).
examples.zh: 婚礼小礼物里放的是白色的糖衣杏仁（dragées）。

examples.en: She sprinkled colorful dragées on top of the cupcakes.
examples.zh: 她在纸杯蛋糕上撒了彩色的糖珠（dragées）。

definition.en: a pill or tablet covered with a smooth coating (sometimes sugar-coated) to make it easier to swallow.
definition.zh: （药）外面有光滑包衣的药片/药丸（有时为糖衣），便于吞咽。

examples.en: Some medicines come as dragées with a sweet coating.
examples.zh: 有些药物是糖衣包裹的药片（dragées）。

examples.en: The pharmacist explained that the dragée should be swallowed whole.
examples.zh: 药剂师说明这种包衣药片（dragée）要整片吞服。

extraExplanation: “dragée”来自法语，常见拼写带变音符号：dragée；英文里也常写作不带符号的 dragee。读音里的“zh”音（/ʒ/）类似于英文 measure 里的中间音。
在烘焙语境中，dragées 通常指“装饰用糖珠/银珠”（常见银色或彩色）。在婚礼语境中，常指“糖衣杏仁”（也常被称为 Jordan almonds）。

summary.en: Dragées are sugar-coated sweets (often almonds) and can also mean sugar-coated pills.
summary.zh: Dragées 指糖衣糖果（常为糖衣杏仁），也可指糖衣药丸。

definition.en: a small sweet (often an almond) coated in a hard, smooth layer of sugar; commonly given at weddings or celebrations
definition.zh: （常指杏仁外裹硬糖衣的）糖衣小糖果；常用于婚礼或庆典赠礼

examples.en: At the wedding reception, guests were given little bags of dragées.
examples.zh: 在婚礼宴会上，宾客收到了装着糖衣杏仁（dragées）的小袋子。

examples.en: She decorated the cake with silver dragées.
examples.zh: 她用银色的糖珠（dragées）装饰蛋糕。

definition.en: a small pill or medicinal tablet with a sugar coating (more common in medical or older writing)
definition.zh: （药用或较旧用法）糖衣小药丸；糖衣片

examples.en: The pharmacist prepared sugar-coated dragées to make the medicine easier to swallow.
examples.zh: 药剂师把药做成糖衣小药丸（dragées），让它更容易吞服。

extraExplanation: dragée 源自法语，常写作 dragée（带重音符号 é），英语里也常见不带重音的拼写 dragee。
dragees 是复数形式；单数是 dragée / dragee。烘焙语境里常指蛋糕用的“糖珠/银珠”，喜糖语境里常指“糖衣杏仁”（也叫 Jordan almonds）。

summary.en: Likely meant dragline: a big cable-operated digging machine, or a fishing line dragged behind a boat.
summary.zh: 很可能是 dragline：指大型钢索拉铲挖掘机；也可指船后拖行的拖钓线。

definition.en: a large excavating machine (a type of crane) with a bucket that is dragged by cables, used for digging in mines, construction sites, or waterways
definition.zh: （挖掘用）拉铲挖掘机；一种用钢索拖拽铲斗进行挖掘的大型起重/挖掘机械，常用于矿区、工地或疏浚水道

examples.en: The dragline removed tons of soil to widen the canal.
examples.zh: 拉铲挖掘机挖走了大量泥土来拓宽运河。

examples.en: A dragline crane is often used for open-pit mining.
examples.zh: 露天采矿常会用到拉铲式起重机。

definition.en: a fishing line dragged behind a moving boat (also called a trolling line)
definition.zh: （钓鱼）拖钓线；船行进时拖在船后方的鱼线

examples.en: They set a dragline behind the boat to catch tuna.
examples.zh: 他们在船后放下拖钓线来钓金枪鱼。

extraExplanation: “Dragelin”不是常见的标准拼写；你可能想写的是 **dragline**。在工程语境中最常见，指大型拉铲挖掘机；在钓鱼语境中也可指拖钓线。
词源上可直观理解为 drag（拖拽）+ line（绳索/线）：铲斗或鱼线都“被拖着走”。

summary.en: “Dragen” isn’t standard English; it’s usually a misspelling of “dragon.”
summary.zh: “dragen”不是标准英语；通常是把“dragon（龙）”拼错了。

definition.en: Not a standard English word; most often a misspelling of “dragon.”
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词；最常见是把 “dragon（龙）” 拼错成 “dragen”。

examples.en: Did you mean “dragon”? (dragen → dragon)
examples.zh: 你是想写 “dragon” 吗？（dragen → dragon）

examples.en: In the story, the dragon guarded a treasure.
examples.zh: 在故事里，那条龙守护着宝藏。

extraExplanation: “dragen”在荷兰语/德语里与“携带、承受、穿戴”等含义有关（如荷兰语 dragen=to carry/to wear），但它不是英语里的常用词。若你是在学英语，通常需要的词是“dragon（龙）”。

summary.en: A decorative box for holding small sweets, especially dragées.
summary.zh: 用于盛放小糖果（尤指糖衣杏仁等）的装饰性小盒。

definition.en: a small decorative box or dish used to hold dragées (sugar-coated almonds/candies) or other small sweets; a candy box.
definition.zh: （放糖果或糖衣杏仁等的）小巧装饰盒/糖果盒。

examples.en: She kept silver dragées in a tiny drageoir on the coffee table.
examples.zh: 她把银色糖衣杏仁放在咖啡桌上的一个小小的糖果盒里。

examples.en: At the wedding, each table had a drageoir filled with sugared almonds for guests.
examples.zh: 婚礼上，每张桌子都放着一个装满糖衣杏仁的糖果盒招待宾客。

extraExplanation: 这是一个法语借词（来自 *dragée* “糖衣糖果”），在现代英语中非常少见，多见于描写欧式礼仪、古董或精致摆设的语境。
相关词：*dragée*（糖衣糖果/糖衣杏仁）、*bonbonnière*（更常见的“糖果盒/喜糖盒”，也常指婚礼小礼盒）。

summary.en: “Dragged” is the past form of “drag,” meaning pulled with effort, moved slowly/unwillingly, or (informally) criticized strongly in public.
summary.zh: “Dragged” 是 “drag” 的过去式/过去分词，可表示费力拖拽、疲惫不情愿地挪动，也可（非正式）指公开猛烈批评。

definition.en: past tense and past participle of “drag”: to pull something or someone along a surface, usually with effort
definition.zh: “drag”的过去式和过去分词：拖、拽（某物或某人），通常很费力

examples.en: He dragged the heavy box across the floor.
examples.zh: 他把沉重的箱子拖过地板。

examples.en: The dog dragged its leash through the mud.
examples.zh: 那只狗把牵引绳拖在泥里。

examples.en: She was dragged to safety by a firefighter.
examples.zh: 她被消防员拖到安全的地方。

definition.en: to move slowly and unwillingly; to force yourself to go somewhere when you’re tired or unmotivated
definition.zh: 慢吞吞、不情愿地移动；（很累或没动力时）硬撑着去某处

examples.en: I dragged myself out of bed at 6 a.m.
examples.zh: 我早上六点硬撑着从床上爬起来。

examples.en: After the long meeting, everyone dragged back to their desks.
examples.zh: 漫长的会议结束后，大家都疲惫地挪回工位。

definition.en: (informal) to criticize someone strongly, especially in public or online
definition.zh: （非正式）猛烈批评、公开“喷”某人（尤其在网上）

examples.en: He got dragged on social media for his rude comment.
examples.zh: 他因为那句无礼的评论在社交媒体上被狠狠批评。

examples.en: The article dragged the company for lying to customers.
examples.zh: 那篇文章严厉批评这家公司欺骗消费者。

extraExplanation: 发音提示：dragged 的 -ed 读 /d/（因为前面的 /ɡ/ 是浊辅音），所以读作 /dræɡd/，不是 /dræɡɪd/。
口语里 “get dragged” 常见于网络语境，意思是“被群嘲/被狠狠批评”。注意语气较强，正式写作中可用 “was harshly criticized”。

summary.en: A “dragger” is someone or something that drags, and it can also mean a trawling fishing boat.
summary.zh: “dragger”可指拖拽的人或物，也可指拖网渔船（有时也指拖网）。

definition.en: A person or thing that drags (pulls something along a surface).
definition.zh: 拖拽者；拖拉的东西（把某物沿着地面或表面拖着走的人或物）。

examples.en: He was a slow dragger, pulling the heavy suitcase across the floor.
examples.zh: 他拖得很慢，把沉重的行李箱在地板上拖着走。

examples.en: This plastic dragger helps you move furniture without scratching the wood.
examples.zh: 这个塑料拖垫能帮助你移动家具，而不会刮伤木地板。

definition.en: A fishing boat that pulls a trawl net; also, the trawl net itself in some contexts.
definition.zh: 拖网渔船；（某些语境中也指）拖网。

examples.en: A dragger returned to port early because the weather turned rough.
examples.zh: 因为天气变糟，一艘拖网渔船提前返港。

examples.en: The regulators inspected several draggers for illegal fishing gear.
examples.zh: 监管人员检查了几艘拖网渔船是否使用非法渔具。

extraExplanation: “dragger”在日常口语里不算特别常见，更常见的是用更具体的词，比如“someone who drags…”（拖东西的人）或“trawler”（拖网渔船）。在沿海地区或渔业新闻里，“dragger”作为“拖网渔船”会更常见。

summary.en: “Draggers” usually means people/things that drag, and in fishing it can mean trawler boats that drag nets.
summary.zh: “draggers”通常指“拖拽的人或物”；在渔业语境中也可指“拖网渔船”。

definition.en: People or things that drag something; something (or someone) that pulls with resistance and slows movement.
definition.zh: 拖拽的人或物；会产生阻力、把速度拖慢的东西（或人）。

examples.en: After the storm, volunteers used draggers to pull heavy branches off the road.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，志愿者用拖拽工具把粗重的树枝从路上拉走。

examples.en: Old, muddy wheels can be real draggers when you’re trying to move fast.
examples.zh: 旧轮子又老又沾泥时，你想走快就会被它们拖慢。

definition.en: (Especially in fishing) boats that drag a large net along the sea floor; trawlers.
definition.zh: （尤指渔业）拖网渔船；用大网在海底拖行捕鱼的船（trawlers）。

examples.en: Several draggers left the harbor before dawn to look for shrimp.
examples.zh: 几艘拖网渔船天没亮就出港去找虾。

examples.en: The town’s economy depends on lobster boats and draggers.
examples.zh: 这个小镇的经济依赖捕龙虾的船和拖网渔船。

extraExplanation: “dragger”在一些英语沿海地区（尤其美国东北部）是很常见的渔业用词，口语里常指“拖网渔船”。如果你在新闻或纪录片里看到与渔业、港口、海鲜产业相关的语境，这个意思更可能。

summary.en: “Draggier” means “more draggy”: either more resistant/heavy to move, or more slow and tedious in pace.
summary.zh: “draggier”意为“更draggy”：要么指阻力更大、更沉涩；要么指节奏更拖沓、更乏味。

definition.en: Comparative of "draggy": having more resistance or friction, so it feels heavier or harder to move (often about a car, steering, brakes, or motion in water/air).
definition.zh: “draggy”的比较级：阻力更大、更涩、更不顺（常形容汽车、转向、刹车，或在水/空气中的运动）。

examples.en: After I pumped up the tires, the ride felt less draggier and more smooth.
examples.zh: 把轮胎打足气后，骑起来没那么“拖/涩”，更顺滑了。

examples.en: In cold weather, the steering can feel draggier than usual.
examples.zh: 天气冷时，方向盘/转向可能会比平时更沉、更涩。

definition.en: Comparative of "draggy": slower, more tedious, or less lively (often about a story, lesson, meeting, or pacing).
definition.zh: “draggy”的比较级：更拖沓、更无聊、更缺乏节奏感（常形容故事、课程、会议、节奏/进度）。

examples.en: The middle chapters are draggier than the beginning.
examples.zh: 中间几章比开头更拖沓。

examples.en: This week’s meeting felt draggier because it went on too long.
examples.zh: 这周的会议因为开得太久，感觉更拖沓。

extraExplanation: “draggier”是形容词“draggy”的比较级，意思是“更……”。在书面语里，有时会用更常见的表达来替换，比如：more sluggish（更迟缓）、more tedious（更乏味）、more resistant（阻力更大）。
注意：有的人会说“less draggier”，但更标准的表达通常是“less draggy”（没那么拖沓/没那么涩）。

summary.en: “Draggiest” means the most draggy—slow-paced, tedious, and least engaging.
summary.zh: “draggiest”表示“最拖沓、最沉闷无聊的”，强调节奏慢、让人觉得冗长。

definition.en: Superlative form of “draggy”: the slowest, dullest, or most boring (often used about stories, movies, meetings, or parts of an event).
definition.zh: “draggy”的最高级：最拖沓的、最沉闷无聊的（常用于故事、电影、会议或活动的某一段）。

examples.en: The middle chapter was the draggiest part of the book.
examples.zh: 中间那一章是这本书最拖沓、最无聊的部分。

examples.en: That meeting was the draggiest hour of my week.
examples.zh: 那场会议是我一周里最沉闷的一小时。

examples.en: The movie starts strong, but the second half is the draggiest.
examples.zh: 这部电影开头很精彩，但后半段最拖沓。

extraExplanation: “draggiest”来自形容词“draggy”（拖沓的、沉闷的）的最高级形式。拼写规则是：以辅音字母+y结尾时，变最高级通常把y改成i再加-est（draggy → draggiest）。
“draggy/draggiest”偏口语、影评或日常评价中使用，比“boring/slow”更强调“节奏拖、推进慢、让人觉得时间被拉长”。

summary.en: Draggily means moving or happening in a slow, heavy, tired, or dragging way.
summary.zh: draggily 表示“拖拖拉拉地、缓慢费力地（带疲惫或拖沓感）”。

definition.en: In a slow, heavy, and tired way, as if you are being pulled down or moving with difficulty.
definition.zh: 拖拖拉拉地；缓慢而费力地（像是被拉住或很疲惫一样）。

examples.en: After the long hike, he walked draggily back to camp.
examples.zh: 长途徒步后，他拖着疲惫的步子慢慢回到营地。

examples.en: The meeting moved draggily, and everyone looked bored.
examples.zh: 会议进展得很拖沓，大家看起来都很无聊。

extraExplanation: “draggily”来自形容词“draggy”（拖沓的、进展缓慢的）和动词“drag”（拖拽）。它强调“速度慢”之外，还带有“沉重、费劲、让人提不起精神”的感觉。
这个词在日常口语里不算常用；更常见的替代表达有“slowly”（慢慢地）、“heavily”（沉重地）、“wearily”（疲惫地）、“draggingly”（拖着脚步地）。不过“draggily”更能把“拖沓、低效率/低精神”的语气合在一起。

summary.en: Dragginess means slowness or dullness—something feels like it’s dragging; less commonly, it can mean physical resistance or “drag.”
summary.zh: Dragginess 指拖沓沉闷、让人觉得“被拖着走”的感觉；较少见时也可指物理上的阻力/拖拽感。

definition.en: The quality of feeling slow, dull, or lacking energy; a sense that something is moving too slowly or is boring.
definition.zh: 拖沓、沉闷、没劲的状态；让人觉得进展太慢或很无聊的感觉。

examples.en: The dragginess of the meeting made it hard to stay focused.
examples.zh: 会议的拖沓沉闷让人很难集中注意力。

examples.en: After lunch, I often feel a bit of dragginess and want a short break.
examples.zh: 午饭后我常常有点犯困、没精神，想休息一下。

definition.en: (Less common) The quality of having “drag” or resistance, making movement feel heavy or slowed down.
definition.zh: （较少见）阻力大、拖拽感强的特性，使移动显得更费力或更慢。

examples.en: The dragginess of the wet fabric made it uncomfortable to walk in.
examples.zh: 湿衣料的拖拽感让走路很不舒服。

examples.en: There was dragginess in the controls, as if the machine needed oil.
examples.zh: 操控有种发涩的阻力感，好像机器需要上油。

extraExplanation: “dragginess”来自形容词“draggy”（拖沓的、乏味的），再加名词后缀“-ness”表示“……的状态/性质”。日常中更常说“sluggishness / dullness / a dragging feeling”。
语气上比较口语、非正式，常用于描述会议、剧情、学习进度等“节奏太慢、让人提不起劲”的感觉。

summary.en: “Dragging” most commonly means pulling something with effort; as an adjective it can describe something slow and tiring, or boring and drawn out.
summary.zh: “dragging”最常指费力拖拽；作形容词时可形容事情进展拖沓费时，或内容沉闷冗长。

definition.en: the act of pulling something or someone along a surface, usually with effort; the present participle (-ing form) of “drag”
definition.zh: 拖拽；拖拉（“drag”的-ing形式），指费力把某物/某人沿着地面或某方向拉着走

examples.en: He was dragging the suitcase up the stairs.
examples.zh: 他正把行李箱拖上楼梯。

examples.en: Stop dragging your feet—let’s go.
examples.zh: 别磨蹭了——我们走吧。

examples.en: She came in dragging a chair behind her.
examples.zh: 她进来时拖着一把椅子在身后。

definition.en: slow, tiring, or taking longer than it should
definition.zh: 拖沓的；缓慢费时的

examples.en: It’s been a dragging day at work.
examples.zh: 今天上班感觉特别漫长、拖沓。

examples.en: The meeting turned into a dragging discussion.
examples.zh: 会议变成了一场冗长拖沓的讨论。

definition.en: boring or lacking energy (often used about a story, speech, or activity)
definition.zh: 乏味的；没劲的（常形容故事、演讲或活动）

examples.en: The film started strong but became dragging in the middle.
examples.zh: 电影开头很精彩，但中段变得有点沉闷。

examples.en: His speech was informative, but parts of it felt dragging.
examples.zh: 他的演讲信息量很大，但有些部分听起来有点无聊拖沓。

extraExplanation: “dragging”常见两种用法：①动词-ing形式（进行时/作状语/作定语）：He is dragging… / the dragging sound（拖拽的声音）；②形容词，表示“拖沓、沉闷”，更偏主观感受。
口语里“dragging your feet”是常用表达，表示“磨蹭、故意拖延”，不一定真的在拖脚走。

summary.en: “Draggingly” means slowly and unwillingly, as if being dragged.
summary.zh: “draggingly”表示拖沓、缓慢且不情愿地，仿佛被拖着前进。

definition.en: In a slow, heavy, or reluctant way, as if something is being dragged along.
definition.zh: 缓慢、沉重或不情愿地（仿佛被拖着走）。

examples.en: He answered draggingly, clearly not wanting to continue the conversation.
examples.zh: 他拖拖拉拉地回答，明显不想继续这段对话。

examples.en: The afternoon passed draggingly, and everyone kept checking the clock.
examples.zh: 下午过得很拖沓，大家不停地看表。

examples.en: She walked draggingly up the stairs after a long day at work.
examples.zh: 工作了一整天后，她拖着沉重的步子上楼。

extraExplanation: “draggingly”来自动词“drag（拖拽）+ -ingly（副词/方式）”。它常用来形容时间、对话或行动“拖沓、难熬、费力”，带有一种“被拖着走”的画面感。
在日常口语里，人们更常说“slowly”“reluctantly”或“painfully slowly”。“draggingly”更偏书面或文学化，用来强调那种沉重、磨人的感觉。

summary.en: Draggle means to get (or make something) wet and dirty by dragging it along the ground, often describing clothes.
summary.zh: Draggle 指（把某物）拖在地上而弄得又湿又脏，常用于描述衣服下摆等。

definition.en: to make something (or become) wet, dirty, or messy by dragging it along the ground or through water/mud
definition.zh: （把某物）在地上或水/泥里拖着走而弄湿、弄脏、弄乱；（某物）被拖得又湿又脏

examples.en: The hem of her dress dragged in the rain and began to draggle.
examples.zh: 她的裙摆在雨里拖着走，开始变得又湿又脏。

examples.en: Don’t draggle the towel across the floor—it will get filthy.
examples.zh: 别把毛巾在地上拖来拖去——会弄得很脏。

examples.en: After the hike, their shoes were draggled with mud.
examples.zh: 徒步之后，他们的鞋子被泥弄得又湿又脏。

extraExplanation: “draggle”常让人联想到“拖得狼狈不堪”的画面，常见搭配有 draggle + hem/dress/skirt（把裙摆拖得又湿又脏）。
相关形容词更常见的是 draggle-tailed，形容衣服下摆拖得脏乱、整个人看起来邋遢狼狈（多用于文学或描写性语境）。

summary.en: “Draggled” means looking wet, dirty, and untidy, often after rain or being dragged through mud.
summary.zh: “draggled”指看起来又湿又脏又凌乱，常用于雨后或在泥地里折腾后显得很狼狈的样子。

definition.en: Wet, dirty, and messy-looking (often from rain, mud, or being dragged along the ground).
definition.zh: （常因雨水、泥污或被拖拽在地上而）湿漉漉、脏兮兮、显得邋遢不堪的。

examples.en: After walking home in the storm, she looked draggled and exhausted.
examples.zh: 暴风雨里走回家后，她看起来又湿又脏，还很疲惫。

examples.en: The draggled dog shook water all over the floor.
examples.zh: 那只湿漉漉的狗一甩身，把水甩得满地都是。

examples.en: His clothes were draggled with mud from the hike.
examples.zh: 徒步回来后，他的衣服沾满泥巴，显得很狼狈。

extraExplanation: “draggled”带有很强的画面感，常用来描写人或动物在雨中、泥地里、或经历折腾后“狼狈不堪”的外观，比单纯的“wet/dirty”更生动。
词源上与“drag（拖拽）”有关，暗示衣物或毛发像被拖在地上弄湿弄脏一样，因此常和“clothes / hair / look”搭配：draggled hair（湿乱的头发）、draggled clothes（又湿又脏的衣服）。
语体上偏文学/描写性，在日常口语中也能用，但不如“soaked”或“muddy”常见；写作时用它能更突出“又湿又乱又脏”的感觉。

summary.en: “Draggles” means (something long) trails and gets wet/dirty, or looks wet/dirty from dragging.
summary.zh: “draggles”指（长物）拖地而变得又湿又脏，也可指因此呈现出湿脏凌乱的样子。

definition.en: (of something long, like clothing or hair) to trail on the ground and become wet, dirty, or messy; also, to make something become wet/dirty by dragging it.
definition.zh: （指衣物、头发等较长的东西）拖在地上而变得又湿又脏、凌乱；也可指把某物拖得又湿又脏。

examples.en: Her long skirt draggles in the rain as she walks.
examples.zh: 她走路时长裙在雨里拖在地上，变得湿漉漉、脏兮兮的。

examples.en: Don’t let the curtain draggles on the floor—it will pick up dust.
examples.zh: 别让窗帘拖到地上——会沾满灰尘。

definition.en: (less common) wet, dirty, or ragged-looking because it has been dragged through water or mud.
definition.zh: （较少见）因在水里或泥里拖过而显得湿、脏、破旧的。

examples.en: He arrived with draggled hair after the storm.
examples.zh: 暴风雨后他赶到时头发湿乱不堪。

extraExplanation: “draggles”通常是动词“draggle”的第三人称单数（he/she/it draggles）或名词复数形式；但在现代英语里，这个词本身就比较少见，更常用的说法有“drag in the mud / get wet and dirty / bedraggled”。
相关形容词“bedraggled”更常见，常用来形容人或衣物“又湿又脏、狼狈不堪”。

summary.en: An old-fashioned, insulting word for a very untidy person, especially one with clothes that look like they’re dragging on the ground.
summary.zh: 一个偏旧且带侮辱性的词，指非常邋遢的人，尤指衣服（如裙摆）脏乱得像拖在地上。

definition.en: A person (often a woman in older usage) who is untidy or slovenly, especially with a long or trailing skirt/clothes; someone who looks as if their clothes are dragging on the ground.
definition.zh: （多为旧时用法，常指女性）邋遢、不修边幅的人；衣着脏乱、裙摆似乎拖地的人。

examples.en: In the old novel, the landlord sneers at her as a “draggletail” because her dress is muddy at the hem.
examples.zh: 在那部旧小说里，房东因为她裙摆沾满泥，讥讽她是个“draggletail”（邋遢鬼）。

examples.en: Don’t judge her—she’s been working all day and looks like a draggletail only because she’s exhausted.
examples.zh: 别急着评判她——她忙了一整天，只是累坏了才显得有点邋遢。

extraExplanation: 这是带有强烈贬义、且偏“古旧/文学化”的词，在现代日常英语里很少用；更常见的替代说法有 messy person, slob, shabby-looking（语气较中性可说 untidy）。
词源上可理解为 draggle（拖脏、弄湿）+ tail（尾巴/衣摆、裙摆的“尾部”），形象地指“衣摆拖在地上又脏又湿”的样子。

summary.en: Draggletailed describes something (especially a bird) with a tail dragging or hanging wet and dirty, and by extension a person who looks messy or worn out.
summary.zh: draggletailed 指（尤指鸟）尾巴拖地或湿脏下垂的样子，也可引申为人看起来邋遢、狼狈或憔悴。

definition.en: (of an animal, especially a bird) having a tail that is dragging on the ground, or hanging down wet and dirty; bedraggled-looking.
definition.zh: （指动物，尤指鸟）尾巴拖在地上，或湿漉漉、脏兮兮地耷拉着；看起来邋遢、落魄。

examples.en: A draggletailed hen wandered across the yard after the rain.
examples.zh: 雨后，一只尾巴湿漉漉、脏兮兮的母鸡在院子里晃来晃去。

examples.en: The sparrow looked draggletailed, its feathers clumped from the storm.
examples.zh: 那只麻雀看起来很狼狈，羽毛被暴风雨打得一绺一绺的。

definition.en: (figurative) looking messy, tired, or neglected in appearance.
definition.zh: （比喻）衣着或外表凌乱、疲惫、缺乏照料的。

examples.en: After the long trip, he arrived draggletailed and half-asleep.
examples.zh: 长途旅行后，他到达时一脸疲惫、衣着凌乱，几乎要睡着了。

examples.en: She felt draggletailed after weeks of overtime and little rest.
examples.zh: 连续加班、休息很少的几周后，她觉得自己整个人都很憔悴。

extraExplanation: 这个词由 draggle（在泥水里拖、弄得湿脏）+ tailed（有尾巴的）构成，语气带一点老派或文学色彩；现代英语里更常用的近义词是 bedraggled（邋遢、狼狈的）。
它常用来描写“雨后/风暴后羽毛或衣服湿黏下垂”的画面感，所以在叙事文学或描写场景时很有表现力。

summary.en: An uncommon adverb meaning “in a wet, muddy, and untidy (bedraggled) way.”
summary.zh: 一个不常见的副词，表示“湿脏邋遢、狼狈不堪地”。

definition.en: In a dirty, wet, or untidy way, as if your clothes (especially the hem) are dragging in mud or water; bedraggledly.
definition.zh: 以又脏又湿、衣着邋遢的样子（尤指衣摆像拖在泥水里一样）；狼狈不堪地。

examples.en: After the storm, he came home draggletailedly, with mud on his pants and water in his shoes.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，他狼狈地回到家，裤子上全是泥，鞋里也进了水。

examples.en: The stray dog trotted draggletailedly across the yard, soaked from the rain.
examples.zh: 那只流浪狗浑身被雨淋透，湿漉漉、邋邋遢遢地小跑过院子。

extraExplanation: “draggletailedly”来自形容词“draggle-tailed”，字面意思是“尾巴（或衣摆）拖在地上弄脏了”。早期也常用来形容衣服下摆被泥水拖得又湿又脏的样子。
这个词非常少见，写作或日常表达更常用“bedraggledly / untidily / in a bedraggled state”等更自然的说法。

summary.en: Draggletailedness means an untidy, dirty, bedraggled appearance—especially clothing that looks as if it has been dragged along the ground.
summary.zh: draggletailedness 指一种邋遢、脏乱、狼狈的外表状态，尤指衣服像在地上拖过一样又湿又脏。

definition.en: the state or quality of being draggletailed (dirty, wet, or untidy-looking, especially because clothes look like they have been dragged along the ground).
definition.zh: 拖泥带水般的邋遢、脏乱状态；指衣着或外表因像被拖在地上而显得又湿又脏、很不整洁的样子。

examples.en: After walking through the rain without an umbrella, her draggletailedness was obvious—mud on her hem and hair stuck to her face.
examples.zh: 没带伞在雨里走了一路后，她的“拖泥带水般的邋遢”一眼就能看出来——裙摆沾了泥，头发也黏在脸上。

examples.en: The novel describes the character’s draggletailedness to show how far she has fallen into poverty.
examples.zh: 小说用“拖泥带水般的邋遢”来描写这个人物，突出她贫困潦倒到什么程度。

extraExplanation: 这是一个非常少见、偏文学/描写性的名词，由形容词 draggletailed（衣服像拖地一样又脏又乱）加名词后缀 -ness 构成，表示“……的状态/性质”。
draggletailed 来自 draggle（弄湿弄脏、拖在地上）+ tail（像尾巴一样拖在后面），常用于形容衣摆、裤脚等“拖地”导致的狼狈感。现代英语更常用 bedraggled / shabbiness / slovenliness 来表达类似意思。

summary.en: Draggling describes something (often clothing) that is wet, dirty, and untidy from being dragged along the ground.
summary.zh: draggling 形容（常指衣物）因拖地或在泥水中拖过而变得又湿又脏、凌乱邋遢。

definition.en: wet, dirty, and untidy (especially clothes) as if they have been dragged along the ground or through mud/water
definition.zh: （尤指衣服）因在地上拖拽或在泥水中拖过而变得又湿又脏、邋遢的

examples.en: After the storm, her skirt was draggling with rainwater and mud.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，她的裙摆又湿又脏，像在泥水里拖过一样。

examples.en: He walked in with draggling shoes, leaving footprints on the floor.
examples.zh: 他鞋子又湿又脏地走进来，在地上留下脚印。

examples.en: The dog returned with draggling fur and a guilty look.
examples.zh: 那只狗毛发湿漉漉、脏兮兮地跑回来，一脸心虚。

extraExplanation: “draggling”来自动词 draggle（把……拖得又湿又脏），带有较强的书面/文学色彩，日常口语里更常说 muddy、soaked、soggy、dirty 或 “dragging on the ground”。它常用来描写衣摆、鞋子、毛发等“拖地后变得脏湿”的状态，也可引申为“邋遢、狼狈”。

summary.en: Draggly means untidy, worn, and hanging down messily.
summary.zh: draggly 指外观邋遢破旧、下垂拖沓、凌乱不整洁。

definition.en: Untidy and worn-looking; hanging down in a messy way (often about hair, clothes, or plants).
definition.zh: （外观）邋遢的、破旧的；（头发、衣物或植物等）下垂拖沓、凌乱的。

examples.en: After the storm, the flowers looked draggly and bent.
examples.zh: 暴风雨过后，花看起来东倒西歪、很拖沓凌乱。

examples.en: His draggly coat and muddy shoes made him look exhausted.
examples.zh: 他那件破旧邋遢的外套和沾满泥的鞋子让他显得很疲惫。

examples.en: She tied up her draggly hair before class.
examples.zh: 上课前她把凌乱下垂的头发扎了起来。

extraExplanation: “draggly”来自“drag”（拖、拖拽）。它常用来形容东西“像被拖着一样”松垮下垂、显得不整洁。
语气多为口语、带一点轻微的负面评价；用于形容外观状态，而不是人的品格。

summary.en: “Draggy” means slow and tedious, or (for clothes) so long that it drags on the ground.
summary.zh: “draggy”表示“拖沓乏味的；（衣物）过长而拖地的”。

definition.en: Slow, tedious, and seeming to take too long; lacking energy or excitement.
definition.zh: 缓慢而拖沓的；冗长乏味、让人觉得时间过得很慢的。

examples.en: The meeting felt draggy, with long pauses and no clear decisions.
examples.zh: 会议让人觉得很拖沓，停顿很久，也没有明确的决定。

examples.en: The movie starts strong but becomes draggy in the middle.
examples.zh: 这部电影开头很精彩，但中段变得拖沓。

examples.en: I’m more focused in the morning; afternoons can get draggy.
examples.zh: 我早上更专注；下午常常会变得没精神、拖拖拉拉。

definition.en: (Clothing) Hanging so low that it trails or rubs on the ground; likely to drag.
definition.zh: （衣物）太长而拖地的；容易在地上拖拉的。

examples.en: Her draggy skirt kept catching on the steps.
examples.zh: 她那条拖地的裙子老是卡在台阶上。

examples.en: These pants are a bit draggy—maybe I should hem them.
examples.zh: 这条裤子有点拖地——也许我该把裤脚改短。

extraExplanation: “draggy”来自动词“drag”（拖、拽）。形容节奏、过程或内容时，常带一点主观感受：不仅“慢”，还“让人觉得无聊/没劲”。口语和影评、工作场景里比较常见。

summary.en: A draghound is a dog trained to follow an artificial scent trail used in drag hunting.
summary.zh: draghound 指受训追踪人为气味路线、用于拖猎（仿猎）活动的猎犬。

definition.en: a hunting dog trained to follow an artificial scent trail (a “drag”), especially in drag hunting (a sport that imitates foxhunting without chasing a live animal)
definition.zh: （拖猎/仿猎中）受训沿着人为铺设的气味路线（“拖迹”）追踪的猎犬；尤指用于拖猎运动、模仿传统猎狐但不追逐活体动物的猎犬

examples.en: The draghound followed the laid scent trail across the fields without hesitation.
examples.zh: 这只拖猎犬毫不犹豫地沿着人为铺设的气味路线穿过田野。

examples.en: In drag hunting, a pack of draghounds chases a scent drag instead of a live fox.
examples.zh: 在拖猎运动中，一群拖猎犬追的是气味拖迹，而不是活狐狸。

extraExplanation: “draghound”常见于英国与爱尔兰的乡村狩猎文化语境中，和“drag hunting（拖猎/仿猎）”密切相关：组织者会提前用布条或液体气味沿途拖拽、留下“路线”，猎犬则追踪这条人工气味线。它常被视为比传统“foxhunting（猎狐）”更不伤害野生动物的替代形式，但仍带有浓厚的马术与乡村社交传统。

summary.en: “dragian” is not a standard English word; it’s usually a misspelling (often of “draconian”).
summary.zh: “dragian”不是标准英语词，通常是拼写错误（常见为“draconian”）。

definition.en: Not a standard English word; most often a misspelling or a name. In writing, it is commonly intended to be “draconian” (meaning extremely harsh).
definition.zh: 不是标准英语词；多见于拼写错误或人名。在英文写作中常被想表达为“draconian”（意为极其严厉的）。

examples.en: I couldn’t find “dragian” in the dictionary—did you mean “draconian”?
examples.zh: 我在词典里找不到“dragian”——你是不是想写“draconian”？

examples.en: The rules felt draconian, not “dragian,” so I corrected the spelling.
examples.zh: 这些规定让人觉得很严苛，应该是 draconian，不是“dragian”，所以我改了拼写。

extraExplanation: “dragian”更可能是拼写误差。最常见的目标词是 **draconian**（源自古希腊雅典立法者 Draco 的名字，因法律过于严酷而出名），意思是“极端严厉的、苛刻的”。如果你能贴出原句，我也可以帮你判断它本来想表达哪个词。

summary.en: Dragline usually means a cable-operated excavator used in mining, or more generally a strong line/cable used for dragging.
summary.zh: dragline 常指采矿等工程中使用的拉铲挖掘机；也可泛指用于拖拽的绳索或钢缆。

definition.en: A large excavating machine (a type of crane) that uses a long boom and a bucket dragged by cables to remove earth or overburden, especially in mining.
definition.zh: 一种大型挖掘机械（类似起重机），用长臂和用钢缆拖拽的铲斗来挖掘土石，常用于露天采矿等工程。

examples.en: The mine brought in a dragline to strip away the topsoil.
examples.zh: 矿场调来一台拉铲挖掘机来剥离表土。

examples.en: A dragline can move huge amounts of material, but it needs a lot of space to operate.
examples.zh: 拉铲挖掘机能搬运大量物料，但作业需要很大的空间。

definition.en: A strong line or cable used for dragging or pulling something along the ground or through water.
definition.zh: 用于在地面或水中拖拽、牵引物体的结实绳索或钢缆。

examples.en: They attached a dragline to the log to pull it out of the mud.
examples.zh: 他们把拖拽绳系在原木上，把它从泥里拉出来。

examples.en: The crew used a dragline to tow the small boat back to shore.
examples.zh: 船员用拖缆把小船拖回岸边。

extraExplanation: “dragline”在工程与采矿语境里最常指“拉铲挖掘机”。它的铲斗不是像常见挖掘机那样用液压臂直接挖，而是靠钢缆把铲斗“拖”出去、再拉回，因此适合远距离、大体量的挖掘与剥离作业。
相关词：dragline excavator（拉铲挖掘机）；overburden（覆盖层/表土，采矿中需先移除的土石）。

summary.en: “Draglines” is the plural of “dragline,” most commonly meaning large cable-operated excavating machines; it can also mean lines that are dragged for fishing or towing.
summary.zh: draglines 是 dragline 的复数，最常指钢缆牵引式的大型拖铲挖掘机；也可指用于拖拉（如拖钓或牵引）的绳线。

definition.en: (plural of dragline) a large excavating machine that uses a long boom and a bucket pulled by cables, often used in mining and big construction projects.
definition.zh: （dragline 的复数）一种大型挖掘机械，带长臂和用钢缆牵引的挖斗，常用于采矿和大型工程。

examples.en: The open-pit mine uses draglines to remove the top layer of earth.
examples.zh: 这座露天矿用拖铲挖掘机来移除表层土。

examples.en: Several draglines worked day and night on the construction site.
examples.zh: 几台拖铲挖掘机在工地上昼夜作业。

definition.en: (plural of dragline) a line (rope or cord) that is pulled along the ground or through water, especially in fishing or towing.
definition.zh: （dragline 的复数）一种在地面或水中被拖拉的绳线，尤指拖钓或牵引用的绳线。

examples.en: The fishermen set their draglines near the shore at dusk.
examples.zh: 渔民在黄昏时把拖钓线布在近岸。

examples.en: Check the draglines for damage before you pull the net.
examples.zh: 拉网前先检查拖拉绳线是否有损坏。

extraExplanation: “dragline（拖铲挖掘机）”在英美工程与采矿语境中很常见，尤其与“open-pit mine（露天矿）”“overburden（覆盖层土）”等词常搭配。日常生活中更常见的是“excavator（挖掘机）”，而 dragline 是其中一种更专门、更大型的类型。

summary.en: A dragman is a worker who drags or hauls heavy things, especially in older contexts involving a heavy cart or hauling equipment.
summary.zh: dragman 指拖运、搬运重物的工人，多见于较旧语境，常与重型拖运车或拖拉设备有关。

definition.en: a worker whose job is to drag or haul something heavy; historically, a person who drove or worked with a “drag” (a heavy cart or sled used for hauling)
definition.zh: 拖运工；拉车工（旧称：负责拖拉、搬运重物的人；也指驾驭或使用“drag”（一种用于拖运的重型车/雪橇）的人）

examples.en: In old mining towns, a dragman might haul supplies from the station to the camp.
examples.zh: 在早期的矿镇里，拖运工可能把物资从车站运到营地。

examples.en: The company hired a dragman to pull the logs out of the muddy road.
examples.zh: 公司雇了一个拖运工把原木从泥泞的路上拖出来。

extraExplanation: “dragman”在现代英语中很少见，带有历史/行业色彩。这里的drag不是“变装皇后（drag）”，而更接近“拖拉用的工具或重型车（a drag）”。因此dragman常出现在较旧的文本、地方史、矿业/伐木等语境中。

summary.en: Dragnet usually means a large-scale police search; it can also mean a fishing net pulled through water, or figuratively a broad net that catches many people/things.
summary.zh: dragnet 常指警方的大规模搜捕行动；也可指拖网捕鱼的大网；引申为“撒大网”式覆盖很多人/事物的系统或措施。

definition.en: a coordinated police search or operation (often with checkpoints and many officers) to catch a criminal or find someone/something
definition.zh: （警方的）大规模搜捕行动；（常指设卡、多人协同行动的）搜查/围捕

examples.en: Police set up a dragnet across the city to find the escaped prisoner.
examples.zh: 警方在全城布下大搜捕行动，寻找逃犯。

examples.en: A dragnet operation led to dozens of arrests.
examples.zh: 一次大规模围捕行动导致数十人被捕。

definition.en: a large net that is pulled through water (or along the bottom) to catch fish
definition.zh: 拖网（在水中或沿海底拖行以捕鱼的大网）

examples.en: The fishermen used a dragnet to catch shrimp.
examples.zh: 渔民用拖网捕鱼虾。

definition.en: (figurative) a broad system or process that tries to catch or include many people or things, sometimes unfairly
definition.zh: （比喻）“大网式”的搜罗/管控系统；（有时含不公或牵连无辜之意）

examples.en: The new rule casts a dragnet over small businesses as well as big ones.
examples.zh: 这项新规定像撒大网一样，把小企业和大企业都罩了进去。

examples.en: Critics say the policy creates a dragnet that targets innocent people.
examples.zh: 批评者认为该政策形成“拖网式”抓捕，可能牵连无辜。

extraExplanation: “dragnet”原指“拖网捕鱼”（drag=拖，net=网），后来引申为警方“撒大网”式搜捕。这个词在新闻报道里很常见，语气通常较正式。
美国还有一部经典警匪广播剧/电视剧《Dragnet》（20世纪中期），使这个词在流行文化中更广为人知。

summary.en: Dragnets are either large fishing nets dragged through water or wide, organized police searches to catch someone.
summary.zh: dragnets 可指（渔业）拖网，也可指（警方）大范围、有组织的搜捕/搜查。

definition.en: Large nets dragged through water to catch fish.
definition.zh: （渔业）拖网：在水中被拖拽前进、用来捕捞鱼类的大网。

examples.en: Some fishing boats use dragnets to catch large numbers of fish at once.
examples.zh: 一些渔船使用拖网一次捕捞大量鱼类。

examples.en: The new rules limit the use of dragnets to protect sea life.
examples.zh: 新规定限制拖网的使用，以保护海洋生物。

definition.en: Organized police searches over a wide area to catch a suspect; a broad sweep to find people or things.
definition.zh: （警方）大搜捕/大范围搜查：在较大区域内进行的系统性搜查，用于抓捕嫌疑人或寻找目标。

examples.en: Police set up dragnets around the city after the robbery.
examples.zh: 抢劫案发生后，警方在全市范围内布下大搜捕。

examples.en: The investigation led to dragnets at airports and train stations.
examples.zh: 调查引发了在机场和火车站进行的大范围搜查。

extraExplanation: “dragnet”本义来自“drag（拖拽）+ net（网）”，先指渔业的“拖网”。后来引申到执法语境，强调“像拖网一样全面扫过”的搜查方式。

summary.en: Drago is mainly used as a personal name (often Slavic in origin) and is also widely known from the fictional character Ivan Drago in *Rocky IV*.
summary.zh: Drago 主要作为人名使用（多与斯拉夫语来源有关），也因电影《洛奇4》中的虚构角色伊万·德拉戈而广为人知。

definition.en: A personal name (given name or surname), common in Slavic-language regions; it is often connected to roots meaning “dear,” “beloved,” or “precious.”
definition.zh: 人名（名或姓），在斯拉夫语地区较常见；常与表示“亲爱的 / 被珍爱 / 珍贵”的词根有关。

examples.en: Drago is a common surname in some parts of Eastern Europe.
examples.zh: Drago 在东欧一些地区是比较常见的姓氏。

examples.en: His first name is Drago, but his friends call him by a nickname.
examples.zh: 他名叫 Drago，但朋友们会用昵称称呼他。

definition.en: In popular culture, a well-known fictional surname, especially “Ivan Drago,” a boxer character from the film *Rocky IV* (1985).
definition.zh: 在流行文化中，一个很有名的虚构姓氏，尤其指电影《洛奇4》（1985）中的拳击手角色“伊万·德拉戈（Ivan Drago）”。

examples.en: People often recognize the name Drago from *Rocky IV*.
examples.zh: 很多人是通过《洛奇4》认识 Drago 这个名字的。

examples.en: He joked that he would train like Ivan Drago.
examples.zh: 他开玩笑说自己要像伊万·德拉戈那样训练。

extraExplanation: “Drago”在不同国家的拼写与发音可能略有变化；它常与斯拉夫语词根 *drag-*（意为“亲爱的、珍爱的”）相关，也会出现在更长的名字里（如 Dragan、Dragomir 等）。
在英语语境里，它很多时候被当作专有名词使用（人名/角色名），通常不翻译其“字面意思”，而是按音译或保留原名。

summary.en: Drago is mainly used as a name (surname/given name), and it can also mean “dragon” in Italian.
summary.zh: Drago 主要用作人名/姓氏；在意大利语中也可表示“龙”。

definition.en: a male given name or surname (used for some real people and fictional characters).
definition.zh: 男性名字或姓氏（用于一些真实人物与虚构角色）。

examples.en: Ivan Drago is the boxer in the movie Rocky IV.
examples.zh: Ivan Drago 是电影《洛奇4》里的拳击手。

examples.en: Drago is a common-sounding surname in some European contexts.
examples.zh: Drago 在一些欧洲语境中听起来像常见的姓氏。

definition.en: the Italian word for “dragon.” (Often seen in names, brand names, or fantasy contexts.)
definition.zh: 意大利语中“龙”的意思（常见于人名、品牌名或奇幻语境）。

examples.en: The café is called Il Drago, meaning “The Dragon.”
examples.zh: 这家咖啡馆叫 Il Drago，意思是“龙”。

examples.en: In fantasy stories, you might see “Drago” used as a dragon’s name.
examples.zh: 在奇幻故事里，你可能会看到 “Drago” 被用作龙的名字。

extraExplanation: “Drago”在英语里最常被当作专有名词（人名/姓氏）来理解，尤其因为电影《Rocky IV》里的角色 Ivan Drago，使这个名字在流行文化中更有辨识度。
在一些斯拉夫语族里，类似形式（如 Drago-, Dragan 等）常与“珍贵/亲爱的”或“龙”相关的词根有关；具体含义会因语言与地区而不同。

summary.en: A dragoman is a historical term for an interpreter and guide, especially in Middle Eastern/North African travel and diplomacy.
summary.zh: dragoman是历史用语，指翻译兼向导，常见于中东/北非的旅行与外交语境。

definition.en: an interpreter and guide, especially one who translated between Europeans and people in the Middle East or North Africa (a historical term)
definition.zh: （历史用语）翻译兼向导，尤指在中东或北非为欧洲人与当地人做口译并协助联络的人

examples.en: The embassy hired a dragoman to interpret at official meetings.
examples.zh: 使馆雇了一位dragoman在正式会谈中做口译。
