extraExplanation: “drawbeam”不是日常英语里的常用词，更常见于特定行业或设备说明书里。不同领域对它的指代可能不完全一致：有时泛指“用于牵引/拉动的梁”，在织造语境中则更接近“与经纱卷绕、引经、张力控制相关的梁”。
如果你是在某个图纸、说明书或游戏/软件里看到的“drawbeam”，把上下文（句子或图片）发来，我可以帮你确定更准确的对应含义与译法。

summary.en: DrawBench is a benchmark used to evaluate and compare text-to-image generation models.
summary.zh: DrawBench 是用于评测与对比文生图生成模型的基准。

definition.en: a benchmark dataset and evaluation framework used to compare the quality of text-to-image generation models, often by scoring how well images match prompts and how appealing they look
definition.zh: 用于比较文生图（text-to-image）生成模型质量的基准数据集与评测框架，常通过评估图像与提示词的匹配度和视觉效果来打分

examples.en: The team used DrawBench to compare two text-to-image models on the same set of prompts.
examples.zh: 团队用 DrawBench 在同一组提示词上对比了两个文生图模型。

examples.en: On DrawBench, the new model did better on prompts that require counting and spatial relations.
examples.zh: 在 DrawBench 上，新模型在需要计数和空间关系的提示词上表现更好。

extraExplanation: DrawBench 常出现在生成式 AI 论文与博客里，属于“基准测试（benchmark）”的一种：用固定的提示词集合来让不同模型生成图片，再用人工或自动指标做对比。
名称一般理解为 draw（画）+ bench（bench/benchmark 的缩写或联想），强调“用来评测画图能力的基准”。不同文章可能会对其具体版本、提示词数量和评分方式有所调整。

summary.en: Drawboard most commonly refers to a weaving device used to control warp threads for patterned cloth.
summary.zh: Drawboard最常指织布时用来控制经线、织出花纹的提花装置。

definition.en: a device used in weaving (especially with a drawloom) to control groups of warp threads so patterns can be made.
definition.zh: （织布用语）提花装置/拉花装置：用于控制经线分组，从而织出花纹的设备（常见于提花织机/拉花织机）。

examples.en: The weaver used a drawboard to create repeating floral patterns.
examples.zh: 织工用提花装置织出重复的花卉图案。

examples.en: In traditional workshops, the drawboard was operated by an assistant.
examples.zh: 在传统作坊里，提花装置常由助手操作。

extraExplanation: “drawboard”并不是日常英语里很常见的词；更常见的相关表达是“drawing board”（画板/制图板）或比喻义“go back to the drawing board”（推倒重来，从头再来）。如果你原本想查的是“drawing board”，我也可以按该词条再给你更常用的解释与例句。

summary.en: A drawbolt is a sliding bolt used to secure a door or gate; it can also mean to fasten something using that bolt.
summary.zh: drawbolt 指用来锁门或栅门的滑动插销；也可作动词，表示“用插销把门闩上”。

definition.en: A sliding metal bolt used as a door or gate fastener; you slide it to lock or unlock.
definition.zh: （门或门闩上的）插销；滑动式门栓，用来把门/栅栏锁住或打开。

examples.en: She slid the drawbolt across and checked that the door was secure.
examples.zh: 她把插销推过去，并确认门已经锁牢。

examples.en: The garden gate has a simple drawbolt instead of a key lock.
examples.zh: 花园的栅门用的是简单的插销，而不是钥匙锁。

definition.en: To fasten (a door or gate) with a sliding bolt.
definition.zh: 用插销把（门或栅栏）插上；上门栓。

examples.en: Please drawbolt the back door before you go to bed.
examples.zh: 睡前请把后门插上门栓。

examples.en: He drawbolted the shed and walked away.
examples.zh: 他把工具棚插上插销就走了。

extraExplanation: “drawbolt”多用于英式或较传统的五金/建筑语境，指那种用手“拉/推”来滑动的门栓。现代口语里也常用更通用的说法：bolt（门闩/插销）、sliding bolt（滑动插销）、door bolt（门栓）。

summary.en: Drawbore is a woodworking method (and the verb for doing it) that uses slightly offset holes and a peg to pull a mortise-and-tenon joint tightly together.
summary.zh: Drawbore（抽紧榫）是一种木工连接法（也可作动词），通过略微错位的孔位和木钉把榫卯拉紧固定。

definition.en: a woodworking joint where a peg (dowel) is driven through slightly offset holes in a mortise-and-tenon joint to pull (“draw”) the joint tightly together, often without glue
definition.zh: （木工）抽紧榫：在榫卯（尤其是榫头-榫眼）结构中，将木钉穿过“略微错位”的孔位，把两部分“拉紧”咬合在一起的连接方式，常可不靠胶水

examples.en: The chair frame is drawbored, so the joints stay tight even after years of use.
examples.zh: 这把椅子的框架用了抽紧榫，所以用了很多年榫卯依然很紧。

examples.en: He drawbored the mortise-and-tenon joint with an oak peg.
examples.zh: 他用橡木木钉给这处榫卯做了抽紧榫处理。

definition.en: to make a drawbore joint by drilling slightly offset holes and driving in a peg to pull the joint tight
definition.zh: （木工）做抽紧榫：钻出略微错位的孔并打入木钉，使榫卯被拉紧固定

examples.en: You can drawbore the joint to lock it mechanically, even without clamps.
examples.zh: 你可以用抽紧榫把结构“机械锁住”，即使不用夹具也能固定。

examples.en: We drawbored the gate’s frame to keep it from loosening outdoors.
examples.zh: 我们给大门框架做了抽紧榫，避免它在户外久了变松。

extraExplanation: “drawbore”由 draw（拉紧）+ bore（钻孔）构成。关键点是：先把榫头插入榫眼后，标记孔位；再在榫头上把孔位向肩部方向“微移”一点点（常见约0.5–2毫米，取决于尺寸与木材），这样木钉打进去时会把榫头“拉”向肩部，形成自紧效果。
这种工艺常见于传统家具、门框、木结构（timber framing）。优点是结实、抗松动；但偏移量过大可能导致开裂或无法打入木钉。

summary.en: “Drawbored” is a woodworking term meaning a mortise-and-tenon joint was tightened and pinned by drilling slightly offset holes and driving in a peg.
summary.zh: “drawbored”是木工术语，指通过孔位略微错开并打入木钉，把榫卯结构拉紧并固定。

definition.en: past tense/past participle of “drawbore”: to fasten a mortise-and-tenon joint by drilling slightly offset holes and driving in a wooden peg so the joint is pulled tightly together
definition.zh: “drawbore”的过去式/过去分词：在榫卯结构中把孔位故意错开一点再打入木钉，使榫头被“拉紧”并牢牢固定

examples.en: The chair frame was drawbored, so it stayed tight without any glue.
examples.zh: 这把椅子的框架用了“错孔穿销”（drawbore）工艺，所以不用胶也很牢。

examples.en: He drawbored the joint with oak pegs for extra strength.
examples.zh: 他用橡木木钉把榫卯做成错孔穿销，以增加强度。

definition.en: describing a joint that has been fastened using the drawbore method
definition.zh: （形容词用法）指已经用错孔穿销法固定好的榫卯连接

examples.en: A drawbored mortise-and-tenon joint is common in traditional timber framing.
examples.zh: 错孔穿销的榫卯连接在传统木结构建筑中很常见。

extraExplanation: “drawbored”并不是日常英语里常见的词，主要出现在木工、传统木结构（timber framing）等语境中。
原理是：木钉孔在榫头与卯眼两侧略微“错位”，钉子被敲入时会把榫头“拉”进卯眼，从而让连接更紧、更抗松动。

summary.en: “Drawbores” are drawbore holes used in woodworking to pull a pegged joint tight (or the process of making them).
summary.zh: “Drawbores”指木工中用于穿销拉紧榫接的钻孔（也可指制作这些孔的过程）。

definition.en: (Woodworking) Holes made for a drawbore joint—an offset pegged joint where a wooden pin pulls (“draws”) the parts tightly together.
definition.zh: （木工）穿销拉紧榫接（drawbore joint）所钻的孔；这种孔通常有轻微错位，用木销把两块木料“拉”得更紧。

examples.en: The chair legs felt solid because the drawbores were slightly offset, pulling the joint tight.
examples.zh: 这把椅子的腿很牢固，因为 drawbores 的孔位略微错开，把榫接拉得更紧。

examples.en: After drilling the drawbores, he drove in hardwood pegs to lock the frame together.
examples.zh: 钻好 drawbores 之后，他把硬木木销敲进去，把框架锁紧。

definition.en: The act or process of making drawbore holes (often referred to as “drawboring”).
definition.zh: 制作 drawbore 孔的过程（常称为 drawboring）。

examples.en: Drawbores take planning, but they make strong joints without metal fasteners.
examples.zh: 做 drawbores 需要先规划，但能在不用金属紧固件的情况下做出很结实的接头。

extraExplanation: 在传统木作里，drawbore 的关键是“孔位错开”：先在榫眼（mortise）那块木料上钻孔，再把榫头（tenon）插入，借孔位在榫头上做标记，但把榫头上的孔向肩部方向微微移动一点点（offset）。这样打入木销时，木销会把榫头“拉”进榫眼里，形成自锁、紧密的结构。
常见相关词：drawbore joint（穿销拉紧榫接）、drawbore peg（穿销木销）、drawboring（穿销工艺/过程）。

summary.en: “drawboring” isn’t a standard English word; it’s likely a merged phrase or a misspelling.
summary.zh: “drawboring”不是标准英语单词，可能是把短语连写或拼写有误。

definition.en: Not a standard English word. It looks like a misspelling or a merged phrase (for example, “draw boring” or “drawing is boring”).
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词。看起来像拼写错误或把短语连在一起（例如“draw boring”或“drawing is boring”）。

examples.en: I can’t find “drawboring” in a dictionary—did you mean “boring” or “drawing”?
examples.zh: 我在词典里找不到“drawboring”——你是不是想查“boring”或“drawing”？

examples.en: If you mean “drawing is boring,” you can say: “Drawing is boring for me.”
examples.zh: 如果你想表达“画画很无聊”，可以说：“Drawing is boring for me.”

extraExplanation: “drawboring”这种连写形式在英语里不常见，除非是用户名、标签（hashtag）或自造词。
如果你告诉我你想表达的意思（例如：想说“画画很无聊”、还是想查“boring（无聊的）”、或“draw（画/拉/抽签）”），我可以给你对应的标准词条、发音和更多例句。

summary.en: A historical term for a young assistant who helped a weaver operate a drawloom by pulling cords to create patterns.
summary.zh: 历史用语：在提花织机旁拉绳协助织工织出花纹的少年助手。

definition.en: In historical weaving, a young assistant who helped operate a drawloom by pulling cords to lift warp threads and form complex patterns.
definition.zh: （历史上的纺织/织造）提花童工；在提花织机（drawloom）旁拉绳、提起经线以织出复杂花纹的男孩/学徒。

examples.en: In the old workshop, a drawboy pulled the cords while the weaver guided the shuttle.
examples.zh: 在旧式作坊里，提花童工负责拉绳，而织工负责引梭。

examples.en: The pattern was so detailed that the loom needed a weaver and a drawboy working together.
examples.zh: 花纹太精细了，这台织机需要织工和提花童工配合操作。

extraExplanation: “drawboy”常写作“draw-boy”，多见于历史语境（尤其与欧洲的提花织机 drawloom 有关）。因为当时织出复杂纹样需要一人织布、另一人拉动绳索控制经线，所以会出现这种助手角色；现代工业织机出现后，这个职位基本消失。
如果你想表达的是“画画的男孩 / 画一个男孩”，英语通常会说“a boy who draws”或“draw a boy”，而不是“drawboy”。

summary.en: A drawbridge is a bridge that can be raised or opened, especially at a castle or over water; it can also mean to raise such a bridge.
summary.zh: drawbridge 指可升起或打开的桥（尤指城堡吊桥或可开启的桥）；也可作动词表示“升起/打开吊桥”。

definition.en: A bridge that can be raised or opened (often like two hinged sections) to let boats pass or to protect an entrance, especially in castles.
definition.zh: 可升起或打开的桥（常见为两段铰接式），用于让船只通过或保护入口，尤指城堡的护城河吊桥。

examples.en: The drawbridge lifted to let the tall ship enter the harbor.
examples.zh: 吊桥升起，让高大的船只驶入港口。

examples.en: In old movies, soldiers stand guard as the castle drawbridge comes down.
examples.zh: 在老电影里，城堡的吊桥放下时，士兵在旁站岗。

definition.en: To raise or open a drawbridge.
definition.zh: 升起或打开吊桥。

examples.en: At night, they drawbridge the entrance to keep strangers out.
examples.zh: 夜里，他们把入口的吊桥升起，防止陌生人进入。

extraExplanation: “drawbridge”里的 draw 原意是“拉、拖”，表示用绳索、链条或机械把桥“拉起来”。现代城市里常见的类似结构也会被叫作 drawbridge 或 movable bridge。
在文学和影视中，drawbridge 常用来营造“防御、隔绝、进入城堡/内心世界”的意象：放下表示欢迎或进入，升起表示拒绝或自我保护。

summary.en: Drawbridges are bridges that can be lifted or moved to allow ships through or to protect an entrance.
summary.zh: Drawbridges 指可升起或移动的桥，用于让船只通过或防御入口。

definition.en: a bridge that can be raised, lowered, or moved to let boats pass or to protect an entrance (especially in castles or over canals)
definition.zh: 可升降桥；吊桥（可抬起/放下或移动，让船只通过，或用于防御入口，常见于城堡或运河）

examples.en: In the movie, the guards raised the drawbridge to keep enemies out.
examples.zh: 在电影里，卫兵把吊桥升起来，防止敌人进入。

examples.en: The drawbridge goes up several times a day to let large boats pass.
examples.zh: 这座可升降桥每天会升起好几次，让大型船只通过。

extraExplanation: “drawbridge”常让人联想到中世纪城堡：桥的一端连接城门，遇到危险时可以拉起，形成防御。现代城市里也有“drawbridge”（或更广义的“movable bridge”），多用于航道上，让船只通过。
词源上，draw- 这里有“拉起、牵引”的意思，并不是“画画（draw）”的那个含义。

summary.en: “Drawcansir” is not a recognized English word; it’s probably a typo, name, or combined words.
summary.zh: “Drawcansir”不是公认的英文单词，可能是拼写错误、名字/用户名，或多个词的组合。

definition.en: Not a standard English word. It is likely a misspelling, a name/username, or a concatenation of words (e.g., “draw + can + sir”).
definition.zh: 不是标准英文单词。更可能是拼写错误、姓名/用户名，或把多个词连在一起（例如“draw + can + sir”）。

examples.en: I can’t find “Drawcansir” in an English dictionary—did you mean a different word?
examples.zh: 我在英文词典里找不到“Drawcansir”——你是不是想写别的词？

examples.en: “Drawcansir” looks like a username rather than a common English word.
examples.zh: “Drawcansir”看起来更像用户名，而不是常见英文词。

extraExplanation:
我可能需要你多给一点信息，才能准确解释：
1）你是在什么句子/场景里看到“Drawcansir”的？
2）你想表达的意思是什么（中文也可以）？
3）它是否可能是这些词之一的拼写：draw（画/拉）、cancer（癌症/巨蟹座）、draconian（严苛的）、或其他？
把原句发我，我可以帮你判断最可能的正确拼写与含义。

summary.en: “drawcansir” is not a recognized English word; it’s likely a typo or multiple words combined.
summary.zh: “drawcansir”不是常见英语词，可能是拼写错误或多个词连写。

definition.en: Not a standard English word. It looks like a misspelling or several words typed together (for example: “draw”, “can”, “sir”).
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词。看起来像拼写错误或把多个词连在一起输入（例如：draw、can、sir）。

examples.en: “drawcansir” isn’t in most English dictionaries—did you mean “draw” or “cancer”?
examples.zh: “drawcansir”在大多数英语词典里找不到——你想表达的是“draw”还是“cancer”吗？

examples.en: If you tell me the sentence you saw it in, I can help you identify the correct word.
examples.zh: 如果你告诉我它出现的句子语境，我可以帮你判断正确的单词。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“drawcansir”很可能是：①拼写错误；②把几个词连着打了；③某个用户名/代号/游戏ID。最常见的拆分联想是 draw（画/拉）+ can（能/罐头）+ sir（先生）。
如果你是想查某个具体词，请发：1）原句或截图；2）你想表达的中文意思；3）是否为专有名词（人名/地名/ID）。我就能给出准确释义与用法。

summary.en: “Drawcard” most commonly means a main attraction that brings people in; in card games, it’s usually written as “draw a card,” meaning to take a card from a deck.
summary.zh: “Drawcard”最常见义为“招徕点/主要看点”；在纸牌游戏里通常写作“draw a card”，表示“从牌堆抽一张牌”。

definition.en: a person, thing, or feature that attracts people’s attention and makes them want to come (especially to an event, show, or place).
definition.zh: （尤指活动、演出或地点的）招徕点；吸引人的人物/事物；卖点

examples.en: The famous singer is the main drawcard of the festival.
examples.zh: 那位著名歌手是这个音乐节最主要的招徕点。

examples.en: Free samples can be a big drawcard for customers.
examples.zh: 免费试吃/试用对顾客来说可能是很大的吸引点。

definition.en: to take one card from a deck (common in card games). Usually written as “draw a card.”
definition.zh: （从牌堆中）抽一张牌（常用于纸牌游戏；通常写作“draw a card”）。

examples.en: At the start of your turn, draw a card.
examples.zh: 在你回合开始时，抽一张牌。

examples.en: If you have no cards left, you can’t draw a card.
examples.zh: 如果你手里/牌库里没牌了，你就不能再抽牌。

extraExplanation: “drawcard”作名词时，在英式英语、澳新英语里更常见；美式英语里更常用“draw”（如：The show’s big draw is the actor.）或“main attraction”。
在市场营销语境中，drawcard 接近“卖点/亮点/引流点”，常用来描述能“带来人流”的关键因素。

summary.en: “Drawcut / draw cut” means a slicing cut made by pulling (drawing) the blade along the target.
summary.zh: “drawcut / draw cut”指“抽切/拉切”：刀刃在拉带移动中完成切割。

definition.en: a cutting action made while pulling (drawing) a blade along the target, rather than chopping straight down; often used in swordsmanship and some knife techniques.
definition.zh: （拉）抽刀式切割：刀刃一边向后拉（抽、带）一边割开目标，而不是垂直劈砍；常见于剑术与某些刀法。

examples.en: In fencing practice, he used a draw cut to make the blade bite more deeply.
examples.zh: 在击剑训练中，他用抽切让刀刃切得更深。

examples.en: A draw cut can be safer and more controlled than a hard chop when using a knife.
examples.zh: 用刀时，抽切往往比用力劈砍更安全、更容易控制。

definition.en: to cut by pulling a blade across something, using a slicing motion while drawing the blade toward you or along the surface.
definition.zh: 用抽切方式切：刀刃贴着表面移动，并在拉动（或带动）刀刃的同时完成切割。

examples.en: Draw-cut the rope instead of hacking at it.
examples.zh: 用抽切把绳子割断，不要乱砍。

examples.en: He draw-cut the meat into thin slices.
examples.zh: 他用抽切把肉切成了薄片。

extraExplanation: “draw cut”也常写作“draw-cut”（加连字符），更强调它是一个固定术语。
在武术/剑术语境里，draw cut强调“拉带产生的切割”，通常比“chop（劈）”更依赖刀刃角度与连续移动。
如果你原本想查的是“die-cut / drag-cut / drawknife”等类似词，也可以告诉我具体语境（印刷、雕刻、刀具或格斗），我可以帮你区分。

summary.en: Drawdown most commonly means a fall from a previous peak (especially in investing), and it can also mean withdrawing/using funds or a reduction of resources or troops.
summary.zh: Drawdown 最常指（尤其投资中的）从高点回撤/下跌；也可指提款/支用资金，或资源与兵力的减少/撤出。

definition.en: a decline from a previous high point, especially in finance (a fall in value, performance, or profits).
definition.zh: （从高点）回撤；下跌（尤指金融中资产价值、业绩或利润从高位下降）。

examples.en: The fund experienced a 12% drawdown during the market crash.
examples.zh: 市场暴跌期间，这只基金出现了12%的回撤。

examples.en: Investors worry about drawdowns as much as they care about returns.
examples.zh: 投资者在意回报的同时，也同样担心回撤。

definition.en: the act of taking money out of an account or using part of a loan or credit line.
definition.zh: 提款；支用（从账户取钱，或使用贷款/授信额度的一部分）。

examples.en: You can make a drawdown from your mortgage in stages as construction progresses.
examples.zh: 你可以在施工推进时分阶段从按揭贷款中支用资金。

examples.en: The company made a large drawdown on its credit facility to cover payroll.
examples.zh: 公司从授信额度中大额支用资金以支付工资。

definition.en: a reduction in the level of something such as supplies, resources, or troops; a withdrawal.
definition.zh: （物资/资源/兵力等的）减少；调走；撤出。

examples.en: There was a drawdown of medical supplies after the emergency.
examples.zh: 紧急情况过后，医疗物资储备有所减少。

examples.en: The plan called for a gradual drawdown of troops.
examples.zh: 该计划要求逐步撤军。

extraExplanation: 在投资语境里，drawdown 常指“最大回撤（maximum drawdown）”：从某一阶段的最高净值跌到之后最低点的最大跌幅，用来衡量风险与抗跌能力。常见搭配：deep drawdown（深度回撤）、recover from a drawdown（从回撤中恢复）。
与 withdrawal 相比，drawdown 更常用于“逐步支用/动用额度”或“从峰值回落”的专业语境；withdrawal 更泛指取款/撤离。

summary.en: “Drawdowns” is the plural of “drawdown,” meaning declines from a peak (finance), withdrawals from funds/credit, or lowered water levels.
summary.zh: drawdowns 是 drawdown 的复数，可指（金融）从高点回落的回撤、（资金）提款/动用额，或（水文/工程）水位下降。

definition.en: (Finance) A decline from a previous peak in the value of an investment or account (often measured as a percentage).
definition.zh: （金融）投资或账户价值从此前高点回落的幅度（常以百分比衡量）。

examples.en: The fund experienced a 20% drawdown during the market crash.
examples.zh: 在市场暴跌期间，这只基金出现了20%的回撤。

examples.en: Investors compare strategies by looking at returns and maximum drawdown.
examples.zh: 投资者会通过收益率和最大回撤来比较不同策略。

definition.en: (Banking/Accounting) Money taken out from an account, budget, or credit line; a withdrawal or amount used.
definition.zh: （银行/会计）从账户、预算或授信额度中提取/动用的资金；支取额、动用额。

examples.en: There were several drawdowns from the construction loan this month.
examples.zh: 这个月这笔建筑贷款发生了多次提款（动用）。

examples.en: The project’s cash drawdowns must be documented for auditing.
examples.zh: 项目的资金支取必须留档以备审计。

definition.en: (Environmental/Engineering) A lowering of a water level (for example, in a reservoir or groundwater).
definition.zh: （环境/工程）水位下降（例如水库水位或地下水位下降）。

examples.en: Heavy pumping caused drawdowns in the groundwater level.
examples.zh: 大量抽水导致地下水位下降。

extraExplanation: 在投资语境中，drawdown 常与“最大回撤（maximum drawdown）”一起出现，用来衡量风险：它关注的是“从最高点到最低点跌了多少”，而不是单日跌幅。它能帮助你理解一段时间内可能承受的最坏亏损程度。

summary.en: A drawee is the party (often a bank) that a check or bill orders to pay money.
summary.zh: drawee 指支票或汇票上被要求付款的一方（常为银行）。

definition.en: A person or organization that is ordered to pay money on a check or bill of exchange (the one who must pay).
definition.zh: （支票或汇票的）受票人；被指示付款的一方（必须付款的人或机构）。

examples.en: On a check, the bank is usually the drawee.
examples.zh: 在支票上，银行通常是受票人。

examples.en: The bill named the importer as the drawee who must pay the exporter.
examples.zh: 该汇票把进口商写为受票人，必须向出口商付款。

synonyms: acceptor (after acceptance, for bills of exchange)
extraExplanation: “drawee”常见于银行、贸易与票据法语境，和“drawer（出票人）”“payee（收款人）”一起理解最清晰：drawer开票/签发，drawee被要求付款（常是银行），payee实际收款。
在支票（check）里：drawer=写支票的人；drawee=付款银行；payee=收款人。
词形来自动词 draw（开出/签发票据）+ -ee（表示“被……的人”，如 employee）。

summary.en: Drawees are the people or institutions (often banks) that are instructed to pay money on checks or drafts.
summary.zh: Drawees 指在支票或汇票上被要求付款的人或机构（通常是银行），即受票人/付款方。

definition.en: a person or organization (such as a bank) that is directed to pay money on a check, draft, or bill of exchange
definition.zh: （支票、汇票或票据上）被要求付款的人或机构（如银行），即“受票人/付款方”

examples.en: On a check, the bank is usually the drawee.
examples.zh: 在支票上，银行通常是受票人（付款方）。

examples.en: The drawee refused to honor the draft because the account had insufficient funds.
examples.zh: 受票人因账户余额不足而拒绝承兑该汇票。

extraExplanation: “drawee”常见于票据/国际贸易语境：drawer（出票人）开出支票或汇票，要求drawee（受票人/付款方）向payee（收款人）付款。
在支票（check）里，drawee通常是付款银行；在汇票（bill of exchange/draft）里，drawee可能是买方或其银行。被要求付款不等于一定会付款：只有在承兑（accept）或账户资金充足并同意付款时，才会实际支付。

summary.en: “Drawen” is an archaic form of “drawn,” the past participle of “draw.”
summary.zh: “drawen”是“drawn”的古语形式，表示“draw”的过去分词。

definition.en: (Archaic or dialect) past participle of “draw” (same meaning as “drawn”): pulled, taken out, or attracted.
definition.zh: （古语/方言）“draw”的过去分词形式，相当于“drawn”：被拉、被抽出，或被吸引。

examples.en: In old poems, you may see “drawen swords” meaning “drawn swords.”
examples.zh: 在古诗或旧文本里，你可能会看到“drawen swords”，意思就是“drawn swords（出鞘的剑）”。

examples.en: The curtains were drawen back to let in the light.
examples.zh: 窗帘被拉开让光照进来。

extraExplanation: “drawen”是较旧的拼写/形式，现代英语几乎都用“drawn”。英语里有一类过去分词以“-en”结尾（如 broken, taken, written），而“draw”在历史上也出现过“drawen”，后来标准化为“drawn”。
阅读古典文学或圣经译本、早期英文文本时更可能遇到“drawen”。日常写作与考试中建议使用“drawn”。

summary.en: Drawer most commonly means a sliding storage compartment in furniture; it can also mean a person who draws or, in banking, the person who writes a check.
summary.zh: Drawer 最常见指家具里的“抽屉”；也可指“绘图者/画家”，或在票据语境中指“出票人（开支票的人）”。

definition.en: A sliding box-like compartment in a piece of furniture (such as a desk or dresser) used for storing things.
definition.zh: （家具里的）抽屉：可拉出/推进的盒状隔层，用来收纳物品。

examples.en: The keys are in the top drawer of the desk.
examples.zh: 钥匙在书桌最上面的抽屉里。

examples.en: She opened the drawer and took out a notebook.
examples.zh: 她打开抽屉，拿出一本笔记本。

definition.en: A person or thing that draws (especially an artist who makes drawings).
definition.zh: 绘图者；画家（尤指用线条作画的人）。

examples.en: He is a skilled drawer of cartoons.
examples.zh: 他是个很会画漫画的人。

definition.en: In banking, the person who writes and signs a check or draft.
definition.zh: （银行/票据）出票人；开票人（写并签发支票或汇票的人）。

examples.en: The drawer must sign the check before it can be cashed.
examples.zh: 支票必须由出票人签名后才能兑现。

extraExplanation: “drawer”最常见的意思是“抽屉”，读音里结尾的 -er 常被弱读成 /ər/。注意拼写：drawer 不是 *drawner*。
抽屉相关的常见搭配：top drawer（最上层抽屉）；junk drawer（杂物抽屉）；silverware drawer（餐具抽屉）。
在英美文化里，“everything but the kitchen sink”常用来形容“什么都带上了”；对应到收纳场景里，“junk drawer”也很常见，指家里放各种零碎物品的抽屉。

summary.en: A “drawerful” is the amount that fits in a drawer—basically, a drawer filled with something.
summary.zh: “drawerful”指“一抽屉的量”，也就是装满抽屉的东西。

definition.en: the amount that a drawer can hold; a drawer filled with something
definition.zh: 一抽屉的量；装满抽屉的东西

examples.en: She kept a drawerful of old letters in her desk.
examples.zh: 她在书桌里存着一抽屉的旧信。

examples.en: He dumped a drawerful of receipts onto the table.
examples.zh: 他把一抽屉的收据倒在桌上。

examples.en: I found a drawerful of spare keys in the kitchen.
examples.zh: 我在厨房发现了一抽屉的备用钥匙。

extraExplanation: “drawerful”由“drawer（抽屉）+ -ful（……的量/满……）”构成，表示“一个容器所能装下的量”。类似构词：a bagful（一袋的量）、a handful（一把的量）、a cupful（一杯的量）。
发音提示：美式英语里 drawer 常读作接近“dror”，所以 drawerful 连读时听起来像“DROR-ful”。

summary.en: “Drawers” most commonly means the plural of “drawer” (a furniture compartment). It can also mean people who draw, or (older/British) underwear.
summary.zh: “drawers”最常见是“抽屉”的复数；也可指画画的人；在较旧或英式语境中还可指内裤。

definition.en: A sliding box-like container in a piece of furniture (like a desk or dresser) used for storing things; a “drawer.”
definition.zh: （家具里的）抽屉；用于存放物品的可拉出的盒状隔层。

examples.en: I keep my socks in the top drawer.
examples.zh: 我把袜子放在最上面的抽屉里。

examples.en: Please close the drawer gently.
examples.zh: 请轻轻把抽屉关上。

definition.en: People who draw, especially as an occupation (artists/illustrators); “drawers.”
definition.zh: 画画的人；（尤指职业的）绘图者、画家。

examples.en: The museum invited several drawers to sketch the exhibits.
examples.zh: 博物馆邀请了几位画家来为展品写生。

examples.en: She’s a talented drawer who draws animals well.
examples.zh: 她很会画画，尤其擅长画动物。

definition.en: Underwear that covers the lower body (old-fashioned or British usage); “drawers.”
definition.zh: 内裤（较旧式或英式用法）；贴身的下装。

examples.en: In old novels, you may see the word “drawers” meaning underwear.
examples.zh: 在一些老小说里，你会看到“drawers”表示内裤。

extraExplanation: “drawers”最常见是“drawer（抽屉）”的复数。注意别和动词 draw（画画/拉）混淆：drawer（人/物）是“画的人/抽屉”，draw 是“画/拉”的动作。
“drawers=内裤”在现代美式英语里不常用，更多见于英式英语或较古旧的语境（例如维多利亚时代题材作品）。现代更常说 underwear / briefs / panties 等。

summary.en: A file used to store a drawing/graphic; in some contexts, it can also mean saving a drawing as such a file.
summary.zh: 用于保存绘图/图形的文件；在某些语境中也可指“将图保存为绘图文件”。

definition.en: (computing) a file that stores a drawing or graphic, often in a vector-based format.
definition.zh: （计算机）用于保存绘图或图形的文件，常见为矢量图格式。

examples.en: Please export the logo as a drawfile so we can edit it later.
examples.zh: 请把标志导出为绘图文件，这样我们之后还能编辑。

examples.en: The designer sent a drawfile instead of a PDF.
examples.zh: 设计师发来的是绘图文件，而不是 PDF。

definition.en: (especially in some software or systems) to save or output a drawing as a drawing file.
definition.zh: （尤指某些软件/系统中）把图保存或输出为绘图文件。

examples.en: After you finish the sketch, drawfile it and upload it to the shared folder.
examples.zh: 草图完成后，把它保存成绘图文件并上传到共享文件夹。

extraExplanation: “drawfile”在日常英语里不算非常常见；更常见的说法是“drawing file / image file / vector file”。但在特定平台或软件文档中（尤其是早期系统），“Drawfile”可能指一种专门的矢量图文件格式（常与 RISC OS 相关）。

summary.en: “Draw filing” is a metalworking method of smoothing and flattening a surface by drawing a file back and forth sideways across the work.
summary.zh: “draw filing”指金工中的拉锉法：横向来回拉动锉刀以找平并抛光表面。

definition.en: a metalworking technique of filing by holding the file sideways (at right angles to the work) and drawing it back and forth across the surface to make it flatter and smoother.
definition.zh: （金工）拉锉法：把锉刀横着（与工件成直角）放在表面上，来回“拉/推”锉削，使表面更平整、更光滑。

examples.en: After rough filing, he used draw filing to flatten the steel plate.
examples.zh: 粗锉之后，他用拉锉法把钢板表面锉平。

examples.en: Draw filing leaves a smoother finish than pushing the file in one direction.
examples.zh: 拉锉法比单向推锉更容易得到光滑的表面。

extraExplanation: “draw filing”里的 draw 是“拉/拖动”的意思，不是“画画”。这种方法常用于去除细小凸起、找平表面，属于较精细的手工修整。
使用时通常会两手握住锉刀两端，让锉刀横跨工件表面，均匀施力来回拉动；与常见的“前推锉削”相比，更适合做平面精修。
也有人把它写成“draw-filing”。如果你想找的是文件归档相关的词，可能是“file a drawing”（归档图纸）或“filing drawer”（文件抽屉）。

summary.en: A rare/old word for a gate that can be lifted or drawn up, often in a castle setting.
summary.zh: 一个较古旧的词，指可被升起或拉起的门，常见于城堡语境。

definition.en: (Archaic or rare) A gate that can be pulled up or lifted—especially a castle-style gate or barrier (similar in idea to a portcullis).
definition.zh: （古旧/少见）可被拉起或升起的门；尤指城堡式的可升降大门或障碍物（概念上类似落闸门/铁栅门）。

examples.en: The old fort was protected by a drawgate that could be raised at night.
examples.zh: 那座古堡由一扇夜里可以升起的升降门保护着。

examples.en: In the story, the guards lowered the drawgate to block the riders.
examples.zh: 在故事里，守卫放下升降门来阻挡骑手。

extraExplanation: “drawgate”在现代英语中非常少见，更常见的说法是“portcullis（落闸门/铁栅门）”或“drawbridge（吊桥）”。它通常出现在历史描写、奇幻文学或地方性/古英语资料中，用来营造中世纪城堡的氛围。
词形上可理解为“draw（拉起、牵引）+ gate（门）”，强调“可被拉动而开合/升降”的结构。

summary.en: Drawgear is mainly a railway term for the equipment that couples rail cars and transmits pulling force.
summary.zh: drawgear主要是铁路术语，指连接车厢并传递牵引力的牵引/连挂装置。

definition.en: (Railways) The coupling and pulling equipment on a rail vehicle, such as the drawbar, coupler, and related parts used to connect cars and transmit pulling force.
definition.zh: （铁路）车钩/牵引装置：铁路车辆上用于连接车厢并传递牵引力的部件组合，如牵引杆、车钩及相关结构。

examples.en: Before the train departed, engineers inspected the drawgear for wear and cracks.
examples.zh: 列车出发前，检修人员检查牵引装置是否磨损或有裂纹。

examples.en: A faulty drawgear can cause poor coupling and unsafe pulling forces between cars.
examples.zh: 牵引装置故障会导致连挂不良，并在车厢之间产生不安全的牵引力。

definition.en: (Technical, less common) Equipment or a mechanism used to draw, pull, or haul something.
definition.zh: （技术用语，较少见）用于“拉、牵引、拖曳”的设备或机构。

examples.en: The manual mentioned drawgear designed for pulling heavy loads at low speed.
examples.zh: 说明书提到一种用于低速牵引重载的牵引机构。

extraExplanation: “drawgear”多见于英式或行业（铁路/车辆工程）语境，日常英语里更常写作“draw gear”或直接说“coupling / coupler / drawbar”。如果你是在特定设备、论文或说明书里看到该词，通常指“车钩与牵引传力系统”的整体。

summary.en: A draw glove is a protective glove used mainly in archery for the hand that pulls the bowstring.
summary.zh: draw glove 主要指射箭用的拉弓手套，用来保护拉弓手的手指。

definition.en: a glove worn on the drawing hand to protect the fingers when pulling back a bowstring (archery)
definition.zh: （射箭）拉弓手套：戴在“拉弓那只手”上，用来在拉弓时保护手指不被弓弦磨伤的手套

examples.en: She wears a draw glove to protect her fingers when she draws the bow.
examples.zh: 她戴着拉弓手套，拉弓时可以保护手指。

examples.en: If the string hurts your fingertips, try a draw glove or a finger tab.
examples.zh: 如果弓弦磨得你指尖疼，可以试试拉弓手套或护指片。

definition.en: (less common) a glove used to avoid smudging pencil/charcoal while drawing or sketching
definition.zh: （较少见）防蹭手套：画画/素描时用来避免手部把铅笔或炭笔画面蹭花的手套

examples.en: He used a thin glove while drawing to keep the paper clean.
examples.zh: 他画画时戴了薄手套，让纸面保持干净。

extraExplanation: “draw glove”更常见的写法是分开的两词；你写的“drawglove”更像是商品名/用户名或非标准拼写。
在射箭里，draw指“拉弓（draw the bow）”，draw hand是“拉弓手”（通常是惯用手），而bow hand是“持弓手”。
相关装备：finger tab（护指片，通常是一小块皮革/材料挡在手指与弓弦之间），archery glove / shooting glove（拉弓手套的常见叫法）。

summary.en: Drawhead is a technical noun for a device/part used to grip and pull wire, cable, or similar materials.
summary.zh: Drawhead 是偏工程技术的名词，指用于夹紧并牵引金属丝、电缆等材料的牵引装置/部件。

definition.en: a mechanical part that grips and pulls (draws) something—such as wire, cable, or tubing—through a machine or through a conduit; a pulling/traction head.
definition.zh: （机械）牵引头；拉头：用于夹紧并拉动（牵引）材料（如金属丝、电缆、管材等）通过机器或管道的部件。

examples.en: The technician attached a drawhead to the cable to pull it through the underground duct.
examples.zh: 技术员把牵引头装在电缆上，用来把电缆拉过地下管道。

examples.en: In wire manufacturing, the drawhead helps pull the wire through a series of dies.
examples.zh: 在金属拉丝生产中，牵引头帮助把金属丝拉过一系列模具。

extraExplanation: “drawhead”不是日常英语里的常用词，更常见的写法是分开写作“draw head”，多出现在工程、制造、施工等语境中。
这里的 draw 表示“拉/牵引（to pull）”，不是“画画”。根据行业不同，它也可能被称为 pulling head、traction head 或 drawing head。

summary.en: “Drawhorse” is not a common word; you probably mean “draft horse,” a strong horse used for pulling heavy loads.
summary.zh: “drawhorse”不是常见词；你大概率想说“draft horse（挽马）”，指用来拉重物的强壮马。

definition.en: (Not standard) Likely meant “draft horse” (US) / “draught horse” (UK): a large, strong horse bred to pull heavy loads such as carts, wagons, or farm equipment.
definition.zh: （非标准写法）多半是想写“draft horse”（美）/“draught horse”（英）：一种体型大、力量强、专门用来拉重物（如马车、货车或农具）的马。

examples.en: On the farm, a draft horse can pull equipment that is too heavy for a smaller horse.
examples.zh: 在农场里，挽马能拉动对小马来说太重的设备。

examples.en: In old photos, you often see draft horses pulling wagons in the city.
examples.zh: 在老照片里，你常会看到挽马在城市里拉货车。

extraExplanation: “drawhorse”不太算一个常见英语单词。英语里表达“拉车/拉重物的马”，通常用“draft horse”（美式拼写）或“draught horse”（英式拼写）。
“draft/draught”本义和“拉、牵引（to draw）”有关，所以它和动词draw（拉、拖、画）在意义上有联系，但固定搭配通常不用“drawhorse”。
常见品种（了解用）：Clydesdale（克莱兹代尔马）、Shire（夏尔马）、Percheron（佩尔什龙马）。

summary.en: “Drawing” most commonly means a sketch or the act of making pictures; it can also mean a random selection, like a prize drawing.
summary.zh: “drawing”最常指“素描/图画或画画这一行为”；也可指“抽签/抽奖”的随机抽取。

definition.en: a picture or design made with a pencil, pen, etc.; the act of making such a picture
definition.zh: （用铅笔、钢笔等画的）图画、素描；绘画/画画这一行为

examples.en: She showed me a drawing of her cat.
examples.zh: 她给我看了一张她家猫的素描。

examples.en: Drawing helps me relax after school.
examples.zh: 画画能让我放学后放松。

definition.en: choosing a winner or a person by taking a name or number at random (a “drawing”)
definition.zh: （抽签式的）抽取/抽奖；抽签决定

examples.en: They held a drawing to decide who would get the tickets.
examples.zh: 他们用抽签决定谁能拿到门票。

examples.en: Enter your email for a chance in the prize drawing.
examples.zh: 留下你的邮箱，就有机会参加抽奖。

extraExplanation: “drawing”既可以指“画出来的作品/素描”（最常见），也常用于“prize drawing / ticket drawing（抽奖/抽签）”。语境里出现 prize、winner、tickets、lottery 等词时，多半是“抽签/抽奖”的意思。
在艺术语境中，drawing 常指更偏线条与结构的“素描/线稿”，不一定上色；上色的作品更常用 painting（绘画/油画/水彩画等）来表达。

summary.en: “Drawings” usually means pictures made by drawing; it can also mean the act of drawing or a raffle/lottery drawing.
summary.zh: “drawings”通常指“画作/图画”，也可指“绘画这一行为/技能”，或“抽奖/抽签/开奖”。

definition.en: Pictures made by drawing (usually with a pencil, pen, or similar tool) on paper or another surface.
definition.zh: 用画笔、铅笔、钢笔等在纸或其他表面画出来的图画、素描。

examples.en: The museum displayed children’s drawings from local schools.
examples.zh: 博物馆展出了当地学校孩子们的绘画作品。

examples.en: She keeps his drawings in a folder at home.
examples.zh: 她把他的画作放在家里的文件夹里。

definition.en: The act or skill of making pictures by drawing.
definition.zh: 绘画这一行为；绘画技巧。

examples.en: Drawing is his favorite hobby, and his drawings are improving quickly.
examples.zh: 画画是他最喜欢的爱好，他的绘画水平进步很快。

examples.en: The class focuses on drawings of the human figure.
examples.zh: 这门课主要练习人体素描。

definition.en: A choosing of something by chance (for example, picking a winner or lottery numbers).
definition.zh: 抽取；抽签；（如彩票）开奖。

examples.en: The drawings for the raffle will be held on Friday.
examples.zh: 抽奖将于周五举行。

examples.en: He won a prize in the drawing.
examples.zh: 他在抽奖中得了奖。

extraExplanation: “drawings”是“drawing”的复数。最常见意思是“画作/图画”；在美式英语里也常用来指“（抽奖的）抽签/开奖”。
在艺术语境中，drawing常与painting（绘画/油画）区分：drawing更强调线条与素描（用铅笔、炭笔、钢笔等），painting更强调颜料与色彩。

summary.en: “drawk” is not a standard English word; it’s likely a typo (maybe “draw,” “dark,” etc.).
summary.zh: “drawk”不是标准英语单词，通常是拼写/输入错误（可能想写“draw”“dark”等）。

definition.en: Not a standard English word. It is most likely a misspelling or a typo.
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词，通常被视为拼写错误或输入错误。

examples.en: I couldn’t find “drawk” in an English dictionary—did you mean “draw” or “dark”?
examples.zh: 我在英语词典里找不到“drawk”——你是不是想写“draw（画/拉）”或“dark（黑暗的）”？

extraExplanation: “drawk”在常见英语中没有固定含义。如果你能告诉我你看到它的句子/场景（例如聊天、游戏、歌曲、作业），我可以更准确判断你想查的是哪个词。

可能的目标词（按常见程度）：
1) draw /drɔ/：画；拉；抽（签）。
2) dark /dɑrk/：黑暗的；深色的。
3) dork /dɔrk/（口语）：有点傻/书呆子（有时带轻微贬义，需注意语气）。
4) drake /dreɪk/：公鸭；（也可作人名/姓氏）。

summary.en: A drawknife is a two-handled blade tool pulled toward you to shape or smooth wood.
summary.zh: drawknife（拉刀）是一种两端带把手的刃具，通过向自己方向拉动来削木、塑形或刮平。

definition.en: A tool with a blade and two handles (one at each end), pulled toward you to shave, shape, or smooth wood.
definition.zh: 一种两端各有把手的刀具，通过向自己方向拉动来削、塑形或刮平木材。

examples.en: He used a drawknife to remove bark from the log.
examples.zh: 他用拉刀把木头上的树皮刮掉。

examples.en: A drawknife is common in traditional woodworking and chair-making.
examples.zh: 拉刀在传统木工和椅子制作中很常见。

extraExplanation: “drawknife”里的 draw 指“拉（向自己拉）”，因为使用时通常把刀刃朝向自己，双手握住两端把手，靠拉动来削木。
常见搭配：a curved drawknife（弯刃拉刀，适合做凹面/圆弧）、a straight drawknife（直刃拉刀，适合削平）。
使用情境：常与 shaving horse（削木马/夹木凳）一起出现，木料固定在凳上，人坐着拉刀来削木，属于传统手工具工艺。

summary.en: Drawknife (plural: drawknives) is a two-handled woodworking knife used by pulling it toward you to shave and shape wood.
summary.zh: Drawknife（复数：drawknives）是一种两端带把手的木工拉刀，通过向自己方向拉削来削薄并塑形木材。

definition.en: a woodworking tool with a blade and a handle at each end, used by pulling it toward you to shave or shape wood
definition.zh: 一种木工手工具：刀刃两端各有一个把手，使用时向自己方向“拉削”木材，用于削薄或塑形

examples.en: He used a drawknife to peel the bark off the branch.
examples.zh: 他用拉刀把树枝上的树皮削下来。

examples.en: With a drawknife, you can shape a chair leg quickly before sanding.
examples.zh: 用拉刀可以在打磨前快速把椅子腿削出大致形状。

examples.en: Traditional woodworkers still keep drawknives for rough shaping.
examples.zh: 传统木工仍会备着拉刀，用来做粗加工塑形。

extraExplanation: 你输入的“drawknives”是复数形式；单数是“drawknife”。
词源很好理解：draw（拉）+ knife（刀）。它的核心动作是把刀“朝自己拉”，因此得名。
使用时要注意安全：刀刃朝向身体，通常要配合工作台夹具（如木工台钳、削马 shavehorse）固定木料；初学者建议从少量、顺纹理削起。

summary.en: A drawknot is a knot that tightens when pulled and can be released quickly (like a slipknot).
summary.zh: drawknot 指一种拉动会收紧、也能快速解开的结（类似活结/滑结）。

definition.en: a knot that tightens when you pull one end and can be loosened or released by pulling another end; a slipknot or quick-release knot
definition.zh: 一种“拉紧/可快速解开”的结：拉动一端会收紧，拉动另一端（或抽出活动端）即可松开或解开；类似活结/滑结/抽绳结

examples.en: Tie the package with a drawknot so it’s easy to open later.
examples.zh: 用抽拉结把包裹系上，这样之后更容易打开。

examples.en: The drawstring bag closes with a simple drawknot.
examples.zh: 抽绳袋用一个简单的抽拉结就能收口。

examples.en: He used a drawknot to secure the rope without making a permanent knot.
examples.zh: 他用抽拉结固定绳子，而不是打一个很难解开的死结。

extraExplanation: “drawknot”在现代英语里不算常见，更常见的说法是“slipknot（活结/滑结）”或“bow（蝴蝶结）”。在绳结、航海、露营、包装或抽绳衣物/袋子等语境中，你更可能听到这些常用词。
词源上可理解为 draw（拉）+ knot（结），强调“通过拉动来收紧/松开”的特性。实际指哪一种结，可能因地区或领域（例如航海、手工、露营）而略有差异。

summary.en: “Drawl” means a slow, stretched-out way of speaking; it can be the style itself (noun) or the act of speaking that way (verb).
summary.zh: “drawl”指说话慢、把音拖长的方式；既可作名词指这种腔调，也可作动词指用这种方式说话。

definition.en: a slow way of speaking where words are stretched out, often associated with some regional accents (especially in the southern U.S.)
definition.zh: 慢吞吞、拖长音的说话方式（常与某些地方口音相关，尤其是美国南部口音）

examples.en: He answered with a relaxed Southern drawl.
examples.zh: 他用一种轻松的美国南部拖腔回答。

examples.en: Her drawl made the conversation feel unhurried.
examples.zh: 她的拖腔让谈话显得不急不忙。

definition.en: to speak slowly, stretching out words (often because of a regional accent or a casual mood)
definition.zh: 拖长音、慢慢地说（常因地方口音或语气随意）

examples.en: “I don’t know,” she drawled, looking away.
examples.zh: “我不知道，”她拖着长音说道，目光移开。

examples.en: He tends to drawl when he’s tired.
examples.zh: 他累的时候说话就容易拖长音。

extraExplanation: “drawl”常用来描写口音/语气的“听感”，不一定带贬义；但在写作或影视评论里，有时会暗示人物“懒散、慢条斯理、故意卖关子”等性格或态度。
写对白时，作者可能用“drawl”来营造地域氛围（如美国南部、西部牛仔形象）。使用时要注意尊重：描述口音可以，但避免把口音与能力或智力简单挂钩。

summary.en: A drawlatch is a pull-type latch used to fasten or release a door, gate, or similar closure.
summary.zh: drawlatch 指一种通过拉动来扣住或释放的锁扣/门闩，多用于门、栅栏门或箱柜等。

definition.en: a type of latch (door or gate fastener) that is pulled (“drawn”) to open or release; often used on doors, gates, boxes, or cabinets
definition.zh: 一种通过“拉动/抽动”来开启或释放的门闩/锁扣；常用于门、栅栏门、箱子或柜子等

examples.en: He lifted the drawlatch and pushed the gate open.
examples.zh: 他拉起拉闩，把栅栏门推开。

examples.en: Make sure the drawlatch is fully engaged before you leave.
examples.zh: 离开前确认拉闩已经完全扣住。

extraExplanation: “drawlatch”更常见的写法是分开写成“draw latch”。在五金/建筑语境里，draw表示“拉动、抽动”，latch表示“门闩、锁扣”。
不要和“drawlatch”误读成“drawl”（拖长音的说话方式）+“latch”。如果你看到的是口语或非正式拼写，通常指的还是五金件“draw latch”。

summary.en: “Drawled” means spoke (or said words) slowly with stretched-out sounds.
summary.zh: “drawled”指用拖长音、慢吞吞的方式说话或说出某些话。

definition.en: Spoke in a slow, lazy way, stretching out the sounds of words (past tense of “drawl”).
definition.zh: （drawl 的过去式）用慢吞吞、拖长音的方式说话。

examples.en: “I’m fine,” he drawled, as if he had all the time in the world.
examples.zh: “我很好，”他拖着长音慢慢说道，仿佛时间多得很。

examples.en: She drawled her answer, making it sound a little sarcastic.
examples.zh: 她把回答拖长了音，听起来有点讽刺。

definition.en: Said (words) in a drawn-out, slow manner.
definition.zh: 用拖长、缓慢的方式说出（某些话）。

examples.en: He drawled a greeting from across the room.
examples.zh: 他在房间那头拖着长音打了个招呼。

examples.en: “Sure,” she drawled, clearly not convinced.
examples.zh: “当然啦，”她拖着长音说道，显然并不相信。

extraExplanation: “drawl”常让人联想到某些地区口音，尤其在美国文化语境中常与美国南方英语的“拖音”联系在一起。不过在文学或影视里，它也常用来表现人物的态度：漫不经心、懒散、故作镇定，或带一点嘲讽。使用时注意：描写口音/说话方式时尽量避免刻板印象，把重点放在语气和节奏上。

summary.en: A drawer is usually a sliding storage compartment in furniture; it can also mean the person who writes a check/bill in finance.
summary.zh: drawer 通常指家具里的“抽屉”；在金融语境中也可指“出票人/开票人”。

definition.en: A sliding box-like compartment in furniture (such as a desk or dresser) used for storing things.
definition.zh: （家具里的）抽屉；可拉出的储物格（如桌子或衣柜里的抽屉）。

examples.en: I put my socks in the top drawer.
examples.zh: 我把袜子放在最上面的抽屉里。

examples.en: The drawer won’t close because it’s too full.
examples.zh: 抽屉太满了，所以关不上。

examples.en: She opened the kitchen drawer to find a spoon.
examples.zh: 她打开厨房抽屉找勺子。

definition.en: A person or thing that draws something (especially in finance: the person who writes a check or bill of exchange).
definition.zh: 绘图者；（尤指金融）出票人、开票人（签发支票或汇票的人）。

examples.en: The drawer signed the check before handing it over.
examples.zh: 出票人在交出去前先在支票上签了名。

examples.en: In this contract, the drawer is responsible for issuing the payment order.
examples.zh: 在这份合同中，出票方负责签发付款指令。

definition.en: In some card games, a player who draws cards (or the act/role of drawing).
definition.zh: （某些纸牌游戏中）抽牌者；抽牌的一方（或抽牌这一角色）。

examples.en: The drawer took one more card and then stood.
examples.zh: 抽牌者又抽了一张牌，然后停牌。

extraExplanation: 你输入的 **drawler** 通常是 **drawer** 的常见拼写错误。英语里表示“抽屉”用 *drawer*，发音里中间的 /w/ 很弱或几乎听不见，所以容易被误拼成 *drawler*。

summary.en: “Drawlers” is not standard; you probably mean “drawer(s)” (a pull-out storage box; also a person who draws; or old-fashioned “underwear”).
summary.zh: “drawlers”不是规范拼写；你可能想写“drawer(s)”（抽屉；绘图者；或旧式“内衣/衬裤”）。

definition.en: (Likely intended: “drawer”) a box-shaped container in a piece of furniture that you pull out to store things.
definition.zh: （可能想写：drawer）抽屉：家具里可拉出来用来收纳物品的盒状隔层。

examples.en: I put the keys in the top drawer.
examples.zh: 我把钥匙放在最上面的抽屉里。

examples.en: This drawer is stuck—can you help me open it?
examples.zh: 这个抽屉卡住了——你能帮我打开吗？

definition.en: a person who draws pictures or plans (an artist or designer).
definition.zh: 绘图者；画家；制图员（画画或画设计图的人）。

examples.en: She is a talented drawer of cartoons.
examples.zh: 她是一个很有才华的漫画绘制者。

examples.en: The drawer sketched a quick map for us.
examples.zh: 绘图者给我们快速画了一张地图。

definition.en: (usually plural: drawers) underwear, especially in older or British usage.
definition.zh: （常用复数 drawers）内衣/衬裤（较旧或英式用法）。

examples.en: In old novels, people might say “put on your drawers.”
examples.zh: 在老小说里，人们可能会说“穿上你的衬裤/内衣”。

extraExplanation: “drawlers”不是常见英语单词，最可能是把“drawers”（抽屉；也可指内衣）拼错了。
如果你想表达“爬虫/爬行者”，常用词是“crawler(s)”。如果你告诉我句子语境，我可以帮你确认你真正想用的词。

summary.en: “Drawlier” means “more drawly”—speech that is slower and more stretched out.
summary.zh: “Drawlier”意为“更拖腔的、更慢更拖长的说话方式”。

definition.en: comparative form of drawly; speaking or sounding more slow and stretched out (with more of a “drawl”).
definition.zh: drawly 的比较级；说话或发音更拖长、更慢（更有“拖腔/慢吞吞”的口音）。

examples.en: After moving to Texas, his accent sounded drawlier than before.
examples.zh: 搬到德州之后，他的口音听起来比以前更拖长了。

examples.en: She answered in a drawlier voice, as if she had all the time in the world.
examples.zh: 她用更拖长的语气回答，好像时间多得用不完。

extraExplanation: “drawlier”并不算常见写法；更常见的是用更通俗的表达：more drawly / more drawn-out / slower。
注意不要和“drollier”（更滑稽、更风趣）混淆：drawly/drawlier 讲的是说话拖长；droll/drollier 讲的是幽默感。

summary.en: “Drawliest” means “most drawly,” describing the strongest drawl (slow, stretched-out speech).
summary.zh: drawliest意为“最拖腔的”（最高级），形容拖长音、语速慢的说话方式最明显。

definition.en: (rare) Having the strongest drawl; speaking in the slow, stretched-out way where vowel sounds are lengthened.
definition.zh: （少见）最“拖腔/拖长音”的；说话时元音被拉长、语速较慢的（最高级）。

examples.en: Of all the actors, he had the drawliest Southern accent.
examples.zh: 在所有演员里，他的南方口音最拖腔。

examples.en: Her drawliest line in the scene made the audience laugh.
examples.zh: 她在那一幕里最拖长音的一句台词把观众逗笑了。

examples.en: The narrator’s drawliest voice gave the story a relaxed, laid-back feel.
examples.zh: 旁白最拖腔的声音让故事听起来很放松、很悠闲。

extraExplanation: “drawliest”来自形容词“drawly”（拖腔的），而“drawly”又与名词/动词“drawl”（拖长音说话）有关。这个词在现代英语里非常不常用，更常见的表达是“the most drawling”或“with the strongest drawl”。
在美国文化语境中，“drawl”常让人联想到美国南部口音（Southern drawl），多用于描写说话风格或口音特征；是否带贬义取决于语境与语气。

summary.en: Drawling describes slow speech with stretched vowels; it can also mean the style of speaking itself.
summary.zh: Drawling 指“说话慢、拖长元音”的特点；也可指这种说话方式本身。

definition.en: Speaking in a slow, relaxed way, with vowels stretched out (often associated with certain regional accents).
definition.zh: 说话慢而懒散、把元音拖长的（常与某些地区口音相关）。

examples.en: He answered in a drawling voice, stretching every vowel.
examples.zh: 他用拖长元音的慢腔慢调回答。

examples.en: Her drawling accent made her sound calm, even when she was annoyed.
examples.zh: 她拖音的口音让她听起来很淡定，即使她其实很烦。

definition.en: A slow, drawn-out way of speaking; a “drawl.”
definition.zh: 慢吞吞、拖长音的说话方式；拖腔（drawl）。

examples.en: The character’s drawling was used to show he was laid-back.
examples.zh: 这个角色的拖腔被用来表现他很随性、悠闲。

extraExplanation: “Drawling”常让人联想到美国南部英语（Southern American English）的“Southern drawl”，比如把某些元音拉长、语速更慢。在文学和影视作品中，这种说话方式有时用来塑造“悠闲、慢条斯理”的形象，但也可能被刻板化使用；现实中不同地区、不同个人差异很大。

summary.en: “Drawlingly” means speaking in a slow, stretched-out way, often lengthening vowels.
summary.zh: “Drawlingly”指说话拖长音、语速慢、把声音拉长的方式。

definition.en: In a slow, stretched-out way (especially when speaking), with vowels lengthened and words sounding relaxed or lazy.
definition.zh: 以慢吞吞、拖长音的方式（尤指说话时），把元音拉长，语气显得悠闲或懒散。

examples.en: He answered drawlingly, “I guess so…,” stretching the words.
examples.zh: 他拖长音慢慢回答：“我想……是吧。”

examples.en: The actor spoke drawlingly to sound like he was from the American South.
examples.zh: 那位演员用拖长音的方式说话，让自己听起来像美国南方人。

examples.en: “Take your time,” she said drawlingly, as if nothing could hurry her.
examples.zh: “慢慢来，”她拖着长音说道，仿佛没有任何事能催她。

extraExplanation: “drawlingly”来自动词 drawl（拖长音说话）。在英语里，drawl 常让人联想到某些地区口音，尤其是美国南方口音（Southern drawl），也可能用来表现人物的慵懒、从容、冷淡或带点讽刺的语气。使用时注意：它描述的是说话方式，可能带有风格化或刻板印象色彩，写作中应根据语境谨慎使用。

summary.en: Drawlingness means the quality of speaking with a slow, drawn-out, vowel-stretching style.
summary.zh: drawlingness 指说话拖腔拉调、速度慢、把元音拉长的特点。

definition.en: the quality or state of speaking in a drawling way (slow, with vowels stretched out, often sounding relaxed or lazy)
definition.zh: 拖腔拉调的说话方式；慢吞吞、把元音拉长的说话特点（常给人悠闲或懒散的感觉）

examples.en: The drawlingness of his voice made the story feel sleepy and unhurried.
examples.zh: 他声音里的拖腔拉调让这个故事听起来慵懒、不紧不慢。

examples.en: Some listeners find Southern drawlingness charming, while others think it sounds too slow.
examples.zh: 有些听众觉得南方口音的拖腔拉调很有魅力，也有人觉得听起来太慢。

extraExplanation: “drawlingness”由形容词“drawling（拖腔拉调的）”加名词后缀“-ness（……的性质/状态）”构成，表示“这种特征本身”。这个词不算常用，更常见的表达是“a drawl / a drawling voice / drawling speech”。
“drawl”在英语里常与某些地区口音（如美国南方口音）联系在一起，但它也可用于描述任何人故意或无意的慢速、拉长音的说话方式。语境不同，可能是中性描述，也可能带轻微评价（如“懒散、漫不经心”）。

summary.en: “Drawlink” is uncommon. It can mean a mechanical pulling/towing link, or (rarely) “to draw a connection” between ideas.
summary.zh: “drawlink”不常见。可指机械上的牵引连接件；也可（少见）表示“指出/画出联系”（更常用 draw a link / draw a connection）。

definition.en: a connecting piece (a “link”) designed to pull, tow, or transmit pulling force in a mechanical system
definition.zh: （机械中的）牵引连接件；用于拉拽、牵引或传递拉力的连接环/连接件

examples.en: The mechanic replaced the drawlink because it was worn and could fail under load.
examples.zh: 机械师更换了牵引连接件，因为它已经磨损，承载时可能会失效。

examples.en: Check the drawlink before towing to make sure the connection is secure.
examples.zh: 牵引前检查连接件，确保连接牢固。

definition.en: (rare/nonstandard) to create or depict a connection between two things, especially in a diagram (more commonly: “draw a link” or “draw a connection”)
definition.zh: （少见/非标准用法）画出两者之间的联系，尤其指在图表中表示连接（更常说：draw a link / draw a connection）

examples.en: In the report, the author draws a link between sleep and memory.
examples.zh: 在报告中，作者指出睡眠与记忆之间的联系。

examples.en: Try to draw a link between these two ideas in your mind map.
examples.zh: 在思维导图里试着把这两个观点联系起来。

extraExplanation: “drawlink”不是非常常见的标准英语单词。很多情况下更自然的写法是分开写：draw link（机械语境）或 draw a link / draw a connection（表达“建立联系”）。
如果你是在某个软件、网站功能、品牌名或用户名里看到“Drawlink/DrawLink”，它可能是专有名词，含义需要结合具体上下文（例如产品说明或页面功能）。

summary.en: A drawloom is a loom designed to weave complex patterns using a draw mechanism.
summary.zh: drawloom 指一种通过“拉动/提综”机制来织出复杂花纹的织机。

definition.en: a type of loom that uses a draw mechanism (often with a second person or a device controlling groups of warp threads) to weave complex patterns, such as brocades and figured textiles
definition.zh: 一种带有“提花/提综”装置的织机（常由第二个人或机械装置拉动、控制经线分组），用于织出复杂花纹，如锦缎、提花织物等

examples.en: The museum demonstrated a drawloom to show how intricate silk patterns were made.
examples.zh: 博物馆演示了提花织机（drawloom），用来展示复杂丝绸花纹是如何织出来的。

examples.en: On a traditional drawloom, one worker weaves while another pulls the pattern cords.
examples.zh: 在传统的提花织机上，通常一人织布，另一人拉动花纹绳来控制图案。

extraExplanation: drawloom 常见于纺织史与工艺史语境，是“复杂图案织造”的关键技术之一；它在很多地区早于雅卡尔织机（Jacquard loom）出现，后来也被更自动化的装置逐步取代。
词形上是 draw + loom 的复合词：draw 在这里指“拉动（绳索/提综）以提起特定经线”，loom 指“织机”。

summary.en: “Drawls” usually means “speaks in a slow, stretched-out way,” and it can also refer to that kind of slow speech (drawls = instances of a drawl).
summary.zh: “Drawls”通常指“说话拖长音、慢吞吞地说”（动词第三人称/复数形式）；也可指“拖腔的说话方式”的复数。

definition.en: to speak in a slow, stretched-out way, often with drawn-out vowels (common in some regional accents)
definition.zh: （说话）慢吞吞、拖长音地说；带拖腔的口音（常见于某些地区口音）

examples.en: He drawls every word, so the story feels slower than it is.
examples.zh: 他说每个词都拖长音，所以故事听起来比实际更慢。

examples.en: She drawls when she’s tired and doesn’t want to rush.
examples.zh: 她累的时候会拖腔说话，不想说得太快。

definition.en: a slow, lazy-sounding way of speaking with stretched vowels
definition.zh: 拖腔；慢吞吞、拉长元音的说话方式

examples.en: His Southern drawl makes him sound relaxed.
examples.zh: 他的南方拖腔让他听起来很放松。

examples.en: The actor used a drawl to show the character was laid-back.
examples.zh: 演员用拖腔来表现角色很随和。

extraExplanation: “drawl(s)”常让人联想到美国南部口音（Southern drawl），但并不是所有南方人都这样说话；在影视作品里，拖腔有时会被用来塑造“悠闲、慢节奏”的形象。使用时注意避免用它去刻板化某个地区或群体。

summary.en: Drawly means spoken with a drawl—slow, stretched vowels.
summary.zh: Drawly 指“带拖腔的说话方式”，说话慢、元音被拉长。

definition.en: spoken in a slow, lazy-sounding way, with vowels stretched out (with a drawl).
definition.zh: （说话）拖长元音、慢悠悠的；带有拖腔的（drawl 的）。

examples.en: He answered in a drawly voice, as if he had all the time in the world.
examples.zh: 他用拖腔的语气回答，好像时间多得用不完。

examples.en: Her drawly Southern accent made the story sound relaxed and friendly.
examples.zh: 她带拖腔的美国南方口音让故事听起来轻松又亲切。

extraExplanation: “drawly”比较少见，更常用的是“drawling”（拖腔的）或直接说“with a drawl”。它来自名词/动词“drawl”（拖长音说话）。
“drawl”常与某些地区口音联系在一起，尤其是美国南方口音；描述口音时尽量保持中性表达，避免把它和“懒散/不认真”等性格评价直接绑定。

summary.en: “Drawn” most often means pulled/attracted, made by drawing, or looking tired and tense.
summary.zh: “drawn”最常表示：被拉动/被吸引的、画出来的，或（神情）疲惫紧绷的。

definition.en: pulled or moved in a direction with force; taken out by pulling (past participle of “draw”).
definition.zh: 被拉动的；被抽出的；拉出来的（“draw”的过去分词）。

examples.en: He was drawn toward the warm light of the window.
examples.zh: 他被窗边温暖的灯光吸引过去。

examples.en: The curtain was drawn back to let in air.
examples.zh: 窗帘被拉开，让空气进来。

definition.en: made by drawing (lines, pictures, designs); sketched.
definition.zh: 画出来的；绘制的；素描的。

examples.en: She showed me a hand-drawn map.
examples.zh: 她给我看了一张手绘地图。

examples.en: The character was drawn in simple black lines.
examples.zh: 这个角色用简单的黑色线条画出来。

definition.en: looking tight, tired, or anxious, especially in the face (a “drawn” expression).
definition.zh: （尤指脸）显得紧绷、疲惫或焦虑的（“drawn” 的神情）。

examples.en: After the long night, her face looked drawn.
examples.zh: 熬了一整夜后，她的脸看起来很憔悴。

examples.en: His drawn expression worried his friends.
examples.zh: 他紧绷的神情让朋友们很担心。

extraExplanation: “drawn”常见三种用法：① 表示“被拉/被吸引”（draw toward/into）；② 表示“画出来的”（hand-drawn 手绘的）；③ 表示“面容憔悴/紧绷”（a drawn face/expression）。第三种多用于文学或较正式的描写，强调疲惫、担忧带来的“脸部线条被拉紧”的感觉。

summary.en: A drawnet is a fishing net pulled through the water; it can also mean something that traps people like a net.
summary.zh: drawnet 指被拖拉的捕鱼网；也可比喻让人陷入其中的“罗网”。

definition.en: a fishing net that is pulled (drawn) through the water to catch fish; a type of seine.
definition.zh: （捕鱼用的）拖网、围网；一种通过拖拉来捕鱼的渔网。

examples.en: The fishermen cast the drawnet and then pulled it slowly toward the shore.
examples.zh: 渔民撒下拖网，然后慢慢把网拖向岸边。

examples.en: A drawnet can trap many fish at once, so it is used carefully to protect sea life.
examples.zh: 拖网一次能捕到很多鱼，所以需要谨慎使用以保护海洋生物。

definition.en: (figurative) a plan, system, or situation that traps people like a net.
definition.zh: （比喻）像网一样让人陷入其中的计谋、体系或困境。

examples.en: He felt the contract was a drawnet designed to keep workers dependent.
examples.zh: 他觉得那份合同像一张网，目的在于让工人长期依赖。

examples.en: Rumors spread like a drawnet, catching even innocent people in suspicion.
examples.zh: 谣言像一张网扩散开来，连无辜的人也被卷入怀疑之中。

extraExplanation: “drawnet”由 draw（拉、拖）+ net（网）构成，字面意思就是“拉着走的网”。现代更常见的对应词是 **seine** 或 **dragnet**；其中 **dragnet** 既可指拖网，也常用于比喻“（警方）大搜捕/大范围排查”。

summary.en: “drawnly” is a rare/archaic adverb meaning “in a drawn-out, slow, lingering way.”
summary.zh: “drawnly”是一个罕见/古旧的副词，意思是“拖长地、缓慢地、悠长地”。

definition.en:
(rare/archaic) In a drawn-out, slow, or lingering way; similar to “drawlingly.”
Examples:
• EN: He spoke drawnly, stretching every word. / ZH: 他慢吞吞地说话，把每个词都拖长了。
• EN: The note rang drawnly through the hall. / ZH: 那个音符在大厅里悠长地回响。
• EN: She answered drawnly, as if tired. / ZH: 她有气无力地慢慢回答。
definition.zh:
（罕见/古旧）以拖长、缓慢、延宕的方式；类似 drawlingly（拖腔地/慢吞吞地）。
例句：
• EN: He spoke drawnly, stretching every word. / ZH: 他慢吞吞地说话，把每个词都拖长了。
• EN: The note rang drawnly through the hall. / ZH: 那个音符在大厅里悠长地回响。
• EN: She answered drawnly, as if tired. / ZH: 她有气无力地慢慢回答。

examples.en: He spoke drawnly, stretching every word.
examples.zh: 他慢吞吞地说话，把每个词都拖长了。

examples.en: The note rang drawnly through the hall.
examples.zh: 那个音符在大厅里悠长地回响。

examples.en: She answered drawnly, as if tired.
examples.zh: 她有气无力地慢慢回答。

extraExplanation: “drawnly”在现代英语里非常少见，多数情况下人们会用更常见的表达：in a drawn-out way（以拖长的方式）、slowly（缓慢地）、or drawlingly（拖腔地）。
它通常和说话（speak）、声音（sound/note）、语气（tone）等搭配，强调“拖长、拉长、显得慢或疲惫”。
如果你是在写作或读旧文本遇到它，可以把它理解为“拖长地/慢慢地/悠长地”。

summary.en: “Drawnness” is a rare noun meaning a tired, strained, or haggard look (especially in the face).
summary.zh: “drawnness”是个较罕见的名词，指（尤其是脸上）疲惫、紧绷或憔悴的神情。

definition.en: (rare) The quality or state of looking drawn—tired, tense, thin, or strained in the face (often from worry, illness, or lack of sleep).
definition.zh: （罕见）“憔悴、紧绷、消瘦”的状态；指脸部看起来疲惫、紧张或受压（常因担忧、生病或睡眠不足）。

examples.en: After the long night at the hospital, there was a drawnness around his eyes.
examples.zh: 在医院熬了一整夜后，他的眼周显得格外憔悴。

examples.en: The stress of the deadline gave her face a quiet drawnness.
examples.zh: 截止日期的压力让她的脸上多了一种安静的憔悴感。

extraExplanation: “drawnness”不是常用词，更常见的表达是：a drawn face / a drawn look（憔悴的脸/神情）、haggardness（更“憔悴、疲惫不堪”）、gauntness（更“消瘦、凹陷”）。
它来自形容词“drawn”（脸色/神情憔悴、紧绷），这种用法在文学描写或较正式的叙述中偶尔出现。
如果你想表达“困倦、昏昏欲睡”，更可能是拼写想写“drowsiness（困倦）”，而不是“drawnness”。

summary.en: Drawnwork is decorative needlework made by pulling threads out of fabric and stitching the remaining threads into an open pattern.
summary.zh: Drawnwork（抽纱绣/抽丝绣）是一种通过抽出布线并缝合剩余线条来形成镂空花纹的装饰性刺绣。

definition.en: A kind of decorative needlework in which some threads are pulled (drawn) out of a piece of fabric and the remaining threads are stitched to create an open, lace-like pattern.
definition.zh: 一种装饰性刺绣技法：从布料中抽出（拉出）部分纱线，再把剩下的经纬线用针脚加固并组合成镂空、像蕾丝一样的花纹。

examples.en: The tablecloth has delicate drawnwork along the edges.
examples.zh: 这块桌布边缘有精致的抽纱绣花边。

examples.en: She learned drawnwork to repair and decorate old linens.
examples.zh: 她学习抽纱绣，用来修补并装饰旧的亚麻布织品。

extraExplanation: “drawnwork”也常写作“drawn work”（两词），在服装与家居织品中更常见。
它通常用在亚麻（linen）等有规律经纬线的布料上；先“抽丝”再“锁线/织补”，形成规则的镂空图案。常见于桌布、餐巾、床单、袖口等传统手工艺品。
相关词：openwork（镂空织绣的总称）、cutwork（剪洞再包边的镂空绣法），drawnwork更强调“抽出布线”。

summary.en: Draw off means to drain/siphon out liquid, to withdraw/move away, or to divert attention.
summary.zh: Draw off可指“放出/抽出液体”，也可指“撤离/退开”，还可表示“转移注意力”。

definition.en: to remove a liquid from a container, tank, or system (to drain or siphon it out)
definition.zh: 把液体从容器、管道或系统中抽出；放出（排空、虹吸）

examples.en: Please draw off some hot water for the tea.
examples.zh: 请放出一些热水来泡茶。

examples.en: The mechanic drew off the old oil before adding new oil.
examples.zh: 技师先放掉旧机油，再加入新机油。

examples.en: After the soup is done, draw off the fat from the top.
examples.zh: 汤煮好后，把上面的油脂撇掉/撇出。

definition.en: to move away or withdraw (often used for groups like troops, vehicles, or crowds)
definition.zh: 撤离；退开（常用于军队、车辆、人群等）

examples.en: The troops were ordered to draw off at dawn.
examples.zh: 部队奉命在黎明时撤离。

examples.en: Police asked the crowd to draw off and clear the street.
examples.zh: 警方要求人群退开，清空街道。

definition.en: to divert or distract someone’s attention away from something
definition.zh: 把注意力从某事上引开；分散注意力

examples.en: Don’t let small details draw you off from the main point.
examples.zh: 别让小细节把你从重点上带偏。

examples.en: The argument drew him off from finishing his work.
examples.zh: 争吵让他分心，没能把工作做完。

extraExplanation: “draw off”是常见的短语动词（phrasal verb）。在“抽出/放出液体”的意思上通常可分开：draw off the water / draw the water off / draw it off（代词it一般放中间）。
在军事或正式语境里，“draw off”常表示“撤军/撤离”，语气比“leave”更正式，带有“有序撤出”的感觉。

summary.en: “Draw out” can mean prolong something, encourage someone to talk, pull something out, or withdraw money.
summary.zh: “draw out”可指延长（拖长）、引导某人多说、把东西取出/拉出，或从账户取钱。

definition.en: to make something last longer; to prolong or extend (time, a process, an event)
definition.zh: 使（时间、过程、活动）延长；拖长

examples.en: The meeting was drawn out by long speeches.
examples.zh: 冗长的发言把会议拖长了。

examples.en: Try not to draw out the discussion—let’s decide now.
examples.zh: 别把讨论拖太久——我们现在就做决定吧。

definition.en: to cause someone to talk more, especially about personal thoughts or feelings
definition.zh: 引导/套出某人多说（尤其是想法或感受）

examples.en: A good interviewer knows how to draw people out.
examples.zh: 优秀的采访者知道如何引导受访者多说。

examples.en: She was shy, but her classmates drew her out over time.
examples.zh: 她很害羞，但同学们慢慢让她变得愿意开口。

definition.en: to remove or pull something out from inside something else
definition.zh: 把……拉出/取出（从里面）

examples.en: He drew out a chair for her to sit down.
examples.zh: 他拉出一把椅子让她坐下。

examples.en: She drew out a note from her pocket.
examples.zh: 她从口袋里掏出一张纸条。

definition.en: to take money out of a bank account
definition.zh: （从银行账户）取钱

examples.en: I need to draw out some cash before the trip.
examples.zh: 旅行前我得取点现金。

examples.en: He drew out $50 from the ATM.
examples.zh: 他在ATM取了50美元。

extraExplanation: “draw out”是常见短语动词，含义会随语境变化：如果对象是时间/活动，多指“拖长”；如果对象是人，多指“让某人更愿意表达”；如果对象是物品或钱，则是“取出/拿出”。
在口语里，“drawn-out”还能作形容词，表示“冗长的、拖沓的”，例如：a drawn-out process（漫长拖沓的过程）。

summary.en: A drawplate is a tool (a holed metal plate) used to pull metal through to make wire thinner and uniform.
summary.zh: drawplate 指一种带孔的金属工具板，用来拉拔金属，使金属线变细且更均匀。

definition.en: a metal plate with a series of holes that is used to pull (draw) metal through, in order to make wire or rods thinner and more uniform
definition.zh: 拉丝板；拉线板（带有不同孔径的金属板，用来把金属拉过孔洞，使金属线/金属杆变细并更均匀）

examples.en: The jeweler used a drawplate to make a thinner silver wire.
examples.zh: 珠宝匠用拉丝板把银线拉得更细。

examples.en: To change the thickness, she pulled the wire through a smaller hole in the drawplate.
examples.zh: 要改变粗细，她把金属线从拉丝板上更小的孔拉过去。

extraExplanation: 在金工与冶金里，draw（拉拔）是一种常见工艺：通过“拉过模具孔”来减小金属截面并提高均匀度。drawplate 常见于首饰制作、金属加工等场景，功能类似于拉丝模/拉丝板（die/drawplate）。书写时也常见分开写作 draw plate。

summary.en: A technical noun meaning an opening or location where material—especially ore in mining—is drawn out.
summary.zh: 技术名词，指抽取/放出材料的位置，尤指采矿中的放矿点（出矿口）。

definition.en: (Mining/engineering) A place or opening where broken ore or rock is drawn (removed) from a stope or storage area, usually through a chute or tunnel.
definition.zh: （采矿/工程）放矿点；出矿口：从采场或储矿区把破碎矿石/岩石放出（运出）的地点或开口，常连接溜井或巷道。

examples.en: Workers loaded the ore trucks at the drawpoint.
examples.zh: 工人在放矿点给运矿卡车装矿。

examples.en: The drawpoint was temporarily closed for safety inspections.
examples.zh: 放矿点因安全检查而暂时关闭。

definition.en: (Technical) A point or location from which something is drawn or pulled out (e.g., material, fluid, or air) in a system.
definition.zh: （技术）抽取点/引出点：在系统中把材料、液体或空气等抽出或引出的某个位置。

examples.en: Install a filter near the drawpoint to reduce dust.
examples.zh: 在抽取点附近安装过滤装置以减少粉尘。

examples.en: Air quality was measured at each drawpoint in the tunnel.
examples.zh: 在隧道的每个抽气点都测量了空气质量。

extraExplanation: “drawpoint”最常见于地下采矿（尤其是崩落法等）语境：矿石爆破/崩落后，会通过特定开口“放出”到运输巷道，因此叫 drawpoint（直译为“抽出/放出之点”）。在一般英语里不算高频词，更多出现在工程报告、矿山设计图、论文等技术文本中。

summary.en: A drawrod is a rod used to pull or transmit a pulling force in a mechanical system.
summary.zh: drawrod 指在机械系统中用于拉动或传递拉力的拉杆/牵引杆。

definition.en: a rod used to pull, draw, or transmit a pulling force to another part (commonly in machines, valves, brakes, or coupling mechanisms)
definition.zh: （机械等中的）拉杆；牵引杆；用于传递拉力、带动部件运动的杆件

examples.en: The technician replaced the drawrod to restore smooth movement in the mechanism.
examples.zh: 技术员更换了拉杆，使机构运转恢复顺畅。

examples.en: Tighten the drawrod carefully so the valve opens and closes correctly.
examples.zh: 小心拧紧拉杆，确保阀门能正确开启和关闭。

extraExplanation: “drawrod”常见写法也有分开的“draw rod”。在不同工程领域它可能指不同具体部件：例如用于夹紧/拉紧的拉杆、用于阀门联动的连杆，或用于牵引/连接的杆件。理解时重点看它在装置中承担的功能：把“拉力（draw）”传递到“杆（rod）”上再带动其他零件。

summary.en: “Draws” most commonly means “pulls,” “makes a picture,” or “attracts,” as the third-person singular form of “draw.” It can also be the plural noun for “ties” in sports or “lottery drawings.”
summary.zh: “Draws”最常见是动词 draw 的第三人称单数，表示“拉/拖、绘制、吸引、抽取”。也可作名词复数，表示体育比赛的“平局”或“抽奖/开奖”。

definition.en: (third-person singular of “draw”) to make a picture or diagram with a pen, pencil, etc.
definition.zh: （draw 的第三人称单数）画画；绘制（图表等）

examples.en: She draws animals in her notebook.
examples.zh: 她在笔记本里画动物。

examples.en: He draws a simple map for me.
examples.zh: 他给我画了一张简单的地图。

definition.en: (third-person singular of “draw”) to pull something or move it toward yourself or in a particular direction
definition.zh: （draw 的第三人称单数）拉；拖；把……拉向某个方向

examples.en: He draws the curtain closed every night.
examples.zh: 他每天晚上把窗帘拉上。

examples.en: The horse draws the cart along the road.
examples.zh: 马沿着路拉着车走。

definition.en: (third-person singular of “draw”) to attract interest, attention, or people
definition.zh: （draw 的第三人称单数）吸引（注意力/兴趣/人群）

examples.en: The new café draws a lot of students.
examples.zh: 这家新咖啡馆吸引了很多学生。

examples.en: Her story draws everyone’s attention.
examples.zh: 她的故事吸引了所有人的注意。

definition.en: (third-person singular of “draw”) to take something out from inside or to choose something (e.g., a card, a ticket)
definition.zh: （draw 的第三人称单数）抽出；取出；抽取（卡牌、票等）

examples.en: He draws a card from the deck.
examples.zh: 他从牌堆里抽出一张牌。

examples.en: She draws water from the well.
examples.zh: 她从井里打水。

definition.en: (plural noun) games or results that end with no winner; ties
definition.zh: （名词复数）平局；打成平手的比赛/结果

examples.en: This team has three wins and two draws.
examples.zh: 这支队伍有三场胜利和两场平局。

definition.en: (plural noun) events where winners are chosen by picking tickets/numbers at random; lotteries
definition.zh: （名词复数）抽奖；彩票开奖

examples.en: The draws happen every Friday night.
examples.zh: 每周五晚上开奖/抽奖。

extraExplanation: 发音小提示：draws 词尾通常读 /z/（因为前面的音是浊音），听起来像“drɔz”。
动词 draw 的变化：draw → drew（过去式）→ drawn（过去分词）。

summary.en: A drawshave is a hand tool you pull toward yourself to shave wood and shape curves.
summary.zh: drawshave（拉刀）是一种向自己方向拉动来削木、修弧面的木工手工具。

definition.en: a woodworking hand tool with a blade and two handles, pulled toward you to shave (thinly cut) wood and shape curved surfaces
definition.zh: 一种木工手工具，带刀刃和两侧把手，使用时向自己方向拉动，用来削去薄薄木屑并塑造弧面

examples.en: He used a drawshave to shape the chair legs into smooth curves.
examples.zh: 他用拉刀把椅子腿修成光滑的弧形。

examples.en: With a sharp drawshave, you can remove wood quickly but still control the shape.
examples.zh: 拉刀足够锋利时，既能快速去料，也能很好地控制形状。

extraExplanation: “drawshave”也常写作“draw shave”（分开写更常见）。它通常用于制作或修整圆木、弯曲木件，例如弓、独木舟构件、椅子腿、木柄等。
使用时一般把木料固定在“shaving horse（削木凳）”或夹具上；刀刃角度和力度很关键，太大可能“咬”进木头，太小又削不动。

summary.en: A drawsheet (often written “draw sheet”) is a small sheet used to help move or reposition someone in bed.
summary.zh: drawsheet（常写作draw sheet）指护理中用于在床上帮助移动或调整病人体位的移位单/垫单。

definition.en: a small sheet placed across a bed (often under a patient) that can be used to help move, lift, or reposition someone more easily
definition.zh: （护理/医疗中）垫在床上、常放在病人身下的一小块床单，用来更方便地移动、抬起或调整体位

examples.en: The nurse used a drawsheet to help turn the patient safely.
examples.zh: 护士用移位单帮助病人安全地翻身。

examples.en: Place the drawsheet under the patient’s hips and shoulders before repositioning.
examples.zh: 调整体位前，把移位单放在病人的肩部和臀部下方。

extraExplanation: “drawsheet”更常写作分开的形式“draw sheet”。这里的draw不是“画画”，而是“拉/拖动”的意思，强调用这块布来“拉动”病人以便翻身或移位。
在医院或养老护理环境中使用时，常与“reposition (调整体位)”“turn (翻身)”“lift (抬起)”等动词一起出现。

summary.en: A drawspan is the movable part of a bridge that opens to allow boats to pass.
summary.zh: Drawspan指桥梁中可开启的活动桥跨，用于让船只通过。

definition.en: the movable section (span) of a bridge that can be raised, swung, or otherwise opened to let boats pass; a drawbridge span
definition.zh: （桥的）可开启桥跨；可升起/旋转以让船只通过的桥面部分（常指开合桥的活动桥跨）

examples.en: The drawspan opened to let the cargo ship pass through the canal.
examples.zh: 活动桥跨打开，让货船通过运河。

examples.en: Traffic stopped while the drawspan was raised.
examples.zh: 活动桥跨升起时，交通暂停。

extraExplanation: “drawspan”常见于工程、交通与水路管理语境，指桥梁中“可动的那一跨”。在日常口语里，人们更常说drawbridge（开合桥/吊桥），而drawspan更偏技术用词。
发音上也常写作draw-span，强调它是draw（开合）+ span（桥跨）的组合。

summary.en: A drawspring is a pull-back-and-release spring used in locks, guns, and similar mechanisms.
summary.zh: drawspring 指锁具、枪械等机构中通过“拉回再释放”来带动动作的拉簧。

definition.en: a spring (in a lock, gun, or other mechanism) that is pulled back and released to move a part, especially to cock, snap, or fire something
definition.zh: （锁、枪械或其他机械装置中的）拉簧；通过拉回再释放来带动部件动作（如上弦、弹开或击发）的弹簧

examples.en: The old flintlock wouldn’t fire because the drawspring was broken.
examples.zh: 那把老式燧发枪打不响，因为拉簧断了。

examples.en: A weak drawspring can make the mechanism snap more slowly.
examples.zh: 拉簧力量不足会让机构弹动得更慢。

extraExplanation: “drawspring”多见于机械、锁具与早期火器（如燧发枪）的描述中，属于偏专业/较少日常使用的词。现代说明书里更常见的表达是 specific spring name（如 mainspring 主弹簧）或直接说 spring（弹簧）。

summary.en: A drawstop is a control on a pipe organ that you pull out to turn on a specific stop (set of pipes).
summary.zh: drawstop 指管风琴上的音栓拉钮/开关，拉出后可开启某一组音管以改变音色。

definition.en: a knob, tab, or lever on a pipe organ that you pull out (“draw”) to turn on a particular set of pipes (a stop); used to change the organ’s tone and volume
definition.zh: （管风琴的）音栓拉钮／音栓开关：把拉钮“拉出”（draw）以开启某一组音管（stop），用来改变音色与音量

examples.en: The organist pulled a few drawstops to brighten the sound for the hymn.
examples.zh: 风琴师拉出几个音栓拉钮，让赞美诗的音色更明亮。

examples.en: Each drawstop controls a different rank of pipes.
examples.zh: 每个音栓拉钮都控制一组不同的音管。

examples.en: She experimented with the drawstops until the music felt warm and full.
examples.zh: 她不断试不同的音栓拉钮，直到音乐听起来温暖而饱满。

extraExplanation: “Drawstop”常见于管风琴语境：draw（拉出）+ stop（音栓/音列）。在很多管风琴上，这些控制件可能是可以拉出的圆形拉钮，也可能是拨片式的“stop tab”，作用都是选择不同音色（音栓组合也叫 registration）。在英式写法中也常见分开写作“draw stop”。

summary.en: A drawstring is a cord you pull to tighten or close something, often on clothes or bags.
summary.zh: drawstring 指可拉动以收紧或束口的绳子，常见于衣物和束口袋。

definition.en: a string or cord you pull to tighten or close clothing or a bag
definition.zh: （衣物或袋子上的）抽绳；拉绳，用来收紧或束口

examples.en: These sweatpants have a drawstring waist.
examples.zh: 这条运动裤有抽绳腰。

examples.en: Pull the drawstring to close the bag.
examples.zh: 拉一下抽绳把袋口收紧。

extraExplanation: “drawstring”由 draw（拉、牵引）+ string（绳子）组成，字面意思就是“用来拉的绳子”。在服饰与日用品里很常见：hoodie（连帽衫）的帽子抽绳、sweatpants（运动裤）的腰部抽绳、drawstring bag（束口袋）。

summary.en: Drawstrings are cords you pull to tighten or close clothing or bags.
summary.zh: Drawstrings 指用来拉紧或收口的抽绳，常见于衣物或袋子上。

definition.en: Strings or cords used to tighten or close something by pulling (often found in clothing like hoodies, sweatpants, or bags).
definition.zh: 用于拉紧或收口的绳子/抽绳（常见于连帽衫、运动裤或袋子上）。

examples.en: My hoodie’s drawstrings are too long, so I tied them in a knot.
examples.zh: 我连帽衫的抽绳太长了，所以我把它打了个结。

examples.en: Pull the drawstrings to close the bag securely.
examples.zh: 拉紧抽绳，把袋子牢牢收口。

definition.en: In finance (less common), the amount of money a bank has committed to lend and a borrower has taken/used (usually written as “drawdowns” or “drawn funds,” but “drawstrings” may appear in informal talk).
definition.zh: （较少见/非正式）在金融语境中，指已被借款人提取/动用的贷款额度（更常见写法是 drawdowns / drawn funds）。

examples.en: We tracked the project’s loan drawdowns month by month.
examples.zh: 我们按月跟踪项目贷款的提取金额。

extraExplanation: “drawstring”来自“draw（拉）+ string（绳子）”。日常最常见的是衣物（hoodie、sweatpants）或收纳袋（drawstring bag）上的抽绳。
英文里更常用单数形式来表示这种结构：a drawstring / a drawstring bag；复数 drawstrings 常指“有两根绳子”或“多处抽绳”。

summary.en: Drawtongs are long tongs used by blacksmiths to hold and pull hot metal while shaping it.
summary.zh: Drawtongs 指铁匠用于夹持并抽拉高温金属、方便锻造延展的长柄钳。

definition.en: long-handled tongs used (especially by blacksmiths) to hold and pull hot metal while it is being drawn out or shaped
definition.zh: （尤指铁匠用的）抽拉钳；用于夹持并拉动加热的金属，便于延展或锻造成形的长柄钳

examples.en: The blacksmith grabbed the glowing bar with drawtongs and pulled it to the anvil.
examples.zh: 铁匠用抽拉钳夹住发红的铁条，把它拉到铁砧上。

examples.en: Use drawtongs to keep your hands away from the heat while drawing out the steel.
examples.zh: 延展钢材时用抽拉钳，能让你的手远离高温。

extraExplanation: “drawtongs”多见于锻造/冶金语境；其中 draw 指“把金属拉长、抽伸（draw out）”，tongs 指“夹钳”。在现代英语里也常写作分开的形式“draw tongs”，属于较专业的工具名称。

summary.en: A drawtube is a sliding tube in a telescope or microscope used for focusing or positioning an eyepiece/camera.
summary.zh: drawtube 指望远镜或显微镜中用于对焦或调整目镜/相机位置的伸缩调焦筒。

definition.en: a sliding tube in an optical instrument (especially a telescope or microscope) that moves in and out to help focus or adjust the position of an eyepiece or camera.
definition.zh: （光学仪器中，尤指望远镜或显微镜的）伸缩调焦筒；通过前后滑动来帮助对焦或调整目镜/相机位置的管状部件。

examples.en: Turn the focusing knob until the drawtube extends and the image becomes sharp.
examples.zh: 转动调焦旋钮，让调焦筒伸出，直到画面变清晰。

examples.en: The camera needs more back focus, so I racked the drawtube farther out.
examples.zh: 相机需要更长的后焦距，所以我把调焦筒再向外推出一些。

extraExplanation: “drawtube”在器材圈里也常写作“draw tube”或“draw-tube”。多见于天文望远镜的调焦器（focuser）部分：你会看到它与“rack in / rack out（推进/拉出）”等动词搭配使用。

summary.en: Drawtubes can mean a lathe collet-closing tube (machining) or tubes made by metal drawing (“drawn tubes”).
summary.zh: drawtubes可指机加工中用于拉紧夹头的拉管，也可指拉拔工艺制成的管材（拉拔管/冷拉管）。

definition.en: (Machining) a tube or hollow rod in a lathe or collet chuck that pulls (draws) the collet closed to grip a workpiece.
definition.zh: （机加工）车床或夹头卡盘上的“拉管/拉杆管”，用于拉动夹头收紧，从而夹紧工件。

examples.en: The technician replaced the drawtube because the collet wouldn’t tighten evenly.
examples.zh: 技术员更换了拉管，因为夹头无法均匀收紧。

examples.en: Make sure the drawtube threads are clean before installing a new collet.
examples.zh: 安装新夹头前，先确保拉管螺纹干净。

definition.en: (Manufacturing) tubes made by drawing metal through a die to reduce diameter and improve precision; often called “drawn tubes.”
definition.zh: （制造业）通过“拉拔”工艺把金属管拉过模具以减小直径、提高精度的管材；常称为“拉拔管/冷拉管（drawn tubes）”。

examples.en: The project needs stainless steel drawn tubes for tight tolerances.
examples.zh: 这个项目需要高精度的不锈钢拉拔管。

examples.en: Drawn tubes are often used in hydraulic systems and precision frames.
examples.zh: 拉拔管常用于液压系统和精密结构件。

extraExplanation: “drawtube”在机加工里很常见，常出现在“collet（夹头）+ drawtube（拉管）”结构中：旋转或拉动drawtube→夹头被拉紧→工件被夹住。不同机型可能也叫drawbar（拉杆）。
如果你看到的是“drawtubes”，通常只是复数形式；若语境是材料采购/规格表，更可能指“drawn tubes（拉拔管）”。

summary.en: A dray is a sturdy cart or flatbed truck for heavy loads, especially barrels; it can also mean to transport goods by such a vehicle.
summary.zh: dray 指运重物的结实平板车/运货车（常运酒桶等）；也可作动词，表示用这种车运输。

definition.en: a low, strong cart or flatbed truck used for carrying heavy goods, especially barrels or large loads (often in breweries or docks)
definition.zh: （运送重物的）矮而结实的运货车；（尤指）啤酒厂/码头用的平板车（常用于运酒桶等）

examples.en: The brewery loaded the kegs onto a dray and sent them across town.
examples.zh: 啤酒厂把酒桶装上运货车，运到城里另一头。

examples.en: In old photos, you can see horse-drawn drays delivering goods to shops.
examples.zh: 在老照片里，你能看到马拉的运货车把货物送到商店。

definition.en: to carry or deliver goods using a dray (or in the manner of a dray)
definition.zh: 用运货车运输；（像运货车那样）运送（货物）

examples.en: They drayed barrels from the dock to the warehouse.
examples.zh: 他们把酒桶从码头用车运到仓库。

extraExplanation: “dray”常见于英式或历史语境，和啤酒厂运送酒桶的场景联系紧密；现代英语里更多会用“truck / flatbed truck / cart”。在一些城市节庆或啤酒品牌宣传中，你可能会看到“horse-drawn dray（马拉运货车）”作为传统元素出现。

summary.en: Drayage means short-distance freight transport, especially trucking between ports/rail terminals and nearby facilities.
summary.zh: Drayage 指短途货运接驳运输，尤指港口/铁路货场与附近设施之间的卡车运输。

definition.en: the transport of goods over a short distance, especially by truck, often between a port/rail terminal and a warehouse or distribution center
definition.zh: （尤指用卡车进行的）短途货物运输，常指在港口/铁路货场与仓库或配送中心之间的接驳运输

examples.en: The importer paid extra for drayage from the port to the warehouse.
examples.zh: 进口商为从港口到仓库的短途接驳运输额外付费。

examples.en: Drayage delays can happen when there are long lines of trucks at the terminal.
examples.zh: 当货场卡车排队很长时，短途接驳运输可能会延误。

definition.en: to transport goods a short distance, especially by truck
definition.zh: （尤指用卡车）进行短途运输/接驳运输

examples.en: They drayage containers from the rail yard to local distribution centers.
examples.zh: 他们把集装箱从铁路货场短途运输到本地配送中心。

extraExplanation: “Drayage”常见于物流与国际贸易文件（如运费报价、账单、港口费用清单）。它通常不指“长途干线运输”，而是“最后一小段/第一小段”的接驳环节，和“port trucking（港口卡车运输）”“intermodal（多式联运）”语境高度相关。词源与早期用来拉货的“dray（重型货车/搬运车）”有关。

summary.en: Drayage means short-distance freight transport, especially by truck between a port or rail terminal and a nearby facility.
summary.zh: drayage 指短途货运，尤指港口/铁路货场与附近仓库等设施之间的卡车转运。

definition.en: the transport of goods over a short distance, especially by truck between a seaport/rail terminal and a nearby warehouse or distribution center (often as one stage of a longer shipment)
definition.zh: 短途货运；（尤指）港口/铁路货场与附近仓库或配送中心之间的短距离卡车运输（通常是长途运输中的一环）

examples.en: The invoice includes ocean freight and drayage from the port to the warehouse.
examples.zh: 这张账单包含海运费以及从港口到仓库的短途拖运费。

examples.en: Because of congestion, drayage delays at the terminal affected deliveries all week.
examples.zh: 由于拥堵，货场的短途拖运延误影响了整周的送货。

extraExplanation: “drayage”常见于物流/国际贸易语境，和集装箱运输关系密切：货物可能先海运到港口，再由卡车进行drayage到内陆仓库，然后继续配送。
词源与“dray”（旧时指运货的低平车/大车）有关，因此带有“拖运、短程转运”的含义。

summary.en: Drayden is a modern English-language personal name, most often used as a male first name.
summary.zh: Drayden 是一种现代英语人名，多用作男性名字。

definition.en: a given name (first name), usually male, and sometimes a family name (surname). It is used mainly in English-speaking countries and is often chosen for its modern sound rather than a fixed dictionary meaning.
definition.zh: 人名（多为男性名字），有时也可作姓氏。主要见于英语国家，更多是因发音现代感而被选用，而非有固定的词典释义。

examples.en: Drayden starts kindergarten this fall.
examples.zh: Drayden 今年秋天开始上幼儿园。

examples.en: My coworker Drayden is from Arizona.
examples.zh: 我的同事 Drayden 来自亚利桑那州。

extraExplanation: “Drayden”通常被视为现代英语取名（modern name）。它并不像“Michael / John”那样有明确的圣经或传统词源解释；不少家长是因为它的读音、拼写和独特性而选择。
常见的相近拼写有 Draden、Drayden、Draydon 等；在英文环境里，拼写会影响他人是否能一次写对，因此有时会在自我介绍时补充拼写。

summary.en: “Drayed” means “hauled/transported by a dray (heavy cart),” and is the past form of “dray.”
summary.zh: “drayed”是“dray”的过去式/过去分词，表示“用载重车（大车）拖运、运送（重物）”。

definition.en: (past tense / past participle of dray) to transport or haul goods in a dray (a low, strong cart or wagon), especially for heavy loads.
definition.zh: （dray 的过去式/过去分词）用（载重用的）平板车/大车运送或拖运货物，尤指重物。

examples.en: The barrels were drayed from the dock to the warehouse.
examples.zh: 这些桶被用大车从码头拖运到仓库。

examples.en: In the old days, beer was often drayed through city streets in wooden casks.
examples.zh: 过去，啤酒常装在木桶里，用大车穿过城市街道运送。

definition.en: (less common) to move or haul something slowly and heavily, as if by a cart.
definition.zh: （较少见）缓慢而费力地拖拽或搬运（像用车拖运一样）。

examples.en: They drayed the broken machine across the yard.
examples.zh: 他们把坏掉的机器费力地拖过院子。

extraExplanation: “dray”指一种低矮、结实、用于搬运重物的车，常见于港口、酿酒厂、仓库等场景；因此“drayed”多出现在较历史化或行业语境（如旧时报刊、城市运输、港口装卸）里。
在现代日常英语里，人们更常说 “hauled / carted / trucked”。如果你在文学或历史叙述中看到“drayed”，通常是在营造旧式城市运输的画面感。

summary.en: A drayhorse is a strong horse used to pull heavy carts for hauling goods.
summary.zh: drayhorse 指用于拉运重货车、搬运货物的强壮挽马。

definition.en: a strong draft horse used for pulling a dray (a heavy cart or wagon), especially for hauling goods in towns or to/from docks
definition.zh: （尤指在城镇或码头附近）拉运重货车（dray，重型货车/货运马车）的挽马、驮运马

examples.en: In the old days, a drayhorse hauled barrels from the brewery to local pubs.
examples.zh: 过去，drayhorse 会把啤酒厂的桶装啤酒拉到当地酒馆。

examples.en: The museum displayed a harness made for a drayhorse.
examples.zh: 博物馆展出了给 drayhorse 用的马具。

examples.en: The drayhorse moved slowly but steadily under the heavy load.
examples.zh: drayhorse 在重载下走得慢，但很稳。

extraExplanation: “drayhorse”也常写作“dray horse”。“dray”原指一种没有侧板或侧板很低的重型货车，常用于短距离运货（例如码头、仓库、酒厂之间）。因此 drayhorse 通常指在城市运输体系里负责“拉重货”的马。
在英国文化里，drayhorse 常让人联想到传统啤酒厂的送酒马车（运送啤酒桶）；在现代多为历史、博物馆或文学描写中出现。

summary.en: “Draying” means hauling or transporting goods by a dray (a heavy cart), a word mainly used in historical or specialized contexts.
summary.zh: “draying”指用平板重载车（dray）短途运货，主要见于历史或特定行业语境。

definition.en: (Present participle of “dray”) transporting goods by a dray (a low, strong cart), often pulled by a horse or used for short-distance hauling.
definition.zh: （“dray”的现在分词）用平板重载车（dray，一种低而结实的运货车）运输货物，常用于短途搬运（过去多为马拉）。

examples.en: In the 1800s, workers were draying barrels from the dock to nearby warehouses.
examples.zh: 在19世纪，工人们把一桶桶货物从码头用运货车短途运到附近的仓库。

examples.en: The company spent the morning draying kegs across town.
examples.zh: 公司整个上午都在用运货车把啤酒桶运到城里。

extraExplanation: “draying”在现代英语中很少见，多出现在历史/行业语境（如旧时港口、酒厂把桶装货物短途运输）。

很多学习者输入“draying”其实想写的是：
- “drying” /ˈdraɪɪŋ/（变干；晾干）
- “drawing” /ˈdrɔɪŋ/ 或 /ˈdrɑːɪŋ/（画画；拉、抽；吸引）
如果你告诉我你想表达的句子，我可以帮你选对词。

summary.en: A drayman is a (somewhat old-fashioned) driver who delivers heavy goods on a dray, often linked to breweries and local deliveries.
summary.zh: drayman 指（较旧式的）赶货车/配送重货的人，常与啤酒厂和本地短途运送有关。

definition.en: a person whose job is to drive a dray (a strong, low cart or truck) to carry heavy goods, especially for local delivery (e.g., beer barrels).
definition.zh: （旧时）赶大车/货车的人；用（低矮结实的）搬运车或卡车运送重货的工人（常指本地配送，如啤酒桶）。

examples.en: A drayman delivered kegs from the brewery to the pub every morning.
examples.zh: 每天早上都有一位赶货车的人把啤酒厂的啤酒桶送到酒吧。

examples.en: In old city photos, you can sometimes see a drayman standing beside a horse-drawn cart.
examples.zh: 在一些老城市照片里，你有时能看到赶车人站在马拉货车旁边。

extraExplanation: “drayman”带有明显的历史感：19世纪到20世纪初在英美城市里常见，尤其与啤酒厂、港口、仓库的短途运输有关。随着机动卡车与现代物流发展，这个词在当代更偏“历史/文学/行业传统用语”。
词根来自“dray”（低矮、结实、用于载重的车），因此drayman强调的是“拉运重货的配送司机/搬运工”，而不只是一般的“driver”。

summary.en: “Draymen” means men who drove heavy-goods carts (drays), especially in historical contexts.
summary.zh: “draymen”指（多见于历史语境中）驾驶载重车运送货物的车夫/运货工。

definition.en: men whose job is to drive a dray (a low, strong cart or wagon) to carry heavy goods, especially in the past
definition.zh: （尤指过去）驾驶“dray”（低矮结实的载重车/货运马车）运输重物的男人；运货车夫

examples.en: In the 1800s, draymen delivered barrels from the docks to local taverns.
examples.zh: 在19世纪，运货车夫把码头上的桶装货物送到当地酒馆。

examples.en: The brewery hired draymen to move heavy casks through the city streets.
examples.zh: 这家啤酒厂雇运货车夫把沉重的酒桶穿过城市街道运走。

extraExplanation: “draymen”是“drayman”的复数形式。dray 指一种低矮、结实、常用于短距离搬运重物的车（早期多为马拉），常见于港口、仓库、啤酒厂等场景。
这个词带有明显的历史感：在现代英语里更常用的说法是 delivery drivers（送货司机）、truck drivers（卡车司机）或 freight haulers（货运工/承运人），具体看语境。
在旧式城市生活或历史小说中，draymen 往往和码头（docks）、货栈（warehouses）、酒桶/木桶（casks, barrels）等意象一起出现，用来营造工业化早期的氛围。

summary.en: “Drays” most commonly means heavy carts/wagons for hauling goods (plural of dray). It can also be a rare verb form meaning to haul goods.
summary.zh: “drays”最常见的意思是用于搬运货物的结实低矮运货车（dray 的复数）；也可作较少见的动词形式，表示搬运。

definition.en: Plural of “dray”: a strong, low cart or wagon (often without sides) used for carrying heavy loads, traditionally pulled by horses.
definition.zh: “dray”的复数：一种结实、低矮的运货车（常无车厢侧板），用于搬运重物，传统上由马拉。

examples.en: In old photos, you can see drays delivering barrels to the brewery.
examples.zh: 在老照片里，你能看到运货车把桶装货物送到啤酒厂。

examples.en: The street was blocked by drays loaded with timber.
examples.zh: 街道被装满木材的运货车堵住了。

definition.en: Third-person singular form of “dray” (rare): to transport or haul goods using a dray or in a similar heavy, laboring way.
definition.zh: “dray”的第三人称单数（较少见）：用运货车搬运；或以类似费力搬运的方式运送货物。

examples.en: He drays supplies from the dock to the warehouse.
examples.zh: 他把补给品从码头运到仓库。

extraExplanation: “dray”常见于英美早期城市与港口运输语境，尤其和啤酒厂（brewery）或码头（dock）有关：例如“dray horse”（拉运货车的马）。现代英语中更多出现在历史叙述、文学描写或复古场景里。

summary.en: “Drayton” is most commonly a surname and also a place name for various towns.
summary.zh: “Drayton”最常见作姓氏，也可作多个城镇/村庄的地名。

definition.en: a family name (surname).
definition.zh: （常见的）姓氏：德雷顿。

examples.en: One of my professors is Drayton.
examples.zh: 我的一位教授姓德雷顿。

examples.en: The email was signed, “Sincerely, Drayton.”
examples.zh: 邮件落款是：“此致，德雷顿。”

definition.en: a place name used for several towns and villages, especially in the UK and in English-speaking countries.
definition.zh: 地名：德雷顿（用于多个城镇/村庄名称，尤见于英国及其他英语国家）。

examples.en: She grew up in Drayton, England.
examples.zh: 她在英国的德雷顿长大。

examples.en: Drayton is marked on the map just north of the river.
examples.zh: 地图上德雷顿标在河流以北。

extraExplanation: “Drayton”在英国地名中很常见，许多此类地名源自古英语词根：-ton 来自 *tūn*，意为“农庄/聚落”；前半部分常与 *dræg*（与拖拽、搬运有关的地点，如拖船或陆上转运处）相关，因此整体大致可理解为“与拖运/转运有关的聚落”。不同地区的“Drayton”具体来源可能略有差异。

summary.en: “Drazel” isn’t a standard English vocabulary word; it’s likely a misspelling (often of “dazzle” or “drizzle”) or a proper name.
summary.zh: “drazel”不是标准英语词汇；很可能是拼写错误（常见指“dazzle”或“drizzle”）或专有名词。

definition.en: Not a standard English word; it is most likely a misspelling of another word (commonly “dazzle” or “drizzle”) or a proper name (surname/brand/fictional name).
definition.zh: 不是标准英语单词；更可能是其他词的拼写错误（常见为“dazzle”或“drizzle”），或是专有名词（姓氏/品牌/虚构名字）。

examples.en: I can’t find “drazel” in a standard dictionary—did you mean “dazzle” or “drizzle”?
examples.zh: 我在常见词典里找不到“drazel”——你是想写“dazzle（使眼花缭乱）”还是“drizzle（毛毛雨）”吗？
